description:
Oh my gosh seriously some of the best Macarons I've ever had tasted. The Macarons are on the soft chewy side, and I am one of the rare people that like that texture, but if you like your Macarons on the traditional side of crunchy on the outside and then chewy while you're chewing, these may not be for you. I love their vanilla bean and raspberry flavor. My husband liked the Pistachio and Caramel flavor. 


I think on week days their Macarons are on sale for happy hours :)
author: Jenn H.

description:
Be proud of me! I bypassed ALL of the temptations-- and trust me there are plenty-- to get to the cupcake counter. 

That's it, that's what I wanted and boy did it blow my mind! I usually "buy the bar" but I resisted! Lol! 

Not only are their cupcakes beautiful, they're moist and delicious also! 

For me, the Miette cupcake embodies EVERY BIT of the cupcake Kristen Wiig (aka Annie) made for herself and then devoured on Bridesmaids. It's totally the doppelgänger (with a minimalist spin) and exactly how I imagine it tasted while watching that scene. It's dainty, carefully iced, and has a tiny confectionery flower and petal. 

Sorry, this is how my mind works and needless to say, I loved it! 

The staff was kind and readily available to answer questions. The store is beautifully set up and offered a million and one options for your sweet-tooth sans their ice cream sandwiches as the freezer was broken. Their was a fellow running maintenance on it during my visit. 

Miette is adorable, yummy, and a must visit when floating through the Hayes Valley area!
author: Juliet H.

description:
Way too expensive but the licorice and the Graham cracker cookies were absolutely delicious. I've never had such a buttery Graham cracker. 

There are more licorice candies than you can ask for if you like licorice and they let you sample one item.
author: Lana B.

description: It was my first time at Miette and it certainly won't be the last. The shop has a good variety of candy and chocolates, plus cakes and macarons. I only wish they had a slightly greater selection of macarons but they more than made up for it with their macaron happy hour. They go for $1 during their last business hour
author: Sue G.

description:
I've always walked by this place but I finally had time and came in to get something the other week.

* Creme Fraiche Ice Cream Sandwich ($5) - 4 stars
Graham cracker cookies were the perfect softness to go with the ice cream. My boyfriend found the Creme Fraiche flavor too tart, but I thought it was great!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Beautiful shop !!
Hopped in for spring treats .
Wonderful selection & staff so kind and welcoming .
They were on Chestnut Street , years ago , that location , I loved the interiors , omg
The wall paper was gorgeous!
This shop , I think the first location , colors also so appealing .
Love the candy , cakes , cookies .
Reading others reviews , had no idea about happy hour , so fun .
Love buying sweet gifts at Xmas & For spring .
They have such lovely stuff .
The prepared Easter baskets , so nice , priced very fairly , $ 35 dollars and includes a satin bow .
I wish they had , possibly made larger ones , or a hamper basket . 
But I def found high quality goods , to make my own . 
Fun shop , busy bustling hood .
Shop looks like a movie set , just a perfect 
Sweet shoppe !!!
Check it out :)
author: Ellie O.

description:
Miette is my favorite sweet stop in San Francisco! I originally stopped at their store at the Ferry Building but I stumbled upon this location when I was in Hayes Valley. Their macaroons are so decadent and delicate that I can never resist buying at least one! The rose and hazelnut are always great choices.

I also love their selection of sour candy and gumballs shaped like tennis balls. So adorable! Highly recommend to come here if you're looking for a small treat for a gal pal or yourself! While it's on the expensive side, I think Miette has way more character and charm than Sugarfina.
author: Megan K.

description: I come here often to get their shortbread cookies. They are pricy but so far the best I have found in the area. Since everything here looks prepackaged, I wish they would offer more samples. Their cupcakes are pretty to look at but pretty dry and overly sweet.
author: Diane Z.

description: I love a lot of things at Miette. There are so many goodies here to satisfy any sweet tooth, but I LOVED their macarons. They're not your typical macaron, they're chewy and almost bread-y / dense, giving you more to hang on to than just a normal macaron. I'm not sure if macarons are supposed to be like this but I fell in love with it and I'll probably buy one (they're $2 each!) every time I pass by.
author: Charmaine L.

description: Well I love their candy but I ordered a a Tomboy cake for a special occasion and it was NOT fresh. Really disappointing
author: Piper W.

description:
Context: I had this at my friend's birthday party. I purchased neither the cake nor cupcakes.

I'm a committed cake lover. It's one of the reasons I exercise -- so I can eat a ton of cake in times like these. I'm only half joking... 

Upsides: The white icing was delicious and fluffy. It was lightly sweetened and quite delicate on the palette. Loved this part of the cake completely. 

Downsides: The lemon curd was way too sweet. It was aggressive and masked the white icing flavor and cake itself. I was not a fan of this intermediate layer. In addition, the cake was so dry! I'm thinking it's because my friend had purchased the cake earlier that day and we were celebrating at night but even so....if it was baked the same day the cake would not have been that dry. My guess is that they were selling older, less fresh cakes from the back...? I'm not entirely sure, but I'm just putting my honest review forward about this place's product. 

I'd like to give this place another shot, since it seems like most reviews are positive.
author: Julia Y.

description: I have been wanting to visit miette for the longest, but reside in Miami. Couldn't believe this was located so close to where I was staying. The unique piece about their macaron is the in house ground almonds that add such a beautiful texture to these classic beauties. The flavors are wonderful, and oh man the gingerbread cupcake is perfection. Went back consecutive days !
author: Ashley M.

description: It's all about happy hour! One hour before closing, macarons are just $1! Personal fave so far is hazelnut. These aren't as sweet as other macarons I've tried. They are baked well, with a great crunch in the shell and a gooey center filling.
author: Lexi R.

description:
This was a nice candy shop I found while walking around Hayes Street. It was a small shop on the side of the street with a little bit of outside seating. They have a lot of unique candies available. At the register, they have a few baked goods and some macaroons in jars. The macaroons didn't look like any I had seen, but the cupcakes looked good.

I ended up grabbing some Turkish candies and jelly beans. They have a large amounts of candies by the pound, but you can get half pounds or quarter pounds, which is what I got .

It was a wee bit of expensive for what you got, but I enjoyed the variety of candies.
author: Alanna T.

description:
REVIEWER # 663

I didn't know cupcakes and macaroons could taste so moist and delicious until I found this hidden gem in San Francisco! Miette Patisserie is well known for their macaroon and tasty cupcakes. The macaroon selection is off the charts and soft and delish!

They also have a large variety of cupcakes and regular cakes as well! BIRTHDAY PARTIES ANYONE?? Well this is the place! They also have small bags of candy that can be given as gifts or prizes for a work event. The options of those little bags range from: gummies,
chocolates, licorice and marzipan.

All of the delicious items are packages so cute and presentable in the cutest branded bags.
 
DID YOU KNOW: They even have a cookbook that has all the recipes and the photos entice you to want to own your own bakery and make all the delicious cakes./cupcakes!

I've tasted their chocolate cupcakes and fell in love!! Now...this is surprising because I am not a chocolate person at all! However, taking my first bite at the cupcake and tasting that delicious buttercream icing!! OMGGGG! Words can't even describe my first taste! 

HAPPY HOUR!! Yes, you guessed it! This place has a happy hour and during that time the prices on the macaroons and cupcakes are at a sweet deal! Macaroons are only a $1 and the cupcakes are 2 for $5! OMG, does it get any better??

Definitely a place to check out when in the San Francisco Hayes Valley area! Treat yourself to something sweet and delicious, especially during happy hour!

REVIEW 120/196
author: Porsche C.

description: Adorable candy and cake shop in Hayes Valley. Go in and check out all the different candies and chocolates! I personally was excited about the sour candy selection - put together a little bag of sour tape (mango, pink lemonade, cherry, strawberry) and was happy! Candy can be purchased by the pound. The cakes looked lovely too!
author: Deepa K.

description:
I can RAVE about everything Miette...for sure, but I'm going for the jugular and I'm not going to make the baker's happy, but here goes: 

BANANA CREAM TART...mmm...mmm...the BEST!!! They use to have this available daily but for whatever reason stopped. I called them last week and BEGGED...please make it for me...please...please. I was going to Lake Tahoe and wanted to bring it to our host.

No one in the entire San Francisco Bay Area makes anything like this. Baker starts with a crust that is like a fresh butter cookie...(not the usual flaky crust), then spreads a thin layer of dark chocolate to cover the crust...follows that with fresh sliced bananas and the best ever cream. As if that is not enough...they top it with real fresh whip cream and spread dark chocolate shavings all over.

It's what you expect when you get to heaven. I wish they would put it back on the daily mix. Oh, well...did I get a piece??? Sure, on Sunday morning the host and I grabbed to spoons and sat on the deck over the lake and went to town. 

Thanks for a slice of heaven Miette...Nancy!!!!
author: Sandy R.

description:
We decided to pick up a cake here, we chose the Vanilla Tomboy Cake. The cake was dense like a chocolate brownie almost, but really good and not to sweet. Everyone in the household loved it. There candies are $5 for a little bag, but totally worth it in my sweet tooth opinion.

Much love,

Canadian Tourist
author: Sally W.

description: This place makes me weak at the knees. It's filled to the brim with all sorts of sweets and confectionary goodness. They have a bunch of macaron flavors. None of them colored in an outrageous, artificial color. They look very natural. I recommend coming for their "happy hour" when each are $1. Otherwise, they are $2 each. I've picked up a cake here on several occasions without any advance notice. There's usually several to choose from. The gingerbread cake is really flavorful and dense. The strawberry tomboy (chocolate cake with strawberry frosting) was delicious. Very simple, elegant look. The cream is buttery and silky. Never cream cheese frosting. I've also been gifted some cupcakes from here. Love the old fashioned cupcake. I'm also a fan of the turkish delight, of which they have several flavors including rose. This place never fails me when someone's birthday or with holidays coming up.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Cute famous shop in Hayes valley (there's one in the ferry building too). They have various macaroon flavors along with tons of candies, chocolates and their very own published pastry cookbook. The prices are a little high for the small amount you get, but at the same time, get something unique and you'll find it's worth the money. For example get a small $5 bag of rose champagne flavored gummies. So good and different than ordinary gummies! Plus who doesn't like champagne?
author: Lilian N.

description: I was out of town but still wanted to do something for a friend's birthday so I ordered cupcakes on Postmates to be delivered. They were packaged beautifully and looked delicious!! Thank you so much!!
author: Kim L.

description:
A not-so-secret secret about me... I LOVE candy. I mean, really adore it. Sure, it's bad for my teeth, not to mention my waistline, but who cares? Like the soap operas say you've only got one life to live and these are the days of our lives. I particularly like trying new candies and having old vintage classics. Also, when someone makes their own kind of sweet treats like cookies and ice cream sandwiches it makes me even happier. And so when I stepped foot into Miette my dentist cried a little and I got down to business.

I peeked into every basket, every jar, every bowl and pulled out treat after treat. I bought chocolate in the shape of cars and sharks for my children, fancy chocolate with sea salt and ginger for my husband, and such a wide assortment of things for myself I'm ashamed to list them all. But guess what? The gal working there was so kind she didn't even blink an eye as my candy piled up. She just totaled the amount, put my goodies in a cute, pink bag, and wished me well on my way.

It was a delightful experience, one I'm excited to repeat the next time I found myself in town, and one I remember fondly every time I eat one of my sweets from the store.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
This place is a dream. A toffee stuffed, chocolate infused, sugar covered dream. 

I mean, what can I say? Miette is lovely and full of candy and confections. Are they pricey? Yes. Is it worth it? Hell yes. 

Some faves of mine:
1) The sugar/chocolate/toffee almonds. Holy hell these powdered sugar almonds look innocuous, but they are way more interesting and delightful than expected. 

2) Fun animal chocolates: These aren't the fanciest chocolates, but they are perfect for kiddos. My girls loved the tiger and the lady bugs. So cute and an affordable treat. 

3) Chocolate wafers: light and delightful! They go down way too easily and quickly...kind of like Pringles...but chocolate...and so much better. 

4) Toffee: incredible with the perfect amount of chocolate/toffee/nut balance. 

Miette, you are what my dreams are made of.
author: Nicole W.

description:
If you have a sweet tooth, this is your paradise, nothing but sweets galore.

Staff was very friendly and helpful. Store was clean and so adorable! They had everything from chocolates to hard candy, even pastries. Macarons were definitely my favorite here. Prices are a little bit high but still a good stop. 

I can't wait for my next trip to San Francisco, I know where I'm stopping first!
author: Brenda C.

description:
I fell in LOVE. Sugar heaven. So many types of candy and sweets. They're on the pricier end but I think its worth it. From different brands and types from all over the world. I didn't even want to leave, felt like a kid again. The embarcadero location doesn't even compare. My first visit was this past weekend and believe to be the cutest candy store ever. So full of colors. And the staff was super friendly.

Happy Hour macarons are half off. 4-6pm, 1 dollar each. Cheers to that!!
author: Sandy B.

description: I had a variety of their cupcakes. I must say I find their frosting not too sweet which I like. The cake itself is moist and rich.
author: Lena M.

description:
A candy land for the young and adults.
As you walk up to the store front with pale pink awning, I feel like I am Alice in Wonderland. The store is beautiful displaying a bygone era of the 1800's, the staff all dressed with vests and bow ties and are all good looking and professional.

I was in amazement at each display with Bon bons, marzipan cakes, French macaroons, candies that are essentially unique.  You want to buy every candy but not eat them because they are so pretty.

I bought macaroons and oh my, I was in seventh heaven.

A must stop for the locals and the tourist.  This shop is uber photogenic inside and out.
author: Maria P.

description:
Cute. Pink. Sweet. Girly. Nostalgic. These are thoughts that come to mind when I step inside.

Kind. Sweet. Thankful. These are thoughts that come to mind when your co worker surprises you with treats.  

Love those just because moments... should I tell him I'm not a fan of macarons?
author: Linda N.

description: Cute place for anyone with a sweet tooth!! They have a large selection of candies and chocolates at the front of the store. There's a variety of gummy candies, sour candies, sour gummy candies, chocolates, mint chocolates, caramels, etc. They had something interesting called mint lentils too.. think of Holland mints, except they're in the shape of lentils!! Eating one of those lentils is like a mint bomb in your mouth!! If you're searching for retro candies, they have some of those too, like Bit-O-Honey. Towards the back they have a showcase with cakes and macaroons. What I love about Miette is that they don't put coloring in their macaroons, which a lot of other bakeries do.
author: Aimee I.

description: Their chocolate wafer cookies are one of my mum and mine's absolute favorites. They're wonderfully crisp with a light sweetness and a dark chocolate bitterness which makes them a delicious standout from most biscuits.  I bought their cookbook specifically so I could make them after I moved away, and pick up a couple containers of em every time I'm lucky enough to be back visiting.
author: O S.

description: Beautiful shop. Wonderful service. Helpful salespeople. Was overloaded with the beautiful color, dazzling glass jars and tons of choices. Their cupcakes were super yummy and the macaroons were delightful. I will be back! I was pleasantly surprised after a bad experience at a another macaroon place around the corner.
author: Chocolate C.

description:
I have been smitten with Miette every since I laid eyes on her in the ferry building and tasted her decadent yet subtle treats.

This iteration is no less than the ferry building location and in fact  has more to offer. Candies, cupcakes, macarons, and other cute things.

Go for the chocolate tomboy cake for 6 and you will not be let down.
author: David G.

description:
Cutest little candy shop across the grassy area from Smitten Ice Cream! I walked in here and was totally delighted with the selection of candies, chocolates, pastries..all wrapped in the most adorable baggies +Miette stickers.

i came here for the TomBoy cake since it was listed as a 7x7 Best Birthday Cakes in SF article. They only had chocolate on the day I went, so I was a bit disappointed. The cakes are super cute and though they look small, the chocolate was very decadent and plenty for 8 people. I thought the cake itself was on the dry side, but I liked how it wasn't too sweet.

Besides the cake, they have a delightful selection of macarons, candy, chocolate, cupcakes, toffee, and shortbread...everything looked amazing and if I hadn't come with a specific mission and only 20 minutes in the meter, I probably would've emptied my bank account here.

Loveee love this place and how cute everything is. I'll definitely be back for the toffee and cupcakes!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
4 stars for the macarons. They're delicious!
2 stars for my most recent service. (12/18/17)

The reviews here give a lot of conflicting information regarding their Happy Hour. The Miette's website gives no information, so I'll just write in my review the most up to date info, as far as I'm aware. I've read in reviews here that the Happy Hour was no longer occurring, was from 4-6, 5-7, etc. I've also read that there was no limit, had a limit of 6, etc. My first visit was in November of this year, I called ahead and asked if they still had a Happy Hour for their macarons. The woman on the phone told me that they do still have a Happy Hour, from 6-7 on weekdays. I pick up 6 macarons that evening. My second trip in December I go in and pick up 24 macarons. The lady charges me $12, so I assume the Yelp photo stating there's a limit of 6 was wrong and that perhaps there's no limit. I go in for my third visit on December 18th, and was about to pick up two 16-count boxes of macarons. I am told by one of the guys there, "You know about our limit right?" I tell him, "Yes, I've heard something about the limit on Yelp (assumed it was 6). But the last time I came in, I got more than what I thought the limit was. So I wasn't sure if there still was a limit. But I'm happy to pay the normal price for the macarons that goes after the limit." The guy, who I'm assuming is the manager, responds in a very catty tone, "Well, I'm going to need to know when you came in and who you talked to because if someone is bending the rules..." I completely understand from a managerial standpoint you want to know who has not been following the rules. But also understand, that those discussions should happen internally between you and your employees. I should not be berated by a manager, who for one, I don't work for and for a mistake that another person made. I already let you know that I was willing to pay the normal cost. I'm not trying to make trouble here, I just came here to buy some adorably small cookies, not get yelled at by a grumpy manager.

For the future, Miette, I recommend being more transparent about your Happy Hour (be it through your website, Facebook page, or on Yelp). Your Happy Hour is great, by the way, for customers and your business. It clears out stock that would normally go bad by the next morning and it entices more customers. But this miscommunication between your business and your customers creates a lot of unnecessary conflict. 

Another aside, while I love the all-natural, no food coloring vibe of your macarons--some of them are impossible to tell apart. If you guys could find a way to write down which are which in the box or better differentiate the look of them, that would be wonderful!
author: Diane D.

description: The Ballpark peanut brittle is very good here, and during happy hour, the macarons are only $1! I had the green tea macaron, and it was very soft, fluffy, and the filling was amazingly smooth and creamy. I was tempted to eat my boyfriend's piece too! The place itself is decorated like every little girl's dream candy shop. Love it!!!
author: Alice S.

description: Very poor customer service. Ordered and pre-paid for buche de noel to pick up at Hayes Valley.  Cake is at other location after we painstakingly specified where we were picking it up.  Refused to give us one of the ones they had on hand and fix the mistake themselves.  Now we will be 30 - 40 minutes late to Christmas eve lunch with an elderly relative who is waiting for us because we are driving back and forth across town.
author: M S.

description: Charming shop with all of the glass jars of candy and cute window displays. The Tomboy cake is great, but the old-fashioned cupcake with the marshmallow-like frosting is my favorite. I also like their coconut sponge cake and mini chocolate shortbread cookies.
author: Ana G.

description:
Oh how I love sweet surprises!! 

I cannot express how much I love these macaroons!! Miette creates and bakes the BEST macaroons ever!!! Ever since my first bite a few years ago, nothing and nobody has compared to their quality in the makings. 

The consistency of these are made to perfection! In every bite, there's a bit of fluffiness, a bit of chewy, and a bit of crunch - all balanced so evenly! Each flavor (some of my faves - grapefruit, rose garden, pistachio, hazelnut) is true to it's name and not overly sweet or tart or takes over the "cookie" part of it. 

I have also had their ice cream cookie sandwich. Cooling on a hot day and satisfying with the shortbread cookie. 

The lavender shortbread cookie pairs really well with a warm black tea soy latte. 

Miette bakes so many wonderful creations. You will NOT be disappointed! I wish they could teleport themselves to Arizona! The location I usually go to is on the pier. This is at a prime location where you can discover much more foodie heaven!  Your good friends will hopefully bring you back some goodies from here the next time they're in San Fran! ;)
author: Regina W.

description:
Eh I'll give this place the benefit of the doubt and give it a four for now. I stopped by on a Sunday evening on the recommendation of a friend who told me that Miette's macarons are pretty good. When I went into the store, I didn't realize that they serve much more than just macarons! There are so many baked goods--cookies, ginger snaps, candies, chocolates, just about any type of dessert that you can possibly imagine. I didn't love the stuff I got, but I could see myself coming back in the future if I wanted to give someone a easy, presentable gift--that's why I'm giving it the four; I don't super love it right now, but if I really wanted random desserts, this seems like the right place to go. More of a fan of the concept and how cute the store is.

I got the raspberry turkish delight, butter cookies, and macarons. The Turkish Delight tasted like Turkish delight--which is basically just a jello like gummy bear for those of you who aren't familiar. Butter cookies were pretty decent if you're into that--I'd be willing to try more cookies in the future.

The macarons are super 3 though. They're definitely on the cheaper end at around $1.45/macaron I think, but meh they tasted so bleh. I got the green tea, salted caramel, and vanilla. It may have been because I came too late in the day, but the green tea and the salted caramel were both really, really hard. The shells weren't necessarily hard but they were on the really need to be chewed side, which isn't what a macron should be like. Flavors were pretty good though. I will say that again, maybe I just got a bad batch because my vanilla macaron was actually like a proper macaron--soft shell, good flavor, though not rich flavor. It's definitely no Laduree.

tldr; expensive cute pastry/snack shop. great for giving gifts, but so far I haven't actually super liked anything in here. It's just really cute... also macarons are super not on point. If you're in Hayes Valley, just go to Chantal Guillon
author: Jasmine X.

description: I'm wasn't the biggest fan of macarons.. but these are the best ones I've ever had. Seriously!! Service was great, staff is super friendly, honest, and knowledgable. Would highly recommend this place!
author: Christy S.

description:
$1.85 / macaron. 7 available flavors (6 year-round & 1 seasonal).

Miette macarons have no noticeable flaws but have a more homemade look than others -- the feeling of perfection in imperfection. What is unique is that Miette uses no coloring or artificial flavoring!

Against other macarons, flavors have a lighter sweetness and texture is a bit cakier / less chewy (depending on flavor). I liked the  hazelnut, pistachio, chocolate, and the seasonal chocolate lavender. Don't think I could really distinguish the subtle differences between Chocolate or Chocolate Lavender though.  Strawberry was just ok & Rose Germanium was way too perfumey (almost baby powder-y) to enjoy.

Packaging is simple compostable cardboard and twine.  This was really hard to walk around or travel with.  They use tissue paper to line the box, but there is nothing separating each cookie (no cradles).  On a warm day, the macarons don't do well with the tissue paper and cardboard.

3.5 stars *** I wouldn't say no to a box of Miette macarons, but I wouldn't go out of my way to buy them.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I adore this place! Their macarons are top notch. 

The store is perfection. So cute, and filled with all the sweets you can imagine. The real deal though is their macarons. Crisp on the outside, soft and chewy on the inside. Usually I opt for caramel or vanilla, but they always have so many great flavors. It's a little pricey, but totally worth it. 

Pro tip: buy the macarons and then take them to the adjacent park to enjoy.
author: Angela F.

description: The bakery is sooo cute and makes the most darling cakes but their offering is limited.  You must like their five cakes they make or you're out of luck.  Fortunately they are all fantastic!
author: Lori G.

description: The reason I choose Miette is its pastries made with real flavors and ingredients.  I've chosen the macaroons since they're very popular from France.  Short and sweet, these bite sized cookies will always be my favorite desserts.  I'll be back to see what type of sweets I like!
author: Jimmy C.

description:
What an adorable candy shop. Everything here is so cute and (ridiculously) in order, you almost don't wanna touch anything. Almost. I couldn't help wondering if the candies assorted by color in the jars behind the counter for display only? 

We went about admiring things throughout the store and grabbing whatever tickled our fancy into our basket. Their cupcakes are delicious with a light cream and not heavy or thick. They box it up nicely for you. 

I loved that they had a lot of British/European sweets laid out in front of the cash register area and the glass counter up front. I considered grabbing a few while checking out my purchases. 

Great macarons as well!
author: Esther A.

description:
This is a cute store with lots of treats, but the service is so slow. Came here on a sunday and waited 15 min at the counter and still no one helped me, there wasnt even a line!

Prices for their candies are a bit too high based on the small quantity and basic packaging.

Macarons are priced at $1.85 each and look good but never got to try one cause they are so slow.

They have a good variety of products- cakes, cupcakes, cotton candy, macarons, cookies, candies, chocolate, novelty treats.

Will update this review when i return!
author: Kimia M.

description: This place is heaven!. All kinds of sweet treats! A must when in the neighborhood. I just love this store. This place makes me smile.
author: Astrid C.

description: Disappointing cake. Ordered the Lemon Debutant Cake for my mother's birthday. Frosting and decor were beautiful but the cake itself was VERY very dry. Possibly frozen prior? I wrote to them to check into it and one week later still have had no response. It's really too bad. Their cookies and candies are good. Maybe an "off" day? Extremely disappointing end to an otherwise nice celebration.
author: Cheley F.

description: I ordered a $35 layered chocolate cake with vanilla buttercream for my brother's birthday. It was surprisingly small for the price I paid. I don't know if it was because the cake had been sitting out all day or what but I have tasted cakes from Wal-Mart that were more moist and had more flavor. It wasn't worth the money or the calories. Very unimpressed. That being said, it's a cute shop and maybe some of the other faire tastes better.
author: Connie G.

description: Miette is one of my biggest inspirations as a baker and pastry enthusiast. Their pastries not only look beautiful but they're also super tasty. There is so much attention given to every little detail in the shop as well as every little cupcake, candy, cake, ice cream, etc. Going into Miette transforms me into a childhood wonderland. Thank you Miette for giving me an opportunity to feel like a kid again every time I walk in :)
author: Sara S.

description:
The macarons here are delicious! They are more on the chewier side. I prefer them over Chantal Guillon's macarons, despite their selection of flavors being more limited. Miette doesn't add food coloring or other artificial ingredients to their macarons (which is pretty obvious because none of them are bright colored like hot pink or lime green). I had a hard time differentiating between flavors because most of them shared the same beige color which comes from its' almond base. 

If you're coming for the macarons, make sure you come on a weekday after 6PM so you can purchase them at Happy Hour price--$1 each! 

Overall, the store is cute and quaint much like the other shops in the surrounding area that call Hayes Valley home.
author: Michelle T.

description:
4.5

I could weep heavy tears. I would not be crying from sorrow. On the contrary, I was so overwhelmed with fat boy glee upon stepping foot inside Miette, I simply didn't know what to do. I am fairly certain that I stood in place for a good five minutes, unable to move from sheer awe. If you have even an inkling of a sweet tooth, get yourself to Hayes Valley and indulge in pure excess. Miette is the kind of place that might make you hate yourself in the morning, but it's going to feel so good while you're doing it.

Sweets. It's all about sweets. Expects pinks and bows and frilly stuff. Disregard it if you have issues. You're here for sweets. Cupcakes may be out of fashion (seriously, #firstworld?) but here at Miette, they never went out of style. I devoured a lemon with most cake and ample amount of lemon curd in the frosting. The chocolate on chocolate was as delicious as promised. I was let down by the chocolate with Italian marshmallow cupcake. It was beautifully adorned and decorated but the cake was dry and the topping didn't blend as well with the cake as I would have thought. Still, a fine cake... just not as good as it looked (and in all fairness, it looked beautiful). 

There are also all sorts of candy bars, fancy Euro chocolates, candies, jellies, toffees, caramels, etc. If it's sweet, it's here. The decor is chic without the shabby. Again, unapologetically feminine but that should matter little to the fatty fat fat amongst you. And those chocolate bars? Unlike any others you've had. Unless you've been so lucky as to have caramel cookie apple and champagne & strawberry bars before. Yep. You read right: chocolate, champagne & strawberries.

What are you still doing there, reading? Get up. Eat chocolate! Get fat!! Live a little.
author: Johnny T.

description: A cute little dessert/candy shop in Hayes Valley. We got some macarons and enjoyed people watching from the tables outside. I will be back to try the ice cream sandwiches! I'm not usually a macaron person but I think this place changed me view on them. :)
author: Andrew G.

description:
My husband and I were in San Francisco on business 3 years ago in Pleasanton. We walked into a boutique that had this charming book called "Miette". I immediately bought the book and I realized they were based in San Francisco, just a jump away. We decided to make a day of it. We walked to the Octavia St location from downtown. It was so cut and charming. I love the use of color perfectly placed around the entire room by use of Candy. I love their cute round table displayed with all their hand crafted gems. This place is so charming, I didn't have a problem with purchasing anything here. The young girl was very helpful. The darn little cakes are just the cutest things I had seen. So perfectly fitting for the boutique. The price of the items are perfectly priced for the quality of items they produce. The creations that people are buying take a certain skill to create, and either your good at it or your not. They are great at it! When I was there, I bought the marshmallows, the large caramel, and some meringue cookies. The ingredients used are so predominate in the flavor. The vanilla bean seeds in the marshmallows, the rich flavor of the butter from the caramel, and the light rose flavor from the meringues show the craftsmanship of a true pastry chef. 

It's been a while, but I miss this place. I took the plunge and ordered online, for delivery to Texas. I have to say, I was a bit nervous. Because, I was not sure how they would ship. I ordered yesterday morning and I received my purchase just now by way of UPS next day air. Everything was packed perfectly so nothing was crushed, or broken. I was so happy when I opened my goodie box and ate a Rose-Geranium Macaron, still cold, but not too cold. Really the toffee was in perfect shape as well and did a dance in my mouth. Thank you Miette team for packing my stuff and making me really, really happy!!!! Love from Texas!!!!
author: Adrianna K.

description:
Hayes Valley was on the Friday agenda...and we happened on this Miette location...score!!

I have had their lovely macaroons...but my bestie said she love the cupcakes.  i did not argue....but have not found many I loved.

We got her two faves...a chocolate and a gingerbread...to eat with coffee.

I was in heaven!!

Chocolate....listen up bakers...this is how it is done!!  Moist, strong chocolate flavor.  Light slightly sweet meringue on top.  Perfection!!

Gingerbread...even better!!  Moist, perfect balance of sweet and spice...butter cream extraordinaire!!

I took a Chocolate  Fleur de sel Tart home to share with hubby....also amazing...buttery pastry, smooth intense chocolate flavor, maybe a tad to much salt.

I can not wait until I can get more of the same...
author: Katherine F.

description: Tres délicieux! My stepmom went to France last year and said their macaroons rival this found in Paris. We also got the lemon pound cake and it did taste like the one my grandma used to make. The staff were super friendly and I tried to move past the pastel pink interior. It feels almost as if you've stepped into a fairy tale - not my style, but perfect for the product they sell. This place is heaven for anyone with a sweet tooth - cakes, cookies, macaroons and loads of candy. I would definitely go back.
author: Kirsten M.

description: What a pretty little shop! Their cupcakes are amazing with a rich layer of icing and macarons very tasty! The pistachios macarons shell although a little chewier than I prefer, had great pista flavor. The shop is very neat with everything arranged so perfectly and in a great location.
author: Sharanya A.

description:
You can't help but feel like a kid walking into a candy store with the quaint and charming set up. And you can't help but want more when the sweets are so tasty. Miette was the first place I tried a french macaron and til this day, holds the standard in which I compare macaron greatness...haha!

I've tried Bouchon, Laduree, Chantal Guillon..the list goes on. And they all have different qualities that are great. But here, Miette just feels right. I love the texture and proportion of the macaron and filling - light, slightly chewy, not too sweet, and a size that lets you savor the flavors in a couple bites. 

I usually favor the strawberry one. This time that I went, it was not available (some flavors are seasonal) and went all out to try the other one's that were featured. The stand out one were the green tea and dulce de leche ones. 

#TeamMiette all the way!
author: Vincent L.

description: Came across this shop when I was going to Smitten. It is the cutest bake, candy and sweets shop!!! I love the amazing decor! I'm a sucker for cute stuff and this definitely is cute! They had rows and rows of candy jar with colorful candies in them! There were many baked goods!! There were some cakes! I wish though that I bought a tomboy cake. I'm gonna have to come back and try their famous cake!
author: Marie P.

description: Rock star customer service and an amazing gingerbread cake.
author: Tazz R.

description:
If unicorns and rainbows ever had children, this is what their baby room would look like. Pink, floral wallpapered, filled with candies and sweets, and innocently sitting on the counter is piece de resistance - homemade macarons. 

There are lots of macarons in San Francisco, but Miette's macaron cookie has the texture and flavors most like that of Laduree (Paris, France). My favorites are the seasonal flavors which can range from grapefruit, rose, and strawberry to name a few.

Other noted goodies - ginger crackers, old-fashioned chocolate cakes, caramel and chocolate bites, ice cream sandwiches.

Tip: Macaron happy hour ($1/macaron) is one hour before closing.
author: Grace G.

description:
Miette is my favorite place to pick up French macaroons. I get excited every time they have strawberry (because it only comes out in season) and have to pick up a small box (fits 6-8 pieces). They are magical. Literally. They aren't too small like some macaron places and their always consistent in taste, size, appearance, everything, even price. $1.85 for a small macaron may seem steep to some people, but come on, it's a French macaron. It's not a regular cookie. I like Miette so much better than other shops because these babies aren't overly sweet, their semi-crunchy and semi-chewy. They also have a light whipped cream in between the patties, unlike other places where it's more paste-like or jam-like. Chantal down the block would be the next runner up, but it sure doesn't beat Miette!

Today's flavors: strawberry, vanilla, chocolate hazelnut, pistachio, rose, dulce de leche and chocolate. 

It's confirmed. They still have happy hour macaroons, Monday-Friday from 6pm-7pm where macarons are $1 each.
author: Laura T.

description: I've lived in SF for two years and haven't been here before! No idea how that happened. I popped in this weekend and tried the pumpkin cream and hazelnut macaron and was so happy I did. They were so fresh and soft in the middle but had be perfect crunch on the outside. Will for sure be back to try a few more things!
author: Brittany G.

description:
I've never had macarons before (I know, right?) so my friends decided to take me to get some since we were in San Francisco. What did I walk into...!? This place is the cutest real-life "candy shop" ever! Chocolates, candy flowers, cupcakes, desserts, and endless macarons covered the entire store. Not a single table, shelf, or counter was empty. This is definitely heaven for dessert lovers.

I ordered one macaron of each flavor - go big or go home, right? At $1.75 a piece, it ended up being a little more than $10.50 for six DELICIOUS treats. The little boxes are super cute, too! (Yeah, I'm a sucker for adorable packaging.) Normally, I cringe at the thought of spending almost $2 for such a small treat, but it's definitely worth it once in a while. ;)
author: Christine S.

description:
What a beautiful little sweet shop! I came in particularly for the macarons ($1.85) and tried four flavors. Rose geranium, strawberry, chocolate lavender, and pistachio. Yum! 

The texture of these macarons are a little chewier than most macarons I've tried, but what a wonderful texture that is! I love how these treats aren't laden with food coloring and you can see the almond meal they are made with. What makes these macarons even better? The beautifully light buttercream center that is made with just the right touch of sweetness (the chocolate lavender filling was a bit richer).

The macarons were a reasonable price in my mind since I'm used to paying over $2 for one at other bakeries, but some of the other items seemed over priced. What a treat for the eyes though! I will definitely  return for more macarons!
author: Jess K.

description:
Most perfect cupcakes ever. I was never really into sweets until I discovered these. Now I want cupcakes from here all the time. My favorite is the ginger with cream cheese frosting! The chocolate one was also delicious. It's the perfect amount of sweet and moistness.

TIP: if you're eating dinner in the area, go here beforehand to pick up awesome cupcakes and the best selection of candies and baked goods for dessert. :)
author: Veronica T.

description:
Lots of variety in this cute little shop.

Tons of candy to choose from, 9 flavors of macaroons ($1.65/each), cupcakes, cakes, ice cream sandwiches.

The texture of the macaroon is great. Just the right chewy consistency and the filling isn't too sweet. Also purchased a cupcake and ice cream sandwich that I'm excited to try.
author: Julie L.

description:
Oh Miette! I feel like it has such a special, sweet place in my heart! I realized it's been 5 years already since I first stopped at its Embarcadero location, particularly excited to try their macarons -- one of the first I ever tried, and while I've since tried many more, these macarons still don't disappoint. And that's just the beginning of their goodies.

I didn't even know that there was a large store on Octavia St, which is even more satisfying than stopping by the Embarcadero one. The store here has tables and walls of imported, international candies that you grab yourself. With the gorgeous packaging and displays, everything is really tempting so you better watch your wallet or else you'll be surprised at how easily they add up here.  

This location reminds me of Sockerbit in West LA (they both have some similar options of candies), but Miette also has their own pastries. Today I tried a few macaron flavors that I don't remember getting years ago -- green tea, lavender chocolate, and rose geranium. All three of these happened to only have a few left by the end of the day when I went, although there were still plenty of other flavors. They are all so distinct in flavor! I didn't have to second guess myself or try to decipher them by color. Their macarons are always on the chewier side and particularly on a hot day, can very easily melt. But they're still some of my favorites, and whereas some macarons tend to be bland, forgettable, or disintegrate on first bite, I definitely know when I'm eating one from Miette. Their cookies are also worth noting; my family would get a couple boxes of them and they'd be finished way too soon! 

There wasn't really any service here when I went, which surprised me. But really, this is such a happy place with all the colorful displays, quaint setting, and sweets galore that you can't help but want to take it all in.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
After my last marathon, I wanted to celebrate with the best cake in SF. I have always looked at those chocolate cakes with chocolate on them and thought....that is so over the top. 

But running a marathon is over the top, so I had my hubby buy me a cake from Miette. A Scharffen Berger. Yep. Chocolate on chocolate. Now this will be my post marathon meal. 

I did share, but I still had most of it......
author: Dani K.

description: I bought raspberry white cupcakes and macaroons for my LO's birthday party. Everything was amazing. Super cute cupcakes that kids ate almost right away. Super delicious macaroons. I think those macaroons the best that I've tried so far in the city.
author: Anastasia G.

description:
Sometimes I get so blown away by the personality and aesthetic of a business, being an objective evaluator of the experience beyond the looks just jumps right out the window.  I get caught up in an infatuation with a place and its clouds my own good judgement.

Its like that for me at Miette, which is undoubtedly one of the most precious, gorgeous, well curated bakery shops I have even been into in the United States but with a fairly limited selection of wares once you get inside.  It reminds me of a visit to an old school ice cream shop meets a visit to Pierre Herme in Paris  --its an almost transcendent aesthetic.  Clean, pretty, with just a handful of well curated items to choose from.  Coming to Miette is like looking too long at a really good looking person: you can't help stuttering even while trying hard to keep your cool.  But do the looks go below the surface?

The items at Miette are tasty, and uber precious.  Their baked goods, including cupcakes, tea cookies and french macarones are curated and cultivated to appear like precious gems, tiny treasures, and perfect morsels.  The goods are beautiful.

Good macarons, and nice cupcakes.  This in an adorable shop, but not the spilling over french patisserie with more choices than you can possibly narrow down.  its better looking here than tasting.  MIette is  a meticulously decorated shop, but is mostly a very pretty face.
author: Rachel H.

description:
Love their macarons. 

I have been trying and sampling all the different macaron places throughout San Francisco and Los Angeles and I must say Miette's macarons are still my all time favorite. My only complaint is that they never make any new flavors! I have been going there for a year now and I am forced to consistently get the same flavors over and over again. What makes these macaroons different is the fact that they are much chewier and dense than all the other macarons I have had. Another thing I would also ask of Miette is for more gluten free options because when it comes to their house made desserts macarons are my only option.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
This place is heaven to me. It has amazing cake. It is pretty, and I mean PRETTY - the decor is perfection. The staff are super friendly and very helpful, the guy who served me even helped with a restaurant recommendation. 

We got our wedding cake from here - a raspberry tomboy - and it was the nicest cake I've ever had. It was moist, chocolatey, the raspberry buttercream was Ah-ma-zing and it was perfect in every way. 

We ordered our cake online so that we were guaranteed to get the one we wanted, so I would recommend this in case they sell out of the cabinet. The day that we went, the shop was open until 19:00, which I thought was excellent for a bakery. 

I hope to return one day, digital SLR in hand, to photograph the place to death and to gorge on more delicious cake. 

I got some cupcakes, which we also had on our wedding day, and I could not have been happier with them. I got some taffy, which I didn't particularly like, but that's personal preference. 

Please don't change, Miette, before I've had a chance to return.
author: Lindsey B.

description:
This is one of the prettiest candy stores I've ever been in. I love the gorgeous glass jars filled with pastel candies. They have yummy macarons and you can't go wrong with any of their cupcakes.

This is a great Hayes Valley location. It is right across the park from Smitten and the Biergarten. I recommend grabbing a cupcake and enjoying it in the little park.
author: Kari G.

description:
Oh man, I thought I liked french macarons but I guess I was wrong... I LOVE THEM! 

Miette has shown me the light on these adorable and yummy treats. I have only tried french macarons a handful of times in my life and I thought they were ok at best; not very impressive... but at Miette they're so chewy and soft and omg. A friend of mine and I decided to get the grapefruit, chocolate, and rose flavors. My favorite was the grapefruit, but the other two were good as well. They were all packed in cute box with string, which I still have (why waste a cute box? Haha). We also tried some samples of peanut brittle(?) and that was delicious as well. 

The whole shop is adorable with tables filled various sweets in cute packaging and little notes to explain what they are, including the price. I wish I could have tried a little bit of everything because it looked all scrumptious, sigh. 

The service was also nice, which fit the sugar-coated aura of this place. I'll be sure to stop by again if I'm in the area.
author: Adri A.

description:
The place was a real eye candy with lots of choices. It was a store, so there were no table nor chair. I was hoping to find a place as a desert hang out, like the Christopher Elbow down a few block (but chocolates are double the price there) Got nine different individuals dark chocolate pieces to try. The first piece opened, it was obviously fat bloomed... Since individual pieces have no expiration date, I had to do a sniff test... I ended up opening all nine pieces to check for flaws. So I was a little paranoid. But they were all OK. In all honesty, the wrapping were pretty, none were spoiled, but chocolate without fillings, they all tasted the same. Nice to get as mini wedding favors. The only difference was the bitterness and sweetness derived from the percentage of   cacao. My chocolate pieces range from 70%-88% cacao. 

Between Miette's 70% Marou bar that costs $10 and Trader Joe's 85% Chocolate Lover's for $1.60... No brainier.
author: Emma T.

description: Awesome handcraft candy store! This place has a lot of candy from Europe where there's exquisite attention to detail.
author: Thomas C.

description:
This is a really really cute store with lots of choices for treats, from candy to dessert and really creative ice cream flavors.

Service is wonderful too. Enjoyable pastel-colored world. Plus has outdoor tables with a view to enjoy your treats =)
author: Tanya S.

description:
I have a few Macaroons and the gingerbread muffin with cream cheese icing that won the food network award. The Macaroons were very good.  The muffin was not my favorite but they were very moist.

I would come here again to try something different and get more macaroons!
author: Jennifer L.

description: Clean cute decor. Macarons were nice chewy and soft. Hazelnut was too sweet. Salted Caramel was delicious. Pistachio was not as good as I remembered
author: W W.

description:
I absolutely think Miette is over-priced and not as good as other candy stores I've been to, but it's adorable, fits well in Hayes Valley, and has yummy ice cream sandwiches that are unfortunately $5.

The only reason I had come to Miette was because Smitten was closed, and I was craving something sweet.  But... the $5 ice cream sandwich was actually really good - in part because of whatever graham cracker "bread" they used for it.

Miette is also a place I'd probably shop at to pick up a gift for a friend's mother if she had invited me over for an afternoon tea / a brunch or something.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Yappies! 
The store is cute and pretty oh yeah AND it's in Hayes Valley. Boohoo when I pay almost $2 for one macaroon I expect extra ordinary taste but it's sooo chewy, taste bland. I got macarons at La Boulange accord the street and taste better.
author: Ty N.

description: Macarons, cakes, cookies, and chocolates galore! Cute shop on Octavia that is a must visit if you're in the area. There will be a little sweet something for everyone. I highly recommend getting the chocolate cake for someone's birthday, or the shortbread cookies if you're in the mood for a snack. Goes very well with bubble tea from Papabubble just around the corner!
author: Sherry L.

description:
Instead of ordering some giant cake for our wedding, we ordered multiple Miette Vanilla Tomboys as centerpieces. I was worried about the delivery, as we would be busy getting married when they opened for business that day, so we went to the store a few weeks early to quietly meet Julio. I knew right away that he would be there for us. He knew exactly who we were and remembered everything about our wedding. He and his team walked them over to our venue (Absinthe Private Dining) right on time. It was perfect.

The cakes were fabulous, and we look forward to stopping by for cupcakes whenever we come up for symphony, or new cakes every time we celebrate our anniversary.
author: Erica B.

description: The hazelnut macaron was fine, the pistachio was tasteless and super sweet. Tried a carrot cupcake as well and while the cake was okay the frosting was greasy and didn't have a strong cream cheese tang. Expensive without much flavor. Great shop though that is super cute.
author: Natalie J.

description: Carrot cake was a bit dry. $30 for very small very cute little cake. I was ready to have something amazing but it was just good.
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
If I could dream up my own candy shop, this place would be the closest to my ideal. 

Unlike a Dylan's Candy Bar, this shop is very elegant and cute. I don't like Dylan's very much because it is geared towards young children, and they went wild with their color scheme and theme. I like how it has a feel of an old-fashion candy shop like in Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, but everything was updated. 

We tried a sample of their macaroons and it wasn't that great. I don't think I will order any of those from them, but I do want to try their cupcakes and tomboys. 

My favorite candy was the Champagne bubbles, champagne and fruit flavored gummies. Just up my alley! I knew it would be good because there were only a few bags left. I wasn't disappointed! Tasted so good and exactly like Sanrio candy. A light taste in a chewy gummy covered with sprinkles. The candy is overpriced though. It was like three dollars for a little baggy of gummies. 

This is a place you would go to for the novelty and not necessarily for everyday. Walking in this place makes me all giddy like a five-year-old again.
author: Hang T.

description:
I got the chocolate wafers with sea salt or something, plain looking cookies, ate them all in a day. I got some for my friend, ate them all, then got him some for real. So, I have to eat about two jars of cookies before I've had enough that I can give one away.
The graham wafers were not bad but nowhere near as good.
The cookies as well were not bad at all.
Decently priced but no samplers.
author: Zou Z.

description:
The store is Oh-So-Cute! I spent a good amount of time browsing around at all the interesting candies but turns out they aren't that interesting. I think the decor made everything look like they are tasty. A lot of the candy look like your regular sweets you can buy at walgreens but wrapped in a clear bag. The price here is ridiculous! I did buy their ginger snaps which is in the 7x7 2010 list. The sales lady totally looked unhappy. -star 

The ginger snaps were very over-powering but they do make good nibbles when you are craving a snack.
author: Sarah C.

description: Soooooo delicious!! This is absolutely the cutest bakery and shop.  I ordered 50 cupcakes here to have as my wedding favor, and they boxed them all separately and were so nice. Highly recommend!
author: Meagan H.

description:
I've heard that the macarons at Miette rival those at Chanal Guillion, so I made sure that after lunch, my friends and I made a stop at Miette. This grown up candy store has everything that a big (and little) kid could want: gourmet versions of our favorite candies, from the prettiest cupcakes I've ever seen to delicate marshmallows to my favorite candy bars from overseas to beautifully baked and displayed ginger snaps. I was in sweet tooth heaven.

The macarons do look tasty, but I opted for an ice cream sandwich. Priced steeply at $5, this ice cream sandwich was nothing ordinary. Two incredible graham crackers that will literally make so that I can never eat the Safeway variety again sandwiched creme fraiche ice cream, which was melt in your mouth delicate. This gourmet ice cream sandwich will satisfy the pickiest adult.

Miette is one of the prettiest stores I've ever been lucky enough to set foot in, but I'll definitely have to wait for my next pay check before I dare venture by again.
author: Christina S.

description:
MIETTE MACARONS. 

I've been on this strange strange macaron obsession/rampage. Well I guess it's not strange.. they are pretty delectable. But anyway Jessica C. and I tried a grand total of - 5 -  different places over the past weekend and MIETTE is my personal favorite in SF. Something about their natural coloring and fluffy filling tickles my fancy. Also their shell is lightly crispy and cookie is dense, slightly grainy, and chewy which is macaron perfection in my eyes. They may not be the most traditional but they are not too sweet or florally or artificial, which is just how I like em!
author: Jacqueline C.

description: Delicious macarons. I am going to bump them because they were a tad less sweeter than Chantal Guillon macarons, and that's how I prefer them. Chewy morsels of goodness. I can't wait to come back and get more! My favorite flavors: dulce de leche and pistachio!
author: Janet D.

description:
I purchased macarons and a lemon tea pound cake at the Ferry building. The macarons weren't great, super sweet, and texture is a bit off. The ganache wasn't all that great either (hazelnut vs coffee). The sizes were not matching and some were breaking apart in the jars. I definitely had better.

I do agree the lemon tea pound cake is hecka good. Though I toss/got rid of the icing, the taste was good as it wasn't overly sweet and it was devoured all in one setting.
author: Minerva L.

description: Really good stuff! I come here to get a dozen coz they stay good for a week if refrigerated. each piece is moist and flavorful.
author: Ammie A.

description:
This place is nothing but charming. It screams cute!

Definitely cliché, but you literally feel like a kid in a candy store when you step into Miette. Once you walk in, you're guaranteed to buy something. The decor just sucks you in. Candy and cupcakes. Sweets galore!

This location is very quaint. I've been coming here since the closure of the Chestnut location. I still have to venture out to the one in the Ferry Building sometime soon. 

Yes, everything here seems pricey, but you are truly paying for quality sweets. I don't mind paying a little more for something that's great rather than paying less for something that's mediocre.

On today's visit, I purchased 2 of each of the following macaron flavors: vanilla, pistachio, hazelnut, and chocolate at $1.75 each. And I just had to get their gingerbread cupcake for $3.25. 

Miette's macarons are honestly the best I've ever had! They're fresh and creamy...absolutely delightful. Not too sweet, but sweet enough. Each flavor really tastes like the actual thing...like pistachio literally tastes like pistachios. 

This was my first time trying one of their cupcakes and I was drawn to the gingerbread one because I wanted something different that wasn't your usual vanilla or chocolate cupcake. I'm glad I stepped out of the box and chose the gingerbread one! It was incredibly moist and the ginger taste wasn't overpowering at all. The cream cheese frosting was rich and velvety. I loved it!

The gals that work here are very nice and you just can't help but feel happy once you leave the store. If you haven't tried any of their macarons, I suggest you do so and definitely pick up a gingerbread cupcake! You'll thank me later!
author: Fallon P.

description:
Came here on a Sunday morning (3/18/2012) because my fiance wanted some sweet treats; we arrived at 10:50am, the sign says will open at 11am, so we waited right outside the door.

From outside, we could see some staffs were inside organizing their items and pretty sure they saw us waiting; there were also some other customers waiting outside as well. 11:05am - someone opened the door and asked if we were the one who made some special orders, we said no, then she said "oh we are preparing that order now, please wait for 10 more minutes or so" then closed the door immediately.

I was like, really???! It's fine that you guys needed to prepare your orders, but it's not a right choice to keep your other customers waiting outside the store when it's passed the time you were supposed to open. Why can't we just look around the store inside? Unlike they had only one staff (they had at least 3)!

We still went in by 11:09am, only one staff was smiling at us, the other two looked unhappy the entire time.

Well, I gave all 3 stars for their products, not the customer service.
author: Sammy C.

description: My go-to shop for a sweet gift that is as beautiful as it is tasty. They have a wide selection of European candies, lovely baked goods, and ice cream sandwiches. Their packaging is also quite beautiful and adds to the delight of the recipient.
author: Bruce B.

description:
Just walk a few steps over where they know how to make real macrons. This one taste like wheat macrons with oily and thick/ dense artificial flavoring.
I love the decor of this place which is why I bring visitors, but I wouldn't get anything here really. Sorry cut pretty looking shop!
author: jasmin t.

description:
Quick tip: They have Honees hard candy from Italy.

Quick tip: They do not sell rose water.
author: Chloe M.

description:
I was THAT kid in a candy store right here!  

It is cute.  It is pink.  It is the girliest store ever.  And I wanted it all!  Chocolates, lollipops, cupcakes, AHH!!  I was on a sugar high just looking at everything.  

But one thing made my heart melt....
 
Two word: PISTACHIO MACARONS!  *drool*

Words can't even describe how delicious they were.  The chewiness..the buttercream... all bundled up in a little package of joy.  

*sigh*
author: Cecilia S.

description:
I got 10 macaroons as a gift, so unfortunately didn't get to try them. But I was told they are "super delicious"!

However, their macaroons all have similar color, so hard to figure out the flavors.
author: Stan L.

description:
Everything is imported from Europe! It's a euro candy shop with special packaging, cheap prices, great customer service, nice location, etc, I came in and ordered the strawberry macaron, chocolate lavender, and pistachio. Each cost $1.85, the size is a bit larger than Chantal G's. It was a bit more heavier in the taste, thick texture, and just the right amount of sweetness. 

I'll def be coming back! Thanks ladies
author: Allister D.

description:
Enjoyed Valentine's day with some tasty treats from Miette! Their Carrot cupcake - chock-full of carrots, walnuts, & currants, topped with a creamy, tangy cream cheese frosting. In addition to there delicious macaroons (they usually have 7 flavors on hand). 

If your looking for a sweet snack or something to share with your guests. Look for your nearest Miette!
author: Kristina S.

description:
Aside from their macarons still being my favorite by far in the city (read first review below... their rose geranium and pistachio are my favorite), their selection of black licorice is awesome and i have yet to find anywhere in the city that carries a selection like theirs.

black licorice is definitely a love it or hate thing, and about two years ago i learned to love it. call it all the influence i had of having so many scandinavian co-workers that would eat this stuff religiously, or call it a change in my taste buds. either way, i'm addicted. although i'm not a fan of the salty black licorice, which they have plenty of at miette, they have just as good a selection of the sweet black licorice. i have yet to find another place in the city that has such a unique selection of black licorice to choose from. i usually get a bag of the black cats, the round circle moons, and just recently started noshing on the small jujubee like nuggets with the "k" on the top.

now all miette needs to do is get a selection of swedish gummies and i'm set on my hard-to-get sweet tooth cravings.
author: Kimberly F.

description:
The first day I fell in love with Miette was when I went to the Ferry Building. I really like macarons not because they look so beautiful but they also taste wonderful. They make for a great gift. I have had less tasty macarons and realized this is THE place to get them. 

Macarons: I think the best deal is a box of 6 macarons. Remember to store them in a room temperature before you give them as a gift. No one wants to eat cold macarons. 

Turkish Delight: I bought a bag of Rose flavored Turkish Delight. Let me just tell you LET ME JUST TELL YOU, I felt like Edmund from Narnia. I couldn't stop eating them... I have no idea what they put in them but...they were like druggggsssss...:O

VERDICT: Come here to treat yourself or to buy a gift. There are plenty of tasty choices that you can choose from.

FYI: Girls probably like this store more than guys. So if you are a guy and have no idea how to treat your girl, come here. But, ladies, I'm also sure guys like to receive macarons as gifts too.
author: Eileen W.

description: I don't care how good it is. The cashier/candy clerk was rude and made us feel uncomfortable. As lovely as it is I won't be back.
author: Stardust N.

description:
Date & Time:  Sunday August 2, 2009 @ 4pm
Company:  Michael & Jack Waited Outside
Crowd:  Young Families w/ Children in Adorable Fiddlesticks Outfits
Vibe:  Whimsical
Decor:  So Pretty.  Flowered Wall-Paper.  Tables, Shelves & Counters Filled w/ Huge Jars of Colorful Candies, Macarons, Cupcakes & Cakes
Service:  Polite
Devour:  Rose, Pistachio, Vanilla & Raspberry Macarons, Vanilla & Chocolate Cupcakes w/ Raspberry Buttercream Frosting
Total:  $17
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
This is the cutest bakery/candy shop that I have ever been to, EVER! I literally felt like a lil girl once I walked in and out... rushing back home to dig into what I got LOL

Their "Old Fashion Cupcake w/ Italian Meringue" is one of the BEST chocolate cupcakes that I've had in a while. The cupcake itself wasn't too sweet nor too chocolaty, but it was just right. It was moist and not crumbly. The Italian meringue was a bit different, in a good way; I didn't think it was too sweet,  not bad for my first time having meringue.

I also purchased their chocolate covered gummy-bears which is my favorite candy of all time. It's soooo good, I'm just eating 2 bears a day and I still have some left.

To me, I didn't think this place was too pricey. I mean, I got 2 cupcakes and a baggy of chocolate covered gummy-bears ALL for $10. Not bad, to feel like a lil girl again (:
author: Johanna M.

description:
Small pink shop in Hayes Valley where there's only street parking that's fairly hard to find. There's a few small tables on the outside but none inside. It's a beautiful store where you definitely feel like a kid in a candy store. It's just more elevated than when you were a kid.

They sell their macrons, cupcakes, small cakes and their sea salt caramel tart but no pot de creme! That's one of my favorite things from Miette but apparently they only sell it at the Ferry Building location. Sadness. They do carry a few of their ice cream sandwiches (but not my favorite, lavender). They also sell other artisan chocolates in their shop that are really good as well. Take a chance! They're delicious!

Items I've tried from Miette:
Carrot Cupcake
Gingerbread Cupcake
Gingersnaps
Pistachio Macaron
Hazelnut Macaron
Rose Geranium Macaron
Chocolate-Lavender Macaron

All items are really good. Not THE best macons or cupcakes, but that's because I've tried them at so many places. LOVE their gingersnaps though!
author: Kitty K.

description: Moist cupcakes and ice cream sandwiches!  This cute candy shop is a great find.  The mint chocolate ice cream sandwich had an oreo cookie like crust and the ice cream was minty and cold.  The line was an eighth the size of Smitten's.  My boyfriend and I ate a caramel while waiting in line and we got this deliciously moist ginger cupcake with buttercream frosting.  There are so many other chocolates and jellies and cutely displayed in glass jars and raised cake trays.  Next time I'm going to try a macaron.
author: Elise G.

description:
Sorry Old Fashioned. 
I came back for you, 
but my eyes caught another.

Gingerbread Cupcake with Cream Cheese Frosting.
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/JPOZ0Uv4UFAjewz9qvIHbg?select=HsN_NVAUg5Ff9gtr9xO97A)
I couldn't resist.

First bite, 
the cake bursted with spices and flavor.
Ginger, cinnamon, nutmeg and more.

With the cream cheese frosting, 
slightly sweet and light,
combined to tantalize my tastebuds.
author: Marti L.

description:
I bought a chocolate cake filled & frosted with coffee butter cream for my boyfriends birthday.

Now my BF is very picky about his sweets because he does not like a lot and if something is too sweet, he will not dare take a second bite.

When I cut him a piece of cake, he absolutely LOVED it! Normally he likes to just have one piece and give the rest away, but he refused to give this one away! I told him he wouldn't eat it all and we basically argued for a good ten minutes about it, resulting in me just telling him to keep all of the cake.

I wanted to try the macarons in the glass jars but had already bought a 12 macaron box before going to miette:(. Next time!!!
author: Ann Z.

description:
My Bf and I were strolling around Hayes Valley last Sunday when I saw a sign for Miette on the corner of Octavia and Hayes.

I said: "oh, this is Patty P.'s favorite candy store!"

Bf: "who's Patty P?"

*He has this confused look on his face *

Bf: "are you being an elite snob again?!"

He didn't hear my response because I was already walking ten steps ahead of him.

As I entered the store, I was greeted by a multitude of colors:  soft pinks, pale yellows, baby blues, light lavender.  Lots of frills everywhere.

CUTENESS OVERLOAD!

Pillowy macarons piled in clear jars, perfectly frosted cupcakes, cookies, chocolates and candies imported from Europe, marshmallow sticks and ---

a whole wall dedicated to licorice.

I'm not a fan of licorice per se, but my curiosity was piqued. There's licorice imported from France, England, Belgium, etc.  These are sold by the pound and there's over ten varieties to chose from.

TIP: the licorice from Belgium is made with ammonium chloride. (ok chemistry geeks: NH4 Cl) instead of the traditional salty taste of the ones made with sodium chloride.  If you're feeling sleepy because of your carb-filled breakfast from Stacks next door, get the Belgian licorice. 

You can always use a little bit of ammonia, right?  =P

Service was polite and amazingly enough, I only walked out with a Rococo chocolate bar (infused with rose oil -- I liked this!), a few macarons and caramels.  

After all, this was my second trip to Miette in a span of two days.  Even that's a bit excessive for me.
author: Janice C.

description:
The interior of this charming little shop reminded me of  a movie set----somewhere in between Willy Wonka and Chocolat!   I've never seen such a display of sweets!  Everything from hard candies, licorices, lollypops, toffees, brittles, nut confections, to cupcakes and macarons are all here.  I didn't have enough time this day to really explore this place, so I went for something small----a package of Turkish Delight, those gelatin based fruit flavored squares liberally dusted with powdered sugar!  Yum!  They were delicious!

It's the perfect place to go if you are looking for a unique gift to take back to someone.   The treats are all nicely packaged and displayed here----and all very tempting to try!
author: Mary A.

description:
I'm so sad that I never visited Miette in San Fran but was SO excited to see them at the Super Duper Market in NYC! =D

Great props to the staff on being so helpful with suggestions!

Their shortbread cookies are AMAZING. There is definitely a nice subtle flavor to them. I fell in love with the lavender shortbreads & the walnut shortbreads.

You are on my To Go list when I visit the Bay Area again. Ch'yeahhh Miette!
author: Olivia S.

description:
Must get the Gingersnaps! I wasn't sure if it was good when I got it so I got one container to bring back to NYC for my family. After I tried it back home. I wish I bought more! They're so good!!!!

The macarons are good too! They have good flavor and are moist.
author: Samantha K.

description:
This place is really cute, with a ton of yummy goodies.  I came here the first time to try their macarons.  They weren't bad, but definitely lacked a bit of flavor, especially compared to the store down the street that had tastier ones.  
However, while their macarons were a bit lacking, the Gingersnap Cookies made up for it.  They were simply delicious.  I love stuff with ginger, and these cookies definitely had a strong flavor of ginger.  If it weren't for the price, I would probably come here all the time to stock up.
author: Karen L.

description:
Vlad was awesome - super helpful! Definitely made my money and time feel well spent with his customer service alone. Of course the cupcake was delicious too. So moist! Details in the next paragraph. 

The sweets were on the pricey side and I almost rated this place 4 stars for it but after eating the cupcake I bought and received great customer service from Vlad, I forgot my care for how much I spent. I got an Italian Meringue Chocolate Cupcake for myself and bought a few packs of cookies as thank you gifts.

The shop is cute and brightly lit. There is no shortage of variety here. 

Will be back!
author: Tammy H.

description: I've been to the other Miette locations a few times, but this was my first visit to their Hayes Valley location. They have a large assortment of cute but also tasty candies. The items can be on the pricier side, but they're usually not items you can easily purchase in other stores. Their gingersnaps are amazing and a must purchase (even if you normally don't like gingersnaps- they're that good!). My bf ate the Carrot Cake Cupcake, which he thought was amazing- not too sweet but nice and moist, with a delicious cream cheese frosting. I'm also a fan of their macarons (aside from the floral flavored ones) since they don't use dyes to color their cookies. Parking can be difficult in Hayes Valley, but I will definitely be back to Miette if I am in the area.
author: Amy D.

description:
This is every sweet tooths heaven. There are so many beautiful and colorful candies everywhere. Everything is so pretty, I have a hard time telling if some thing is on display or if they are purchasable.

Although the hard candies and chocolates are calling out to me, the sole purpose of my presence in this heaven is to try their macaroons so I looked at them in their glass jars and got myself vanilla, rose, hazelnut, and one more that I can't remember! Of course I didn't eat them all at once. I enjoyed the chewiness of the pastry and the smooth layer of cream. The pastry is lightly glazed with a layer of hardened sweetener, not sure what it is, it's almost like a glazed donut.

It satisfies the sweet lover in me, but I can't get pass my 2nd one. So sweet.....
author: Elaine Y.

description:
This is one of the few places around that doesn't use ganache in their macarons, but instead uses buttercream frosting--which, for us lactose intolerant people who can only handle butter is very good news!

I tried one of the 6 flavors they had that day, and all were very satisfactory. If you're like me and took some back on the 7 hour drive to Los Angeles, you may find that the frosting doesn't hold up as well as you might hope. No matter though--the deliciousness will remain intact! I will have to find a way to get these to be closer to me without transporting them by car. I'll let you know when I do so you'll be able to experience it too!
author: Lynne S.

description:
I stumbled upon Miette because I was around the neighbor and decided to stop by. 

At first glance, this place is such a gem. Very very cute decor! From the pink awning outside, and all the candies in the jars, I really was loving this place!

I felt like a kid in a candy store (literally). They had so many different varieties of candies. They even had overseas candies that I have never seen in my life! Turns out, they're big in English candies that they specially get imported from England.

As much as I loved their display of candies, I was in there for only one thing, MACARONS! And to sadly to say, I was highly disappointed. First, I know it's all food coloring, but I like my macarons colored. Not only for presentation looks, but also to differentiate the flavors!! When I gave the cookies to my host families, they all kept asking me which flavors were which and I had no idea because they were all the same colors!! Also, the flavors were nothing too great. I love different varieties of macaron flavors from passion fruit to green apple but they only had like 8 different flavors normal and not any great ones either.
