While eating them during coffee with my hosts, the flavors were a little too underwhelming. Too light in taste and after awhile, tasted like all the same. Couldn't tell if it was coffee or chocolate or vanilla.

Anyways, I wouldn't recommend this place for macarons unless you want some exotic candies. I'm sure there are better bakeries that can make better macarons.
author: Hanna P.

description: I ordered a came for my birthday. The vanilla tomboy. It was very good until I found a hair in it...
author: Ashley E.

description:
It's a candy store that the female version of Willy Wonka would absolutely kill for. I've got a great gift for rhyme (yes, yes, some of the time).

We came here late in the day in search of cupcakes or macarons, but being so late, there were slim pickings. Don't worry; we satisfied our macaron fix the next day at Miette's sister Patisserie in Ferry Market.

As for the Confiserie, we picked up the best ice cream sandwich I've ever had, blackberry ice cream in the middle with chocolate ends.

it's next to Patricia's Green, which features an incredibly creepy statue that makes eating an ice cream sandwich somewhat disconcerting.

The sandwich, yum. The prices are steep, though.
author: Jeffrey C.

description:
Their beautiful, pastel displays and amazing assortment of candies make me want to spend all day there. I always have to stop in to get some of my dad's favorites- ginger snap cookies. They are extraordinarily spicy!
Miette offers the best of sweets, everything from old fashioned candy, fancy confections from all over the world to their own house made cakes. I think their newest addition is ice cream- something I definitely would have remembered from my last visit. 
They now carry mast brothers chocolate- a necessary indulgence.
The prettiest candy store I've ever been too- I've yet to try any of their cakes.
author: Margaret H.

description:
I felt like a kid in a candy store, because that's exactly what this place reminds me of. They had all sorts of glass jars filled with different candy and chocolates. Specifically, I came here to try their macarons because I needed to compare them to the ones from Paulette. I tried one hazelnut macaron and it was good, but not as good as Paulette's. They are a bit bigger in size, but the appearance and texture of the macaron is like a cookie. Where's the nice semi-crispy shell? 

I really like the decor of this place. You see a lot of contemporary bakeries these days that focus on one specialty item like macarons and cupcakes and their stores all start to look the same (e.g. Sprinkles, Kara's, Paulette). I haven't really seen a place like this yet. They also had a giant chocolate bunny in the glass counter on display that reminded me of that episode of The Simpsons when Homer was dreaming he was in Candyland and he took a bite out of that chocolate bunny that was hoping by. Good times.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
Walking into Miette is like walking into a little girl's dream candy shop except with adult preferences - Not those kind of preferences, get your mind outta the gutter! They have chocolates from around the world and super adorbs hand wrapped candy flowers. 

However, on my quest to find the perfect cupcake, I tried their gingerbread cupcake and was sadly disappointed! Food Network, how you break my heart! There was a decent molasses taste, but I prefer a slightly stronger ginger taste and the frosting was overwhelming the cupcake. Maybe less frosting or more flavor in the cake part? Also, the cake was oily! Not cool! 

Oh the bright side, even though my initial first bite/impression of their gingersnaps was that there was too much butter, my second impression is that these are highly addicting and proceed with caution. While some of the cookies have too much butter and not enough ginger, other cookies in the box hit the spot with the right amount of ginger and butter!
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Hi everyone, my goal is to taste every single Macaroon and cupcake store I encounter, so that means I've tasted a bit of macaroons and cupcakes in my part and so far found that this place makes the best cupcakes ever! Their macaroons are amazing too, but there are others that are at the same delicious level.

The unfortunate thing is they don't have much variety as much as others such as Cako's, but even then, the one you will chose will not disappoint you! Pricing is decent too.

Their Macaroon's are amazing! The outside shell is a little bit crispy and when you bit deeper into it, your teeth sinks into a smooth, and softer texture where the flavors will then just pop in your mouth and slowly indulges the rest of your taste buds with creamy sweet goodness! Not a lot of bakeries can get the texture of macaroons right, but this place got it!
author: Elaine N.

description:
Chewy, awesome, decadent, fabulous, perfectly crafted MACARONS, y'all!!!!!  Yes they are!

Rose geranium are my favorite, and my birthday is in September.  Just so you know.  *hint hint*

ALSO wonderful about Miette-

The place itself is ADORABLE!  And spotlessly clean.  Everything is packaged so prettily.  The hosts and hostesses are always smiling and in good spirits (although I would be, too, if I worked there!).

I also love the chocolate-covered toffee, chocolate-covered caramels, ginger snaps, and cupcakes.

But nothing in the WHOLE WORLD gets better than the MACARONS!  :)

September.  But really, anytime is a good time to gift me a couple yummy macarons....  Just saying.....
author: Marisa D.

description:
If the point of Miette was to look beautiful, I'd be giving this business 5 stars.  However, that's not the sole purpose of the business.  

I won't beat around the bush:  I was very disappointed in the cupcakes, which were heavily touted by online reviewers I'd read.  I found them bland, flavorless, and overpriced.  I especially disliked the chocolate cupcake, which was overly sweet and lacking in much chocolate flavor.  Also, the size of these cupcakes is a little bit smaller than average, so for $3.25, you wonder what makes these worth so much more money.

I also purchased one of their mini-Scharffen Berger cakes, for $6.  It was quite a bit better than the cupcakes, but still doesn't make it to my mental list of favorite chocolate cakes.  I saw that the larger size 6" cake was $35 (!!!!) and nearly fell over...um, a wee bit pricey for what it is!!!

For those of you who love cute candy shops but require disability access, know that this place is NOT WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE:  there are steps leading into the front door.  What a shame.  

Overall, I was not impressed by my experience here.  Sure, it's pretty to look at, but at the end of the day, you came here to get something tasty to eat that you can't make better at home, right?
author: Amy L.

description:
This place is only good for their happy hour macarons. 

But other than that, all their other goodies are just very overpriced.
author: Kelly T.

description:
This place is so adorable looking, retro, and clean!

Unfortunately, the guy who was helping me was probably the least helpful employee I've ever had. He kind of just waits for you to say something first and if you don't he'll stare and say "hi, what do you want?" in a really emotionless voice haha it's a little awkward. I asked what he liked and he just looked and me confused and said "I don't know, I don't really eat them," then when I asked what cupcakes were the most popular he yet again looked at me confused and said "uh, I don't know. let me ask my manager." Customer service really makes a business and this guy couldn't even properly handle basic questions he probably gets asked everyday working at a little bakery and greetings he should be routinely doing with every customer.

Besides the customer service, I bought two cupcakes: carrot cake and a vanilla with raspberry buttercream. The packaging and decorations were so perfect and simple, I was really really pleased.The carrot cake was really dense and oily but the flavors were pleasant. The vanilla cupcake I have nothing bad to say about, it was really good.

I wish I could give it a higher rating because Miette has such awesome little chocolates, german candies, and great baked goods with really great flavor and it is just so stinkin cute looking but the customer service was just nonexistent.
author: Ellen Y.

description: Super cute bakery - love the decor! This was my first visit from the east coast and I wanted one of everything! I wound up with a package of ginger snaps and a pumpkin macaron. The only complaint I have is the price. :)
author: Eva B.

description:
A cute little store in a quiet area. A good drop by if you want to get some cute little edible gifts for people. They wrap everything with a lot of care so I could imagine making a great gift basket out of these. 

I bought a lemon debutante, which is a lemon buttercream cake. It was alright, I think the cake itself was a little drier than I would have liked it but the tart lemon filling was good. I probably wouldn't pay this price again for the cake. I'd probably try the tomboy the next time I come by, have heard good things about it.
author: Chloe Y.

description:
Obsessed. Completely, totally, utterly obsessed. In like. In LOVE. In passionate, passionate love with Miette.

What can I say? I'm a sucker for candy, baked goods, delightfully girly packaging and the color pink. Miette delivers on all fronts.

Walking in will send your seratonin levels soaring. There is just no way you can come into this shop and not be happy. The packaging and placement is perfect. Candies, both nostalgic and whimsical, wrapped up in cellophane and stuck with the "miette" sticker to seal it. Conversation hearts, licorice bites, chocolate covered gummy bears, etc etc. All looking so pretty in their displays. Bunches of lollipops grouped together, all swirly and fluffy looking. Round ones with one color swirled with white. Long unicorn horn looking ones with the rainbow colors, slim ones on long sticks tipped with with shiny glass looking hearts, ring pops in multiple colors, some heart shaped, some gem shaped. Wafer discs of all colors bagged together, gum drops, gumballs! Jelly beans of one color filling up big glass vases. Whimsical, pink, frilly, and girly. I love it. It's Wonka's candy shop if Wonka was trying to impress a ballerina, or Glinda the good witch of Oz.

Jars lined up of loose imported chocolates and hard candies from around the world (mostly Italy and France) wrapped up in delicate papers and in fantastic colors. One in particular was described as a cloud burst. A tiny candy a little bigger than a jolly rancher. They were a dollar a piece but I had never tasted a cloud before so there you go. Unwrapped it's a white soft candy covered in sparkling sugar and...well...it tastes like you think a cloud wood. Sweet and fluffy, a little chewy then it melts in your mouth. I can't describe it but it's magical!

Marzipan treats, chocolate squares, fizzy candies, Mary Jane's. All for the picking. Varying from $.25 a piece to just shy of two bucks each. And a chocolate table! With imported Italian chocolate bars, Vosges, Mast Bros. out of Brooklyn, and other small batch confectioners in the states. Wrapping up their bars in layers of shiny paper and beautiful papers with scrolly lettering. 

Another table with their own baked goods. Plastic tubes filled with chocolate wafers, ginger snaps, etc. Baggies filled with round, puff like marshmallows, lavender shortbread, chocolate sables. Smaller tubes filled with pink and white meringue kisses. Oh the beauty of it all!

At the counter they've got fresher baked goods--macarons (the chocolate one was obscene), cupcakes, tarts, and ice cream sandwiches (which change daily. I had a fantastic little one with creme fraiche ice cream and a gingery cookie. Tart and sweet at the same time! Also--of no surprise--fresh cotton candy! Not sure how often they run the machine as it was off when I went but it was close to close so that could have explained it. Or maybe it's made to order? 

The place isn't cheap. For the traditional candies you could easily get a box of conversation hearts in a box at Walgreens for much cheaper (and for a larger amount) but sometimes it's nice to give a really fancy wrapped gift for a special occasion. Or just treat yourself to something pretty once and a while. My little cousin turns three next week so I stocked up on pretty lollipops and candies for her for her special day. Also treated myself to a few sweets for the plane ride back, and cookies and other imported candies to take home to share with friends and family. At the very least it's a beautiful place to stop into and look around in. Get a gumboil for a quarter and feel like a fairy person in Candy Land.
author: Annette J.

description:
Wow. This place has amazing selection of fun, sweet treats. I didn't try any of the pastries but did I load up on candy.
So good and so much variety. The staff was super friendly and the decor is adorable. Now the only reason for the 4 star review instead of five...you got it. Expensive! But it's Hayes Valley so I can't be surprised.
author: S. M.

description:
The candy shoppe for adults.  This place really makes you feel like it's OK to be grabbing bags of delicious treats without having to revert to being 8 again.  Perfect place to grab delights for parties or small gifts.  The cakes and cupcakes look too perfect to eat and although I've never had one you know that just by looking at them they have to be tasty.

Service here could be a bit friendlier but they seem to know what they're doing and the store is always ridiculously clean.
author: Kevin J.

description: Well....I really overpaid for some cute candies.  They were great but not $12 great.  That's cool though, I like supporting small biz.  If you are rich or need to impress someone rich, they would me appreciate some of these playful candies. I did try any of the baked goods this time.
author: Cassie P.

description: The desserts here are very beautiful, and the gingerbread cupcake that I tried was delicious, but the store is very "run down" and has not been kept up. It definitely needs to be re-painted and the floor was very dirty. I was surprised because I know the detail and care that is put into the desserts, and I don't understand why the same care wasn't out into the store front. It felt more commercialized that the Miette book would have led me to believe.
author: Cassidy H.

description:
Love love love this place. I'm like a kid in a candy store..eyes wide open and oohing and aahing over all the different types of baked goods and candies here. But my all time favorite are the macaroons!! My fave are the pistachios!! 

I came here on a Sunday afternoon via the south bay just to do a drive by. Picked up a dozen macaroons to send back to my family on the East coast. From what I hear, they devoured it within minutes of opening the box!! And of course, I had to get a few for myself for the ride back to SJ.  

Yes, it was worth a quick drive to the city just for my faves and for my favorite people in my life!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Super cute store that has delicious macarons.

I feel like their macarons are chewier than a classic style which I like a lot. 
They're not shy about making them pretty big too. 
The ganaches and buttercream fillings are lovely and not too sweet. 
It's really refreshing that they don't use any food colorings. 

Overall, I love their chocolate, hazelnut, and strawberry. Some of my favorite macarons ever, I feel they're pretty underrated. Miette is way better than Chantal in my opinion, just saying.
author: Jesse K.

description: Sweetest candy shop in the city. Perfect place to go when shopping for gifts.
author: KK L.

description:
I stopped by here just because I was in the area. 

I love going in because it's so cute inside. And it's filled with sweets! This time, I bought myself one chocolate lavender French macaron and a case of ginger snaps.

The macaron was good, but I feel like this macaron was more dense compared to the last one I ate. The cream inside wasn't quite as creamy as I remember either. The flavor was still there, but the overall quality was different. 

The ginger snaps were good too. I heard many good things about it and now I see why. The ginger taste is very strong and the cookie itself has a nice 'snap' to it. Very memorable. Probably the best ginger snap I've had. It does get overwhelming after a while though and there are a lot of cookies in one case. 

Still love Miette, just disappoint in that one macaron.
author: Sofia R.

description:
I've been meaning to try Miette for awhile, and I can finally say, I'VE ARRIVED!

I actually got lost for about 20 minutes, just trying to find Miette, since I forgot it's exact address, but once I got there, I felt like I was in heaven. Miette's storefront is very cute and being surrounded by sweets made me love the fact that today was Monday.

I bought some vanilla and hazelnut macarons, two of each, to try with my friend. I really liked the vanilla, but the hazelnut, I'm not a fan. It felt very dense and not as appealing as the vanilla macaron.

I'll be honest, I came to Miette to compare it to Chantal Guillon's macarons, but no comparisons could be made...FLAVOR-wise. Texturally, I enjoyed Chantal Guillon's more, but I still like Miette's macarons to come back for another visit.

Both shops are within a block of each other, so you definitely have to try both! But for sure, I'll definitely come back to Miette again for a sweetie fix.
author: Bonita K.

description:
I have been dying to visit this patisserie for as long as I can remember and I was not disappointed. The store is incredibly sweet and whimsical...a real feast for the eyes with its unique selection of chocolates, sweets and cakes galore. This shop is a true gem.

Pros:  They really know what they are doing here...the macaroons are chewy and true to their description.  I tried every flavor: chocolate, pistachio, hazelnut, vanilla, rose geranium and coffee.  The flavors were so pure and delicate...I could not stop eating them.  

Cons/Suggestions: Parking is tricky. Also please know that if you are a connoisseur of french macaroons you will notice the courser texture of Miette's macaroons compared to those in France.
author: Naomi B.

description: I'm a huge fan of french macarons and unfortunately this place was slightly disappointing. I had the Blue Bottle Coffee and the Pistachio one. The pistachio was well flavored but the almond flour that was used wasn't blanched and peeled. They also didn't grind the almonds down fine enough since I got random chewy pieces of almond skin. Not a huge fan... The Blue Bottle one was WAAAAAY too strong and bitter. The only saving grace for this bakery is the cute decor and the old school candy store feeling. Unfortunately the price for the candy is waaaay over priced. It wasn't anything fancy but the same candy you'd find at your local Sweet Factory in the mall.
author: Vicky L.

description:
This is like the sanrio of all things sweet. 
My purchase: 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/JPOZ0Uv4UFAjewz9qvIHbg?select=kk2icfTEBmwFiZcpPHQJjw

Found some interesting candy (forgot the name)- best described as popped disks of ricepaper filled with sprinkles. A pack costed only a couple of bucks. Not a big fan of botan rice candy, i don't like paper dissolving in my mouth, but it's a fun gift! I forgot to get some caramels! Next time!
author: Michelle T.

description: Miette makes the best awesome sour strips in SF.  They are a quality product and much better than movie house candy.  Their strips are sweet, sour, chewy soft, and always fresh.  Honestly, I only buy sour strips there, but I have tried the caramel, which is delicious, the lemon cookies, macaroons, and cupcakes.  Everything is sweet and rich and beautiful.  The store is hella colorful.  Children must think they're in sugar paradise when they enter Miette.  I patronize the Hayes Valley store, across from the park.  They have a store in the Ferry building, too.  2 locations to feed the candy monster that we are born with and still lives in us all!
author: Roland C.

description:
I have been to both Miette locations in San Francisco, but have a soft spot for the store in Hayes Valley. The decor makes you happy as soon as you walk in, with bright colors and beautifully wrapped candy and sweets. 

Their cupcakes are to die for, but I'm also a huge fan of their shortbread cookies. They also offer special treats for holidays, which helps add a classy and festive touch for any occasion. A classic parisian bakery in the heart of SF.
author: Bridget B.

description:
Nice, fancy place.  Great for gifts and special occasions.  A little too high end for casual candy shopping.

I took a star off because the princess cake is GOD AWFUL.  Princess cake is supposed to be covered in a layer of marzipan, but instead they had to "reinvent"  it and do a layer of white chocolate instead!  It's TERRIBLE.  Don't mess with what's perfect!
author: Elizabeth N.

description: Great collection of licorice and other sweets. Slightly expensive but the shopping experience is delightful!
author: Amy M.

description:
Who can take a gummi bear?
Sprinkle it with dew,
Cover it in chocolate
and a miracle or two?

The Miette man..
The Miette man can...
The Miette man cause he mixes it would love and makes the world taste good.

Now that I think about it, it's more like the Miette woman because I've never seen a guy behind the counter. Actually now that I think about it, there could be a walrus & monkey behind the counter, doing amazing cirque du soleil type tricks and I probably wouldn't even think twice about it. 

I LOVE this shop because it is relatively close to my barber so every 10 days, when I get my haircut I get to visit Miette's. Now people will know part of the reason I never break from my every 10 day barber visit. It's because of those chocolate covered pieces of gummy crack they call chocolate covered gummy bears. The BEST movie snack ever HECK one of the best chocolate covered treats period. 

It's so funny every time I visit, I feel like the chocolate covered gummy bears are up front waiting for me personally to pick them. Kind of like a child @daycare waiting for their parent to come pick them and take them home and then EAT THEM! ....I said it was kind of like a child @daycare. 

I visit both Miettes in the Ferry & Octavia often but I prefer this store. I think it just has a greater candy selection but I really only get the gummy bears. 7 more days until my next pick up. 

Even if chocolate gummies aren't your thing trust me they have a bunch of other things worth picking up.
author: Troy R.

description:
" miette, receipes from san francisco's most charming pastry shop"

Hey!  I was just at Costco in Richmond located in the East Bay.  The cookbook is out, I just got it!  It is beautiful!  The contents are beautiful inside and outside!  It is priceless!  The photographs are beautiful and breathtaking!  You will just salivate looking at the photographs and never mind making the pastries, just go out at get them at Miette Patisserie!  My suggestion is to wait until you have time and in the right frame of mind to bake Ms. Ray's easy-to-follow-recipes!  Baking is not only a science, it is an art in this case!

Go out and get it!  Pick it up at the bookseller nearest you!  Buy it at Miette Patisserie!  Buy it at http://amazon.com.  Just buy the cookbook titled:  " miette, receipes from san francisco's most charming pastry shop"!

Oh yes, I still have yet to visit this location!  It is on my "le plus must" list!
author: Chiara A.

description:
I've always wanted to try this place because of the great reviews and the super close location, but I was thoroughly disappointed. I was all excited (literally kid in a candy store kind of excited) seeing all of the different candies  and the decor of the place, but my happiness ended there. My friend and I bought a carrot cupcake, another cupcake (i think chocolate..??), and also a bag of "sour" lime candies. After our transaction we stepped outside  and sat on one of the benches and dug in. no no and no. The cupcakes were not good at all. and the candy was THE WORST. Don't label something as sour candy if it does not have the slightest sour taste to it. 

The 3 stars are ONLY for the following:
 - Cute interior/packaging
 - awesome location in Hayes Valley (love the hayes)
 - ok service
author: Hannah K.

description:
The classy and boutique appearance from the front window, initially fooled me, I though it was some furniture shop that was displaying them with attractive accents of candy.  Walking by the door, I caught the scent of freshly made sweets and chocolate treats and was immediately drawn in from the street.  Inside the high ceilings, the white walls with sea foam green trim accents create a very open and peaceful atmosphere.  The wall of candies are neatly and cleanly displayed, the tables are uncluttered and beautifully showcased.  I almost didn't want to grab some of the candies... notice I said almost...

I loved the retro kind of feel that they took in there approach of the presentation of the desserts, cakes that stood out in my mind was the Scharffen Berger cake and the Old Fashion cake with the cherry on top.  The french style macaroons were awesome, crisp and light, with a moist and flavorful inside, personal favorites of mine are the pistachio and the hazelnut.   On the tables you will see a all sort of enticing candies in a spread that was reminiscent of something you would see in a Martha Stewart magazine article, some personal favorites of mine, like the vanilla marshmallows and fleur de sel caramels.  (Both the regular and chocolate ones are awesome!)

Great place to go if you want to give cute little gifts for someone...  but also a nice little place to go if you want a little something nice for yourself...  :D
author: Chris T.

description:
Lives up to the hype. Both the Hayes Valley and the Embarcedero location never disappoint. 

Best macarons in the Bay Area!! I've tried them all. 
Love the hazelnut and the pistachio best. Always fresh never dry or stale. Organic and local ingredients are also an added bonus.

Wonderful selection of take home candies.

Professional and friendly staff.
author: Lele C.

description: These little macarons are pricey but they are like fluffy bits of heaven melting in your mouth. I feel like a little kid in a candy shop whenever i'm here. with eyes gleaming, i point to the jars that contain the flavors i want and the girl behind the counter takes off the glass lid and carefully places each cookie in a cardboard box. then after paying what i would have paid for two burritos at chipotle, i prance out of the store with a happy heart. end of true story.
author: Queena T.

description:
I love the decor of this store, super cute! It is exactly how I imagine a candy shop would be. I love how the candies were in jars. They have a pretty interesting European candy choices. Like different flavored mentos such as licorice and cola.

Service was great! The girl was super friendly and knowledgeable about where the candies are from and what was in it.  

I ended up getting two macarons but sadly disappointed. The chocolate orange flavor was ok but the texture was too cakey for me. As for the hazelnut one I got I took a bit and just wanted to throw it away... The texture was horrible and the hazelnut flavor wasn't really there...

So three star for great service and decor. Perhaps I will go back and try their other candies..
author: Katie M.

description:
Old fashion cupcake - check
Lemon shortbread - check check
Gingersnaps - check check check
Macarons - KACHING. Jackpot.

Rose geranium is the way to go for macarons at Miette's. They coat their macarons in a sugar glaze, so every bite should be savored to the last speck.

$1.75/macaron is quite the price to pay though, considering Paullete's is right around the corner!
author: Colleen M.

description:
I want to give them a higher rating, but man. Everything is so freaking expensive. Do I really want to pay that much for candy? I mean, granted, I love candy, and yes, they might be imported, but still. Even my crazy sweet tooth can be turned off by the price of these treats.

The store is very cutesy, and I adore how the treats are displayed. There's definitely a "kid in a candy store" vibe. However, I came here on a mission - to compare their macarons to Paulette's. And... well. I wasn't in love with either of them, but Paulette's won out. Miette's macarons are more cakey. That is, they're chewy, and... not macaron-like at all. Disappointment. Good flavor, but not a macaron.

Sorry, Miette's. In the macaron department, you just did not cut it. But maybe if you cut your prices... hah. As if.
author: Amy L.

description:
This place is fantastic for all your adult candy needs. I've visited here several times trying the rose and violet candies, rose meringues, and chocolate gummy bears. The Fleur de Sel Caramels are fantastic, a little overboard on the sweetness, but the flavor is spot on. I've also tried their macarons which really were great. Pistachio was my favorite and the macarons were only $1 each during the happy hour. I don't believe they have it anymore, but the deal was amazing. 
The whole feel of the place seems very pastel retro candy shop. The decor is very cute and the staff is friendly.
Everything is nicely placed out and labeled. The candies are a little pricier than most, but it's worth it!
author: Veronica L.

description:
I am licking my lips as I type this review:

Visiting Miette is a very smart post-brunch option, It is both visually, and tantalizingly the perfect sugary-pick-me-up for after a mimosa brunch.

Rose & Vanilla macaroons were both chewy, light, savory and delicate.
And oh my, happy hour for macaroons..
author: Ty T.

description:
If you are as addicted to sweets like I am, please do yourself a favor and pay a visit to Miette. 

I first discovered the greatness that is Miette from the ferry building down at Embarcadero. When I walked into the Hayes valley store today, I was in complete heaven! 

My favorites are the macaroons of course! They are crispy on the outside and oh so fluffy on the inside. The cream fillings are amazing, and with flavors like rose and chocolate lavender, I was sold. The store is filled with beautiful displays of candies, gourmet chocolate bars, a variety of cookies, and gorgeous cakes and cupcakes. This place is heaven if you have a sweet tooth- hands down one of my favorite shops in San Francisco!
author: Megan K.

description:
Went here yesterday.

Split a vanilla and chocolate lavender with my friend, and brought home a hazelnut for my dad. 

I appreciate that they don't use artificial coloring and they were pretty big compared to the macarons in LA. 

The store also sells cupcakes, mini-cakes, candy, etc. but we wanted to try Chantal Guillon around the corner. I'll definitely be back to try what I missed. :)
author: Dahlia S.

description: This place is like a upscale child's dream heaven of sweets. Why are you so cute and expensive at the same time, Miette? My friend bought me a tiny chocolate marzipan bar for $5. Not worth it. OVERPRICED. It's 1/3 the size of a normal candy bar. This pretty little store can rob you. STILL I had to give it four stars, because I can tell you that the chocolate ice cream sandwich was worth it at $5. And the Mini Scharffen Berger cake was also worth it for $6.50. My friend isn't a big dessert eater, and is very picky about his chocolate cakes, but was in love with this one.  Eating those two things, made me forget about that stupid marzipan bar, which really should have been a $1. Anyway I'm over it, and I'm happy with the chocolate ice cream sandwich and the mini scharffen berger cake. Yummy!
author: April D.

description:
The store is filled with all types of candy and sweet treats!  Candy in large glass jars on the shelves..some individually wrapped on tables..cookies .....cupcakes impeccably frosted sitting behind the glass counter! Oh how they tempt!  All the candy colors of the rainbow!  Soooo pretty.  

My friend and I decided to try their chocolate cupcake, frosted with OCD perfection, topped with a red jellybean.  I also had to try their large round gingersnaps encased in a plain round plastic.  Unfortunately, the cupcake's frosting, even though completely upright during the trip home slid right off the cupcake; leaving some of it on the wrapper, and not in our mouths.  The chocolate flavor was not that intense, rather average.  The gingersnaps' flavor is excellent!  They are quite gingery, without being overly spicy, with a hint of orange and butter.  Unfortunately the ones I bought tasted like they had sat on the shelf for a week.  They were extremely hard..and not crunchy; just hard.  I don't think I will buy any beautiful treats from them again. :(  The people were really nice! :)
author: Delicious B.

description:
Really cute store, all whites and pastels, filled with containers of bright, pastel colored candies. The store looks like the bedroom I wanted when I was a little girl.

Came here with a friend especially to try the macarons. We were underwhelmed. She got the pistachio, I got the lemon. Mine tasted faintly nutty, not very lemony. My friend said the pistachio was fine, nothing to write home about. We both weren't fans of the filling--the consistency resembled that of a whipped cream frosting on a cake. 

Service was meh. We stood there, staring right at the two girls who decided it was more important to finish gossiping and giggling about the customers they helped right before us. Then, one of them walked over and just stared at us expectantly. No, "Can I help you?" or any other greeting. Not even a hello. I hate bad service.

Not coming back here.
author: Evelyn C.

description: Love the decor and layout! The macarons didn't disappoint. The staff was fast.
author: Connie T.

description:
I was hooked on French macarons ever since the hubby and I honeymooned in Paris a few years back. I've been looking for something like it in the Bay Area, and I'm happy to say that Miette's macarons come close to the real thing.

The hazelnut, almond and rose geranium flavors are great, but I really go there for the pistachio macarons. I can eat 10 in a minute if they weren't $1.50 a piece -- just kidding.  These macarons are soooo good, you'd want to savor every bite.  They're much better than the macarons sold at Cocola's and are definitely worth a visit.
author: Dawne L.

description:
If Zooey Deschanel had a candy shop, it would look like Miette in Hayes Valley.

Everything at Miette is cute and dainty with hand written price tags; some tags missing, and it's not the sort of shop you want to call out and ask how much something was. Tastiness is almost guaranteed. 

But was it tasty enough for the steep price tags?

Perhaps not when the two ladies working at the shop couldn't even crack a smile selling sweets. Like, come on now.
author: Joyce L.

description:
Never tries macarons so I decided to try this out while visiting fam. 

Place is really cute and dainty - something you'd instagram about...

Okay first off - $1.75 for those little things, holy. But they were good but that pricing is just too steep (I know cupcakes go up to $3 each but they're 3x the size). Pistachio was on point but lacked variety of different flavors. I really didn't taste much diff between the 3 different pistachio flavors, vanilla had no taste whatsoever. I felt cheated with the filling as if it were too airy and added no substance but since these were my firsts, I had nothing to compare by.

The major thing that put me off, and I agree with more recent reviews, is the two awkward hipster female workers. Light weight creepy how they arose from behind the counter just starring. One started assisting me while the other silently slid back down to her coffin. There were no formal greeting just pure silence, I even asked questions and the child was barely audible in response - I probably disrupted their facebooking time, but it killed my excitement of finding this place and receiving this type of service. My sister even mentioned it on our way back home about the awkwardness and how she felt judged...

Overall:
Decor/Macarons/Location - 4/5 GOOD!
Children of the Corn staff - 1/5 HELLA PASS!

There's another shop down the street that sells macarons too, I will try that place out next time - hopefully the staff is better.
author: Celia Z.

description:
Love the macaroons and the variety of chocolates, candies and cookies.

The media had previously announced that this store was closing to concentrate on their upcoming new store in Jack London Square. Don't worry, it's not closing for good. They closed at 3pm today, and will reopen January 7th, 2010.
author: Luis C.

description:
What a splendid and delightful discovery this was. I could have spent hours in this place looking through all their fun and creative candy assortments. Their macaroons and cupcakes looked absolutely divine but being on the never ending diet that I am I settled for a piece of french chocolate with hazelnuts and almonds (wish I could remember the name) that was just heavenly. 

There was a woman next to me picking up her order of cupcakes they made especially for some sort of party she was throwing...they looked amazing!! 

It's a good thing I don't live closer...I'd stop by every night for a little treat!
author: Kristy M.

description: The review is solely for their macarons. Literally the BEST macarons I've ever had...and I've tried a lot, including the infamous Laduree--albeit the NYC location and the macarons were a day old. The thing is, even several days after storing these in the fridge, they still taste perfectly chewy and scrumptious as opposed to being hard and nasty like other macarons I've had. It doesn't look that pretty because there's no additional colorings to these, and they certainly look homemade, but who cares!! The store itself is really cute, and have a wide selection of sweets, but I didn't even bother to look around because these macarons are honestly the only thing I care about here.
author: Tram L.

description:
I was super excited to want to try this store in SF.  My sister bought me their cookbook and I've been wanting to test out some recipes. 

The store itself is adorable with a really cute decor and cake decorating supplies.  The cupcakes are also picture perfect that you can't say no to them just on looks alone. 

After ordering their Chocolate with Italian Meringue and Carrot Cupcake with Cream Cheese Frosting, I was super excited to dig in. 

I was really disappointed though as the cake is not moist at all.  It was dry for both of the cupcakes tasting almost as if they were a day old and the cake was lacking in flavor.  The cream cheese frosting was pretty amazing as to how stiff they got it to be.  I've been working with cream cheese frosting forever and can never get it to be stiff to stay put.  They did it in a way where it looks beautiful but again, the taste is lacking.  The cream cheese flavor was barely there and there is so much frosting that it becomes way too sweet. 

The Italian Meringue was also way too sweet and didn't go well with their chocolate cake.  

I was pretty disappointed since the cupcakes look so pretty but don't be deceived by the looks.  The taste was just not there for me.  Maybe I should've tried a macaron instead.
author: Stephanie H.

description: This place is always a pleasure to visit. Right now, they have the biggest selection of licorice I've ever seen. The clerk assured me that they each have their own unique taste. I decided to take her word for it because it's not my thing, but I loaded up on the fleur de sel caramels (both plain and chocolate) and French pastilles my Mom and I love.their baked goods are divine. We always have their gingerbread cake for the holidays and my brother-in-law is addicted to their mini lemon poundcakes. Needless to say, I had to take a cupcake home. Even if you don't eat much candy, the colorful displays, friendly staff, and happy aura is sure to put a smile on you face. Miette is a must-visit place in Hayes Valley.
author: Nicole M.

description:
Did a taste test comparing macarons from Miette to Chantal Guillon. Forget the artificial coloring and flavors at Chantal Guillon, Miette is a clear winner in the taste department. Definitely not subtle, but they do a good job with bringing out the natural flavors. 

Favorites: Grapefruit and Pistachio (nice and light)
Rich: Hazelnut and Chocolate (good to try, but too rich/dense for me)
Okay: Rose and Vanilla (good to try, but not my favorite flavors)

Best deal: Happy Hour from 5-7pm for $1 per macaron (maximum: 6)

Will likely come back.
author: Ann B.

description: Macarons are amazing. My favorite are the hazelnut, but honestly all are delicious. Be sure to get them at "macaron happy hour" from 5-7pm (2 hour happy hour!) for only $1
author: Vanessa G.

description: Finally tried the schaffenberger cake, excellent texture and rich chocolately savor. Loved the candy flower atop. Holiday candy is half off right now but i stuck wuth my honey bee licorice and sour fruits. Picked up the gingersnaps because they are my favorite cookie, crisp, chewy and full of gingery bite. Service top notch as always.
author: Kelly K.

description:
As I watched my friend buy a French marshmallow, I rolled my eyes at her.  "Please tell me you know what you are buying."  I wasn't going to let someone pay $3 for a marshmallow!

BUT.  After I took a bite; my taste buds experienced a food-ecstasy!  It was the BEST marshmallow of my life.  I might even consider skipping two macarons for one of this!
author: Hyun S.

description: :-(  I was disappointed with the Tom boy cake. It had some great reviews and was nothing special. Yes it looks very cute but tasted nasty. For $30 I could get the same tasting cake at Safeway. It was dry and not moist. The frosting was thick.  I would maybe come back for something other than their cakes.
author: Des A.

description:
I'm not a candy person, but I ended up in Miette for way longer than I expected.  They have the cutest, tastiest candy (retro/European/modern) selection in the city.  This is a great spot to pick up some treats, a custom made cake or gifts with the SF city girl flair.

I started getting sad as I was eating my treat and it started disappearing. =(

Kudos for being the neighborhood Willy Wonka store and brightening up Hayes Valley.  I must have overlooked this spot back in the day due to the park area being constructed.
author: Jenny K.

description:
This place is definitely money, unless you take advantage of their after work special, where they sell their day long macaroons at $1 a piece. The store is nicely designed, somewhat too candy land for my taste, but I could see the appeal. 

The customer service is generally good, except for one time where the salesperson must have been having a bad day, and wasn't too nice, but everyone has those days. 

All in all, the products are tasty but not tasty enough to merit the prices for essentially cookies and cupcakes.
author: Michael H.

description:
SIGH!!!!!!!   That's the name of one of the delectable candies at Miette -- so called because when you squeeze it, it emits a little sigh -- that's how soft and fluffy and delicious these things are.  They come little bowtie shaped colored wrappers and come in three flavors, vanilla, coffee and something else, I forget, but those are the two that I bought.  

I eat a lot of chocolate and sweets.  There are a lot of chocolates and sweets at Miette.  The interior is like a set from a Tim Burton movie -- bright, colorful, striped and zany.  They have one wall populated with all kinds of licorice and a large table with cookies, chocolates and other goodies so tasty that it would make my cardiologist cry.  Marzipan selections are carefully picked, wonderfully packaged and are all delicious.

They have a variety of "English" style treats too -- Flakes (chocolate that falls apart in the mouth like flakes), marshmallows as long as a ruler and cupcakes of all variety and flavors.  

They also carry Parisian Macarons which are similar, but not identical, to Paulette Macarons just around the block.  Miette Parisian Macarons are not quite as light and smooth as Paulette as the baking/preparation process is different.  This is not a bad thing -- it's just a different kind of bang for your buck.  SECRET TIP:  Miette Macarons are $1.00 from 5:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m. Mon-Fri (Hayes Valley location only).  Another seasonal SECRET TIP:  Holiday candies are 50% off -- so get your fill of Santa Claus and Mrs. Claus chocolates and candy canes while they're still in stock.

The staff at Miette is excellent -- friendly and knowledgeable and appear to have tasted everything in the store.  A job I wish I could have on the side.  I would pay them to be the taste tester!

Miette is not cheap, even for Hayes Valley.  Several small packages of chocolates and pastries along with this and that can add up pretty fast but ultimately, it is definitely worth it.  They have so much variety in this place that if I go back every week for a year, I will be able to get something new and different every time.
author: Paul N.

description: This place is so colorful and cute. I can't believe I've been to Hayes Valley this many times and not noticed it until my friend told me about it. I didn't have much time to look around, but from the looks of it, they had jars and jars full of different candy. How do you even choose?! They also have baked goods such as cupcakes and macarons. I bought a few macarons and they were so good! Not too hard or too soft, they were perfectly chewy and flavorful. I liked all the flavors I tried and will be back to try more when I'm in the area!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
This place reminds me of an old candy shop, the walls filled with glass jars of different sweets and such. Nicely packaged cookies and the big display of cakes and cookies.

Ive ordered a cake here and had to make a last minute change to a bigger cake. They were very accomadating and helpful and made sure I got the right size. 

My friend Jeffrey went to pick up the cake...he saw an ice cream sandwich and decided to get one..he ate it right then and there while waiting for the cake. He left and a min later he walked back in to get another one. Either he just really likes ice cream sandwiches or it was just really that good. I thought it was funny cause he said to me "you punk, I went in there to pick up a cake and ended up eating two ice cream sandwiches!"
author: phillip w.

description: I just found out they have a macaron happy hour where they're like a dollar each! I come for the macarons. I've lived in Paris and ate macarons all over the place and had the best at Pierre herme and laduree. These don't compare... But not in a bad way. They're their own species... I like to think of them as uniquely San Franciscan. I especially love the fruit ganaches... And the pistachio one of course. Over the years I've had their cupcAkes (amazing), cookies and caramels. All are wonderful. The shop delights.
author: Kiki W.

description:
I had miette at the ferry building a few years back and I can remember it tasting soft and flavorful. The miette at Hayes was different but it probably didn't help that I had Chantal guillon five minutes before.

Miette's macarons are crunchier and has flavored nutty toppings on some of their macarons. Biting into it was amazing but lacked some flavor (just tasted sugar). 

I want to give this place another try because the shop is so cute inside!
author: Linda N.

description: This store is so cute and there are so many candies and chocolate selection . Also, the cakes, macaroons and cupcakes look really good. ;)  I felt like a kid again .
author: Isabelle L.

description: The service here is outstanding.  I came in on a busy Saturday to pick up five cakes for a wedding and they made sure that all the cakes were perfect and had me check them.  They were twining them (wrapping the rope string around the boxes) and putting on stickers for which ones had to be served chilled and not.  They were pretty quick considering there was only one roll of twine and five cake boxes (I suggest having at least TWO rolls of twine available).  The girl in charge with the glasses was sweet enough to walk the cakes to my illegally parked car and helped me place them in the trunk.  THANK YOU!
author: Chris L.

description:
In my previous review, I had reviewed their Chocolate Tomboy Cake which was simply amazing!!! 5 stars. This visit was for a few of their small treats I went back for. Unfortunately, I had to drop the rating to 4 stars b/c I didn't like everything....not b/c that it wasn't good, but it just fit my taste buds. 

- Creme Fraiche/Graham cracker Ice-cream sandwich ($4): Cream Franiche...it's got interesting taste to it. Like a thick buttercream but has a slight tart taste to it. It's different...yummy...but I think I do like my ice-cream sandwiches with a more original flavors. The graham cracker was good though. The two together did make a great combination.

- Chocolate cupcake with coffee buttercream ($3.25): Oh my...this was absolutely scrumptious!!! The chocolate cupcake was PERFECT!! It reminded me of how great their Chocolate Tomboy cake was. Mmmm...great memories...*drools* The coffee buttercream was soooooo yummy!! It smelled really coffee-like as well...i wanted more than just one!!!

- Chocolate Tart ($6): The presentation of this was really simple, but you know it's good. The tart was the best part rather than the chocolate filling. It was good, but not my favorite. For $6, I think it was overpriced. 

I LOVE Miette, but it's pricing is a bit too steep for pastry. I wish I can come back on a regular basis, but I can't. I'll end up being fat and broke if so...but I do encourage it's a place you must try at least once! :)
author: Winnie L.

description: Yum.. I do like their macaroons.. Not much selection but still yum.  Chewy goodness.  The candies are good too.. Love the display of seasons.  Fun place to buy gifts.
author: Sandra S.

description:
Miette's macarons = meh. Not bad, but not stellar. The cookies are a little too thick and can run dry. And that is basically the worst thing that can be said about a macaron. Go to Chantal Guillon instead!

Other than that, the shop is cute and shabby chic. Maybe the candies are better than the mac's?
author: Sophie Z.

description:
Always love popping my head in for a few artisan candy treats.  It's great that you don't see many of the big labels or large batch stuff.  Noticed that they keep adding more of their own creations, which is always a good thing so you're not simply a reseller.

Ginger Snap Ice Cream Sandwich: Very creamy ice cream center.  Not terribly sweet but pairs well with the ginger snap.  A little dry for a ginger snap, but the moist ice cream made up for that.  Best waiting a few minutes for it to soften after getting it from the freezer.

Chocolate Mint Ice Cream Sandwich: For a drier cookie, this felt extremely chocolaty.  The mint ice cream was refreshing.
author: Adam B.

description: Such an adorable store with delicious good and candies! I come here every time I visit Hayes and enjoy looking at the items even if I do not purchase any... :)
author: Aedyn H.

description: I bought the chocolate lavender and pistachio macarons. The chocolate lavender one kind of tasted like chocolate and mint and it was just okay for me. I enjoyed the pistachio one a lot more. I liked how chewy the macarons were, but they are a bit on the pricey side.
author: Hannah W.

description:
Expensive. When you pay $1.50 for a piece of chocolate, it's called robbery. It wasn't even that good. Designed for the yappies. Not for me.

At least the staff was friendly.
author: J C.

description:
Very cute store. I was eating at stacks with the bF and I kept eyeing the place because we were literally sitting right next door. I heard a lady talking about the place about how their macarons were too chunky. That did not steer me away. Right after we paid our tab for stacks, I walked right in. I felt so giddy and much like a child again. I grabbed a basket and immediately started filling it! 

I ordered two macarons 1raspberry and 1chocolate, a cupcake, and had some candies in my basket. My bF live right up the alley way from the store and couldn't wait to try the macaron. 

... wait for it ...

The macaron was divine!! I'm glad I didn't listen to the lady. Since, it's so close to the bF's house...I don't know how I'll be able to contain myself. =)
author: Serena F.

description:
When I was about 3 years old, I used to call a toothbrush a teethbrush and adamantly justified my comment with 'but Mom, I have more than one tooth!'  
Same goes for my sweets.  I've got sweet teeth...I don't have a sweet tooth.

Miette helps this dilemma of mine.  :)

This lovely shoppe offers delicate, delicious sweets things that I dream of while in spin class.

That about sums it up.
author: Athena S.

description:
Love it!
I've only been to the ferry building one before. Can't believe the hayes valley one is even more delightful!
Bought all kinds of stuff here, candies, cupcakes, macarons and I got my friend the Princess cake for his birthday party, it was definitely the center of attention that night.

It's 5 stars for both the look and the taste. We bought a bunch of the candy flower for our friend to give to his girlfriend, and we have not seen her happier!

Thank you Miette!
author: Dalu Q.

description:
After brunch on Hayes, I finally made my first visit over to Miette's candy store. I've been a long devotee of the original pastry shop so this visit was long overdue. Miette Confiserie is a dream to say the least. The store is filled with imported candies in glass jars, others formed into bouquets of flowers and pretty shades of pink and pale green docorate the walls. It's everything you ever wanted in a candy store but never saw in real life, until now. 

I loved that every candy had a name card that explains a little bit about where the candy came from, what it's made of and why Miette chose to have it at their store. They do have a limited selection of pastries but they still offered a few items like cupcakes, macarons, and a few cakes. I've always been more of a pastry dessert girl than a fanatic of candy but I had full faith in Miette on the candy. They didn't disappoint!

Caramels - One of the things I hate about caramel is how overly sweet, chewy, or hard they can be. The ones Miette sells has given me a new appreciation for caramel candy (even though they don't made them themselves). They're made with local and organic ingredients and you can taste the quality. The multiple flavors just melt in your mouth. It was buttery sweet, nutty and even hints of fruit that went down so smooth. I'm sad I only bought one!   

Petit Fours - These little cakes are beautiful. It's covered with white chocolate and hints of lemon flavor and is topped off with a real sugar flower petal. The name tag said they're only available during holidays so I assumed they had some left from Mother's Day. Perfectly fresh and delicious!

Chocolate Malt Balls - I had to get a mixed bag of dark, milk and white malt balls. One bite and I knew these were not like anything you could get at Walgreens. I didn't expect how thick layer of chocolate was going to be but it was so good. I love that there was probably more chocolate than malt (though there was a good portion of each).  

I have one chocolate foiled candy left waiting for me at home. It's a chocolate, flavored with strawberries and cream and made to look like a real berry. It's absolutely adorable, which is why its lasted this long outside of my stomach but I think tonight's the night! And I have no doubt I will be back to Miette Confiserie to replenish my new addiction.
author: Julia T.

description:
Oh Miette, how I adore thee. Every time I step through your doors I feel as though I've entered the candy shop from the opening scene of Charlie and the Chocolate Factory. 

The candy is expensive, but I'm a sucker for the marzipan, which I think is around $3.50 per piece.
author: Eliza D.

description:
Love macarons and would eat 10 of them if they didn't have 225 calories each.

I'll not go into detail about the macarons (OK the hazelnut macaron was delicious!) but what I really liked was that they carried Rococo chocolate, thanks to Kristi K's recommendation. It's dark chocolate with Lavender, Sea Salt, Earl Grey or Jasmine.  Not too sweet and just right for someone who doesn't like milk chocolate. 

Apparently they have cotton candy sometimes and I wasn't aware of this when I was there. I've got to come back one day to try the cotton candy. I'm sure it's better than the cotton candy you get at state fairs. Well maybe a little bit better.
author: Nette T.

description:
I wanted to take 10 of their pistachio macaroons and stuff them in my mouth at once and hope no one would look at me funny.  Damn people with standards.  

Drool.

THEY ARE SO DELICIOUS. GIVE THEM ALL TO ME!  MACAROOOOON. mmmmmm.
author: Sunny D.

description:
I come here for one thing, and one thing only. Miette has delicious macarons. 

I'm sure the rest of the stuff they sell is good too. Read the other reviews for that other stuff. All I'm talking about is the delicious macaron. Swoon. 

The meringue cookies are light and chewy when you bite into them. 

The fillings are delicious. They have 7-10 different flavors on any given day -- pistachio, chocolate, chocolate lavender, vanilla, etc. 

The size (larger than normal) is perfect, because, unlike a pringle, you can eat just one. And feel like you've eaten something delicious, and be satisfied. Which, considering macarons are lower in calories than a cupcake or three chocolate chip cookies, is a good thing. 

I go for the pure chocolate macaron. That's my thing. 

They lose a star for price -- $1.85 is a bit steep, especially if you're bringing them to a party for dessert or something. Perhaps if the price were lower, I'd eat more of them. Either way, it's a big high. But overall, a great, great thing.
author: Tom P.

description:
This store looks like it came straight out of a fairy tale about sweet shops, including the girl working behind the counter haha!

The only thing I got were macarons, so I can't speak for their other sweets, but YUM! I've been eating wayyy too many macarons from Sucre in New Orleans, and swore off eating them, but these looked SO tempting! Unlike really colorful macarons that seem to be drenched in food coloring, these looked so wholesome, with the outside cookie the color of actual almond flour, and the cream inside just with a touch of color from the ingredients used; they taste really wholesome too ^^

$1.75 for each, and such a reasonable deal compared to the price of Nola, and the macarons are big too!

Hmm maybe it's cause I just LOVE Nor Cal too much, but everything just seems so good...
author: Shuo H.

description:
My eyes sparkled like a 5 year old stepping into a candy store for the first time.  I placed my hand on the counters, the shelves, and picked up little packages of candy, yummy gummies, and then got even happier when I saw the beautiful display of parisian macaroons.

I bought one of each flavor and a pack of grapefruit gummy.  The macaroons were light and the filling was fluffy.  

I was one happy customer :)
author: Michelle S.

description: A couple of months ago, a girlfriend of mine gifted me some macarons (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/miette-san-francisco-4?select=cMVjS_mbHMnLEJdz__HCxA#3y-4OA_NbjsjMbdseOCGxg) and ginger snaps from Miette's. My first impression was that the macarons were definitely "duller" in appearance than other macarons that I have had before, since they do not use any artificial coloring. I also thought that they only had a few flavors, but they actually had seven flavors: chocolate, chocolate lavendar, hazelnut, pistachio, rose geranium, strawberry, and vanilla. The flavors were pretty apparent and distinct in each macaron, especially in the light cream filing! My absolute favorite part about the macarons though, was their texture--they had the perfect crunchy exterior with a nice and extra chewy interior. It was $1.75 per macaron, but if you buy a dozen, you get one free. They have a few locations in San Francisco, and according to Conde Nast, they are one of the top ten pastry bakeries in the world! Don't miss out!
author: Lien T.

description:
My macaroon addicting is getting expensive. At close to $2 a pop, macaroons must be difficult to make or something. I should hit up Trader Joe's.

However, the $1.75 (no tax!) I paid for the Vanilla Macaroon I got here was worth it. Crispy on the outside, chewy on the inside, bursting with flavor...oh yes, this is one indulgence I do not feel guilty about.
author: Mina K.

description:
Sweets galore! The cupcakes are good, the cakes are good, the cookies are good, the ginger snaps are good, but the best part is the selection of French macarons!  

You must get the pistachio French macaron, and I suggest you don't share.  I don't think you'll want to.  THAT good.
author: Tanya P.

description:
I've been to this location twice so far, the first just to browse. I was on a macaron run a few days ago and decided why not try Miette's for a change. The small selection of macarons are in transparent jars right on the front counter (not the large wall lined with colorful jars). The macarons are $1.75 each and had some normal flavors like vanilla. I bought a pistachio and a rose flavored one as well a piece of mint candy ($.25). There was one staff member in the back working and the one on the floor was "busy" behind the counter. She seemed very tired and just wasn't all too cheery and smiley as I've come to know at any Miette location. I actually still haven't touched the macarons yet but I will update the review later.

The different candies set on the handful of tables have really nice packaging. Don't let the packaging fool you though, the price of one little bag of gummies can well cost over $3! Better signs and labels need to be in place.
author: Dominic T.

description:
C-U-T-E!!!!!!!! Walked around Hayes Valley the other day. I am always amazed how many adorable boutiques and stores pop up around this neighborhood. Each one sweeter than the next. Miette, no exception.

Very Parisian, pink, sweet, lovely. I loved the "interesting" candy selection as well as the obvious; lollipops, marshmallow fluffs, etc. They have a small but tempting array of cupcakes, too --- cute li'l ones at that.

Prices seemed quite high for almost every good I inspected. I get it; the cute/import factor ---- but til the economy is on the up-and-up, I shall save my dollars for cheap Haribo brand candy at Walgreens when I have a sweet-tooth :-)
author: Meredith R.

description:
Mmmm, cupcakes that actually amazed me! And I'm not a big fan of cupcakes.

What I liked: the store is cute with lots of colorful jars of candies, a counter with old-timey candy on it and delicious cupcakes. 
The cupcakes were the only things we ate here and we had a ginger cupcake with cream cheese frosting and a chocolate cupcake with the strawberry frosting. Both cupcakes were moist and the frostings were light yet flavorful and delicious.

What I didn't like: it smells like a perfume shop, not a candy shop when you go inside. Some of the candy in the jars is "jelly belly" and "m & ms"- what up with that?
author: dina s.

description:
I can't believe I dropped about $40 here. This place is heaven situated in front of the park behind Stacks in Hayes Valley. Pink vintage looking decor and a girly feel. 

I bought all the flavors of the macaroons, a sugar cookie, a bag of jordan almonds, Smarties (the European kind) and a bunch of other small candy.

Macaroons are too flakey and cakey for my taste. I guess I just like the manufactured uniform shape of Paulette's. I can't remember which flavors I chose, but majority was too sweet. 

They offer a lot of foreign candy here. It's fun to peruse their selections and read the descriptions of the candy and it's origin. A historic candy lesson! As expected with foreign goods, it's a tad steep in here. I wanted to try their mini-Scharffen Berger cake, but I already had a pile. 

I can't wait to go back.
author: Aileen A.

description:
My sometimes-steroidal, tunnel-vision quest for the perfect macaron makes me quick to dismiss wonderful little places like Miette. The interior of the confiserie looks like it's been spun from the very sugar that has shaped Miette's success, but after tasting their macarons I very swiftly wrote the entire establishment off. It wasn't bad.... just terribly mediocre and unrepresentative of the art form. The raspberry and chocolate confections seemed to match Miette's color palette more with their subdued pinky and brown neutral tones than slap the taster silly both aesthetically and orally with color and flavor. They're... accessory macarons, if you will.

But fast forward many months, and the sister, being the sweet human being that she is, bestows a gift of Miette's chocolate sablés. They were hardly aesthetic wonders-- they couldn't control these little buggers from smearing moist, rich brown crumb all over the cello bag. Lose your appetite? That's okay; more cookies for me. These shortbread cookies are the end-all, be-all of chocolate baked goods. How Miette has managed to cram in so much butter and cocoa into these petite, still-delicate and subtly-sweet bites with the softest, rubble-y and sandy crumb, I'll never know. And while I usually furiously covet trade secrets of the things I love to eat in hopes of replicating them in the kitchen, as long as Miette promises to keep making these buttery sablés, I won't be foaming at the mouth for answers anytime soon.
author: Nuri K.

description: This bakery has delicious macaroons,  the red velvet one especially brings me to a happy place. Thinking of it brings water to my mouth. Go try :)
author: Raymond W.

description:
ahhmaahhgaahhddd these cupcakes were soooo damn sweet. i could feel my teeth rotting away with my very first bite. my dentist loves me. 

i had to eat these with a fork, and my cupcake took me nearly an hour to finish. i also had to wash it down with a glass of hot water. the cupcakes are EXTREMELY MOIST.
author: Susy C.

description: The interior is really cute and well set up. I went during the macaron happy hour and got 6 for $6. I recommend the pistachio. Shoooooo yummy!
author: Jamie L.

description:
Usually I go Miette only get their macaron~ I had try all the favor! Every single favor are not too sweet!
But recently I become a cupcake lover... Since Tea Cake had open in Burlingame. I had been there a lot of time and already try all the favor that they have. So is time for me to try other places~~ and today I went to Miette got a Chocolate favor with strawberry cream for my sister and a Buttercream cake with strawberry cream on top for myself. Since the lady told me their Strawberry is make from fresh strawberry juice so it is not going to be sweet! YES, that is true! The cupcake wasn't too sweet and it taste good! Love it*
and I also got the Mentos candy in fresh Cola favor... omg.. if you like soda~~~~ you must LOVE that candy!! Is so...... GOOD!
author: Joyce W.

description:
This place is adorable and brings out the 5 year old girl in me. I don't even like pink and I want to live here.

Great place to bring out of town friends to get candy and small sweets, their chocolates are smooth and delicious and candies in general are interesting versions of whatever it is you loved as a kid.

We came for chocolate cookies once to make ice cream sandwiches and they were great, very cocoa packed with an amazing texture, a little expensive but I would get them as a treat. Their ginger snap cookies are just as good as everyone makes them out to be as they are like no other I've ever had - very spiced, great crunch and sweet enough to want more without getting tired.

Great place
author: Sam H.

description:
Best gingersnap cookies on the planet, as far as I'm concerned. They use crystallized ginger, and the cardamom notes are strong. A bit of spice, crunch and heaven in one bite. They aren't featured in 7x7's Best 100 for nothing.

Good macarons - not quite traditional, they seem to use more almond and the cookies are far more substantial and chewy than would be expected of a French macaron. And they're macarons, people, not macaroons.
author: Kit A.

description:
A pretty store with pretty candy and beautiful cakes and cupcakes. The cupcakes are so pretty to look at, you almost feel bad eating them :) 
It's so hard to choose just one! We left with the Gingerbread Cupcake with the Cream Cheese Frosting. It was so moist and full of tasty bursts of cinnamon and sweetness.
author: Amy J.

description: walked into this candy store while on a macaroon tour through Hayes Valley. Very cute shop - perfect place to pick up sweets for a gift or party.
author: Ali A.

description:
I love it ... those cupcakes are totally worth $3.00.  Why?  Because buying the entire old fashioned cake is like 20,000 calories which equates to a lot of burpees ... which results in salonpas ($8.00), ben gay ($5.00) and bottle of vodka ($22.00).

The presentation of gummy candy and chocolate balls in those nice glass jars makes it worth the $8.00 per quarter lb price.  Okay, just kidding, it's really not that much ... but it's really just gummy candy.  Whatever happened to Help Ur Self that was like $2.50 a lb?

Anyway, this place is darling and while I rolled my eyes hearing about someone who scraps the cheese off his McDonald's cheeseburger wrapper, I totally would have eaten the paper that my cupcake came in.  But I didn't cause I was trying to be a lady.
author: Kathleen W.

description: I would go out of my way for Miette macaroons. A friend gave a box as a gift, and they are still wonderful three days later (with the help of the frig, I think). Seriously, everything I dislike about a super sweet florescent colored macaroon has been artfully remedied by Miette- not too sweet (this is, I think, the greatest factor for me), pleasant chew, texture and taste that actually conveys real almonds (you can see them), just enough gently flavored buttercream. Yum! Excited to try other treats.
author: Nell S.

description:
This place seems to have spent so much time on decorating their store and the visual aspect of their sweets that they left little effort for the quality of their products. 

The service wasn't so pleasant either. She might have been annoyed with the customer right before us, but that didn't mean she had to continue her mal-humeur with us.

We tried the Scharffen Berger which was rich, but nothing special, and the pistachio macaron was stale.
author: Barbie L.

description: LOVE their macarons. Can't even remember which flavors I got but their macarons are a bit chewier, which I love.
author: Kayla O.

description:
Maybe I should crush a beer can on my forehead...
Or scratch the nether regions of my body in public..
Or wear a wife-beater tank and holler, "Where the f*&$ is my dinner?"
...something...anything to offset the uber-femininity of this too-darling-for-words sweets shop.

But alas, I was awestruck by the jars of colored candies, the gumdrop tree (...was it tacky of me to pick off of it?), the pink tables, the floral wallpaper. Who wouldn't be? The only thing that was missing was a kindly grandma in a Martha Washington bonnet with a little basket of free goodies. Speaking of which, where the hell were the freebies?

No matter, I was drawn to the little $5 baggies of homemade cookies, so I bought one with some chocolate shortbread cookies, sat on the park bench across the street and devoured half of them in about three minutes. Yeah, I liked them. Perhaps I'll be back when I have a hankering for something sweet. But don't bother me now...I have to belch and make lewd comments to the women passing by.

SWEETS - 4 stars...not a candy fan here but I like the bag o'cookies
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...like living in Alice in Wonderland's diabetic coma...but schoolgirl pretty, for sure
SERVICE - 4 stars...very nice...but who wouldn't be in such a fu-fu candy shop?
TOTAL - 4 stars...who can take a sunrise...sprinkle it with dew...cover it with choc'late and a miracle or two...the Candy Girls...oh, the Candy Girls can (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wRfrIrVzePc&feature=related)
author: Ed U.

description:
Cute store, lots of interesting sweet things and a great place to find little gifts, especially gifts for yourself.

I ended up buying a couple of crazy expensive chocolate bars: Michael Mischner 72% cacao and toffee ($12) and Leone Assenzio ($7). So what does a $12 chocolate bar taste like? Delicious of course, but not markedly different than any other gourmet bar especially when toffee is involved. The Leone Assenzio had a liquorice flavor to it perhaps tied to the absinthe that is supposedly mixed in.

A whimsical store, perfect to include on any Hayes walk. Oh and if you're there soon, be sure to check out the scary sculpture in the park across the street in the park... 

Happy Halloween, boo!
author: Jeremy S.

description:
I'm knocking off a star because Miette is a leeetle too precious, and it made me all misty-eyed longing for the day when I had 10 cents and a small paper bag and could molester all the pieces of candy in each jar before selecting the special one. Yes, that was after I walked to school barefoot in the blinding snow uphill both ways. 

In this era of germophobia and the like, you have to have a pretty young lady escorting you around the bins picking out your candy with sanitary scoops. 

4 shiny stars for carrying Lollyphile's lollipops http://lollyphile.com/index.php and having the Absinthe flavor in stock when I had an emergency need for 10 Absinthe pops. 

As the Lollyphile kids say on their website (watch them, they are going places!): 
"We want to make you remember exactly why you threw fits when your parents wouldn't buy you candy, and then we'd like to gently remind you that you're perfectly able to buy your own candy now."
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
Miette makes my favorite macarons. They are so chewy and sooo gooood. 

Did you know that Miette's Hayes Valley location has a Happy Hour? From 5-7pm their macarons are $1 each.
author: Veronica H.

description: Miette is a beautiful little candy shop in a really cute section of Hayes Valley. It is super expensive, but it's great fun to just walk around and look at the variety of stuff they have (good chocolate + licorice and other things) and the gorgeous packaging.
author: Robin K.

description:
I really love this locale of San Francisco! It is a quaint little neighborhood with a small shopping and dining center. 

I ordered:
Scharffen Berger : OMG... best mouse chocolate cake ever! I'm drooling just thinking about it real now!
Ginger Snaps : maybe it's just me? but I wasn't all that into the Ginger Snaps, its suppose to be one of the thing you must try if you go here...but it was decent.. not "wow, OMG I MUST HAVE!"
author: Katie N.

description:
If Martha Stewart opened a candy store, it would look like Miette Confiserie.  It's a candy boutique - a dream come true with something for everyone, from the limited chocolate edition pop rocks flavor to every Jelly Belly flavor (sold separately).  Lots of licorice and interesting chocolate bars imported from all over Europe.  

The prices are high but you can find some unique items in here.  If it is a candy that you can find elsewhere, it doesn't make sense to buy it here.  

And yes, they have top notch cupcakes too (I wish there were more varieties.  The chocolate one with vanilla frosting and sprinkles is my favorite.  Moist, rich, dainty and cute.).  Candy and cupcakes - you have to love a place that offers both.
author: Lolia S.

description: This place is so cute!! I love their macaroons and their cupcakes. The macaroons have a chewy but crispy texture and the cupcakes aren't dry and flaky. It's thick buy not too thick to the point where it's dry. The frosting isn't too sweet and has great flavor depending on the cupcake you order
author: Kristina L.

description:
After eating many macarons after my macaron quest, it still holds that Miette does it better and is way closer than Bouchon.

I had several macarons from Spruce and they do not hold a candle to Miette. I didn't realize how spoiled I was until I ate something that wasn't good. 

Oh Miette, you and your ultra fragrant, chewy macarons. You are so delicious. 

SPOILED MUWAHHAHAHAH.
author: Margaret S.

description: They don't sell cake by the slice, as they do at the Ferry Building, but they do have some tasty cupcakes, that sufficed. : )
author: Laura F.

description: Cute store, nice packaging, great customer service.  A little pricy.
author: C Q.

description:
I love treating myself here. Everything from the cakes to the cookies, but I have to say their macarons really stand out in my mind.

I have tried many other places that make macarons including many in Paris. I have to say this is my favorite. I love it especially when they've just taken them out from the fridge. They have a wonderful chewy texture with teeny bits of almond that add to it's chewiness. Plus, I like the natural colors. I feel that maybe the artificial colors and flavors that other places use compromise the flavor and texture of the cookie.

Just can't get enough.
author: Shum S.

description:
Okay..I haven't gone to the actual store yet..but I can tell you that my heart fluttered when I slipped a Miette's Marzipan chocolate into my mouth the other day. My sweet and thoughtful friends know that Marzipan is right up there for me as french fries and booze...They picked me up some treats during their visit to Miette.
I can honest say that I've never had such delicous Marzipan chocolate--sorry Cocoa Bella :-(
author: Mimi T.

description:
First, the place looks like the candy shop at the beginning of the original Willy Wonka with Gene Wilder so is a charming place to go with a child. 

Second, and I hate to do this because they don't make large batches and I have been disappointed several times before when they run out, but the macarons are phenomenal. And although I don't want to disparage the lovely Paulette just around the corner, Miette's macarons are a touch more subtle and more delectable. 

Yumm... I just finished a rose flavored one.
author: Susan J.

description:
I am torn on this place.

Now, I LOVE candy. I have one of those insatiable sweet tooths that needs a sugar fix for the sake of humanity because god knows if I don't get something sugary to suck on like NOW, then heads might start to roll.

So I was curious (especially after Laura B's review) to check it out.

OK, if the Stepford wives opened a candy shop, this is what it would look like.
It was pink. It was floral. It was cute. Too cute.
Sheepishly, I have to say that I was slightly enamored of the almost cartoonish/Willy Wonka quality of the decor....

But I have to say the candy selection wasn't terribly impressive.
