I can never visit Hayes (or the Ferry Building) without a stop at Miette for a rose macaron.
author: Catherine A.

description: The shop is lovely, I wish I could live there it's SO cute!  A friend (a 6'4" guy I know who has a sweet spot for cupcakes) recommended them for the cupcakes, but I'm smitten with the little round cookies called macrons.  Their macrons are amazing - especially the rose geranium, that's my favorite.  They'll wrap them up in a darling little box, and they make great gifts.  I always stop by when I'm in Hayes Valley or down in the Ferry Plaza, both shops are great!
author: Kim S.

description:
I like this Miette location a lot more than the one in the Ferry Building.  It's more charming, the staff is friendlier, and about the only thing more colorful inside are the customers.

My girlfriend is a sucker for the macaroons here, and after having had a few, I'm becoming a believer.  They don't leave a sugary sticky feeling in your mouth like lesser macaroons do.  Their filling is also creamy and delicate.   At $1.50 a pop, they're a bit on the pricey side, which may be a good thing.  If they were any cheaper, we'd be buying them by the dozen.

We also tried a square of the Aztec Chile chocolates.  That was one of the most complex flavors I've ever experienced.  From the velvety texture of the chocolate itself, to the varying crunches you get from the pumpkin seed and salt crystals, to the fiery spice that engulfs your mouth after a long moment of chocolaty sweetness, they're really unforgettable.

Miette offers candy to satisfy both taste and sight.  Definitely worth a pit stop if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Tony L.

description: This is truly a candy store and also sells cupcakes, macarons and cookies. It's a charming candy shop which is organized and colorful. I left this cute store with a package of chocolate shortbread with sea salt and a few macarons which we indulged at the park across the street.
author: Mika D.

description:
This is like a high end barrel candy store and I like it! My only complaint about the function of the store is that it is not very user friendly. As opposed to open barrels and plastic bags and scales, it's glass jars of candy and no obvious way to retrieve what you want. BUT, the people who work there are helpful and ready to assist.

A+ for cotton candy (although it's not available every day), Parisian macaroons, and for all the Miette confections. Not all the candy is great, but there's a large enough selection that something you find will suit your taste. 

My suggestion to them is to keep bringing in unique candy and confections... it's a place where I expect to find candy that's not available everywhere.
author: Amanda C.

description: Really cute candy shop.  Selection is essentially lots of tiny candies (chocolate, hard candies, caramels).  Macarons are good (not with the bold flavors of Chantal but the sweet / nutty kind).
author: Cathy L.

description:
This store is super cute, which made me want to buy everything in it.  However, I came here on a mission today ~ to compare Miette's macarons with Paulette's side by side.

This was actually my first time trying the macarons at this location and I thought they were actually chewier than the ones at the Ferry Building = yummier macarons.

Now, comparing them to Paulette's.  I like the chewier texture of Miette's macarons better.  Paulette's macarons crumble once you bite into them.  However, the flavors of the ganache inside Paulette's macarons are much more intense (see my review on Paulette's).

So whose macarons reign supreme?  Because my first macarons were from Miette (which led me to my obsession with them), they will probably always be my favorite.  Every time I bite into one of them, it feels like I'm transported to a different place...called Heaven *dreamy look on face*  Yummy yum yum!!
author: Katelynn L.

description:
Miette makes me feel a bit like I'm a kid, and I love it.  Perfect for little gifty treats or special occasion spoiling.

Also:  Apparently they do birthday parties there for children.  If I had gotten a party there when I was turning 8 or so, I think I would have died from happiness.
author: Jess L.

description: This place is absolutely adorable! Whenever I walk in, I feel like I'm 5 again (when you feel like you want to look/buy everything in sight). The macrons are light and delicious, and the cupcakes are yummy as well. My favorite item in the store is the Dolfin Earl Grey chocolate. Miette is only missing a star because it's a little pricey, but it's definitely worth the occasional splurge.
author: Hung F.

description:
J'adore Miette!

The cookies and cupcakes here are indeed divine--the chocolate cookies with fleur de sel being my latest love--but really, I am a sucker for cute packaging. And when baked goods in said cute packaging are made with care (and butter), even better.

Maybe there are better confections to be found around town, but if you're looking for something beautiful to nibble upon--or give as a gift--you can't go wrong here.  C'est bon!
author: Holly S.

description:
I tried their two kinds of fleur de sel caramels. The $2/piece one that the staff recommended was excellent! I can't remember the name but it was worth the $2 and much much more =)

The old-fashioned cupcake had a very light cream on top and the chocolate cake part was just perfect.
author: Angela K.

description:
As I sit in my office, a glass of ruby port in one hand and a Chocolate Sable in the other, I come to the realization that this is just the beginning of a love affair... the part where a mere whisper of chocolate will transport me instantly back to this moment, this first taste... I'll again feel the plastic under my fingers as I search for a way to open the delicate package... taste again the perfect buttery crumble of the cookie...
                    
I'll remember the times before, when we were still just flirting, exploring where our relationship might lead. The chocolate Madeleine that tasted like breathing fine, dark cocoa powder, as if breathing cocoa was the most natural thing in the world. The Parisian macaroon, delicate on the fingers and tongue, yielding finally with a gentle rush of lavender. The pure desire I felt, when I first spied the boiled icing cupcake, the Pot du Creme au Chocolate, the elegantly formed brownie.  

In one small, square instant of perfection, I will again feel as if I had never tasted the Chocolate Sable, never before walked into the Miette Patisserie or Confiserie, never known chocolate, as I know it in this one achingly divine moment.

Ours is a love affair that I pray never dies... 

As it is proper form, I will assure you, dear reader, that the experience of Miette is not limited to the consumption of their divine fare, but extends to the care they take of their customers, their store fronts, and their packaging. Attention to detail is apparent in every aspect of their business, and their attention is unwavering.
author: Meg L.

description:
it's cute, but it's eeesssspeeennnsiive.

i mean, who doesn't love walking into a little pink old fashioned ice cream parlor-themed candy shop.
..full of pretty things that taste relatively amazing in pretty little wrappings?

i mean i love it. eat it up. but for the cost?
mars bars for $2.50? damn.
macaroons for $1.75? jesus.
tiny a$$ frozen solid ice cream sandwiches for $5 bucks.

and so on and so forth.
i will however say that every time i've gone in to this location, the girls behind the counter have been more than amazing.
they're always extremely helpful, and know what they're talking about.
they're witty, pleasant and make the decision process much easier.

although i tend to only pass through here for the occasional $.25 cent chocolate, the other day i caved and bought myself a vanilla cupcake with chocolate frosting. it was wonderful, cost me an arm and a leg but it was just one of those days.
author: Jena R.

description: Love, LOVE this place. I live across town but will still make an effort to get to Miette's when I'm in the area. Yes, they are pricey, but this is hands-down the best high end treats store in the city. Their fleur de sel caramels are what keep me coming back and the rotating stock of seasonal treats is fantastic. There's always something new to try.
author: Teicho S.

description:
OMG. 
When I die, if Heaven does not look like this, I'd rather go to hell.  Everyone knows it's the cutest little place ever, so on to the treats (seriously, I live for candy - I've tried a lot here);
Liquorice; try the sugar cube looking guys and the white pastilles
Most amazing peanut butter cup - Its called a OneStar bar, or something. 
Gummy somethings - the centipedes are incredibly robust!
Those Kika cookies (dont remem. the spelling) are delicious. 

I took a friend here that use to live in Germany as a young boy, and he was constantly saying "Wow, I haven't seen this since I was a little boy in Germaaaany!" If only he was wearing lederhose when he said it.
And yes, in addition to all the candy, I want to eat up all the girls. So sweet.
author: suzanne g.

description:
Okay, so when I first walked in Miette I thought "If Willy Wonka were a 7 year old princess."  It's beautiful.  Really.  

Sometimes, on my way home from a long hard day at work, I get off the bus 8 blocks early just to wander in and look at all the beautiful candy.  I'm not even a big candy person, but something about this place just makes me smile.  Maybe it's the 7 year old princess within...
author: Kim L.

description:
I love love love this place and the nice people who work here. I'm a candy freak and this place scratches my itch every Saturday. The best place stop after pizza at Paxti's and before Blue Bottle for coffee.

i just gave you a perfect Saturday afternoon. Do it this weekend.
author: melissa n.

description:
came here during macaroon happy hour!
got the vanillas & pistachio. yum!

really good stuff here & the girls are always so nice.

woot woot...macaroons one buckaroo each!!!!
get cho maaroon on!
author: Tiger Lily ..

description:
Best place in the city to satisfy any sweet tooth.  Trust me, I am a diabetic in training and know my desserts.  
I don't care what anyone else says, their macaroons have the best flavor, texture, & sweetness; and it is impossible for me to describe in words how they make me feel. 
Don't forget to grab a few caramels on your way out...
author: Jen T.

description:
Thanks Miette for supplying my Christmas cookie platter.  Your gingersnaps, thumbprints, and macaroons were amazingly fantastic!  Mental note: great for hostess gifts and tea parties.

Your store is so pretty, I want it cloned inside my house.  From the vintage cake stands to the oh-so-girly wall paper, I love everything about this cute confiserie.  Where can I get those milk glass pendant lamps?  

Yummy confections & pretty frenchie decor . . . can I move in?
author: Noelle Y.

description: Love the macarons here! Fiancé just went to pick up some during the 5-7pm Happy Hour last Friday March 30th and was informed that it's only 5-6pm now. Weird, everyone else is saying it goes from 5-7pm....  The macarons get 4 stars but their inconsistent Happy Hours gets 2 stars so average out to 3.
author: San Francisco T.

description: This is the cutest candy store ever. There were so many deliciously beautiful candies and sweets.  I couldn't leave without trying something, so I ended up trying a few macarons.  My friend was so captivated by the store she broke her personal promise to not shop and bought goodies for an Easter basket for her nephew and mother. The staff is also really friendly--even if you were there just to look.
author: Leslie C.

description:
That cupcake was delicious! I recommend the chocalate with buttercream. Helps
to have a cup of blue bottle to was the yumminess down.
author: Matthew T.

description:
Okay Boys and girls, Ladies and Gents, let talk about macaroons. 

Miette makes theirs with crushed almonds and their delicious butter creme frosting. They aren't suppose to have a crunch. They are suppose to be a little chewy and soft... pillowy if you will. They are not traditional french macaroons, but amazing and yummy. Oh! and all organic, no dyes and artificial crap in em. 

Other macarooneries in the neighborhood are made with almond flour, changing the texture of the cookie. They also don't use a butter creme frosting. They generally use fruit gele's or denser fillings. They also are not organic, have a crunch and I can assure you are not as fresh as miettes. 

UNLESS they are a seasonal flavor from boulange, they have such a  huge turnover rate that they are super fresh.

So now that you know, hopefully we can stop comparing... take them for what they are... delicious little almond sweeties!
author: Jessie J.

description:
While I can satisfy my sweet tooth with Hershey's Kisses and Sour Patch Kids, there is something marvelous about stepping into a really fancy candy shop (or 'Confiserie,' as they call it here at Miette. I'm assuming the means the same thing). It brings out the Charlie Bucket in me.

Miette feels like it's out of a movie, where well-heeled parents take their smartly-dressed children for a treat, and then a magical rosy-cheeked woman with a bun suddenly appears and takes the children on a fantastical adventure with Mr. Snuffleupagus through a series of chalk drawings.

Dreams do come true. Especially if you have lots of money.
author: Vandana M.

description:
1/13/08 Update:  Was walking to the market around the corner to get bananas for the babe and had to drop in.  One phrase for you:  Chocolate fleur de sel caramels.  Say what?!  Yeah!
-------------------------------
Fabulous.  I walked around for 15 minutes not realizing that my mouth was gaping open.  That is until a man starting chuckling at me and commented, "first time, huh?"

Do you like gingerbread?  Cupcakes with delicious flavor combos?  What about moist carrot cake with sour cream icing?  Ok, if that's not for you, how about the simple goodness of a caramel chew?  Hmmm, colorful, flavorful jellybeans?

The morale of the story:  There's something wonderful, yummy, and full of sugar for everyone.  You will truly behave like a kid in a candy store.  

And please be nice to the diabetics and don't bring them here.  It would really be heartbreaking to witness that...

Minus one star for the high prices.
author: Tamiko J.

description:
*cough* overrated *cough* 

Yes, it is a cute little candy shop that takes cheap candies and puts them in fancy packaging to make them look extra delicious and then charges an arm and a leg for all of it. Look people, it's still just a tootsie roll or butterscotch. 

And yes, they do have Parisian macaroons, but don't fool yourself! They are not cheap and not even close to as good as the ones you'll find in Paris. If you've never tried those, then okay, I understand why you'd find what Miette offers impressive. But if you know what I'm talking about, don't go out of your way and expect you're going to find Laduree. It's like using margarine instead of real butter.

Is it worth popping into if you're in the area? Sure, if you just want to look at a cute, charming candy shop. But take a look, and move on.
author: Kelsey E.

description:
The best way to describe Miette Confiserie is to imagine a combination of Sofia Coppola's movie Marie Antoinette and Charlie and the Chocolate Factory. Tres cute AND delicious! The store is very french and old fashioned yet young and girly all at the same time. 

It's the perfect place to pick up a gift for someone if you don't know what they like (because let's be honest, who doesn't like candy!?) but be careful, some of the candy/baked goods are pricey with cakes running from $30-$50. After looking at their website I discovered that you can hold private parties for kids and/or adults in their stores. A party in a cute candy store with champagne, cupcakes and chocolate? Ummm, YES! 

Moral of the story...this place is definitely a little girl's (or a grown woman's!) dream and if you haven't been, YOU HAVE TO GO!
author: Amanda R.

description:
5 stars for presentation.  I'm a sucker for presentation and packaging.  You can wrap dog crap in pink crepe paper and I'd think it was the coolest thing ever.

3 stars for pricing.

As I've come to learn, pretty equals expensive.
author: Jen I.

description:
Too cute fancy schmancy candy shop. Loved the setup and colorful displays, but didn't want to touch anything! Everything looks so dainty - and I'm a GIRL!  I was wondering if the gummy tree thing near the door could be picked off of, but I didn't try. Coworker purchased me some round chocolate discs with white sprinkles on it. It wasn't labeled as to what it was, except for their "miette" sticker, but it tasted chocolately delicious. There were no price tags either, so I guess you get surprised when you pay? Meh...

I'll be back to try the cute cupcakes and boob looking pastries. If it cost an arm an a leg, I'll make my own.
author: Carolyn J.

description: not a big fan on there candy but love there cupcakes. I wish they would sell there pudding other than at the ferry building. Worth going to the ferry building to get it, but 1-5 times went just to get it, they didnt have anymore =(
author: M A.

description:
When I close my eyes and think of heaven/my dream color palette, I think of Miette every time. While I admit that I have a proclivity for cute wallpaper and treats, I never thought they'd come together in such a charming way.

My best friend and I discovered this place while walking through Hayes Valley and nearly pressed our noses up to the glass window when we spied this confection-filled oasis. 

While I won't pay $10 for a bar of chocolate (I walked out with a $.50 salt caramel), you can bet I sniffed some of the best smelling bars I've ever seen. Basil and Persian lime? Check. Arabic spices? Check. 

3 stars for decor (and that caramel) alone.
author: Carla C.

description:
If you can't remember why you found candy stores charming and magical as a child, go to Miette.  It'll put you in visual (and tasty) aw!

Their English toffee is to DIE for.
author: Wendy T.

description:
Like a sugar-addicted lunatic in a candy store...

Dark chocolate malt balls- I can't find them any where else.  You'll be lucky you get any because I hoard them.  I have ten pounds at my house.  They are continually fresh because they don't stock massive quantities but re-order frequently.  

The gals who work there are so sweet (forgive the pun) but who wouldn't be around all that candy?  They let you sample endlessly...

I love to head over there after brunch with a cappuccino from blue bottle for a pistachio macaroon fix.
author: Monica L.

description:
I've only been here once, so if I keep on coming here and their candy continues to be amazing, this place can move up to five stars for me just 'cause I'm definitely a sucker for sweets. 

I went here with one of my friends after we ate at this place called Fritz nearby (amazing as well). She wanted to get candy after we ate even though we were hella fool, so I was like hey why not? I always have room in my stomach for candy. 

Once I walked into the place, I was already sucked in. The only real candy places I've ever been to are probably the Sweets Factory and the candy aisles inside the movie theaters. So when I saw that the place was small, clean and super cute, I already knew I was in for a pleasant surprise. The candies were organized in neat packages in baskets and other candies were jumbled in jars. Everything was neatly spaced, not all over the place like in the Sweets Factory, and I got a really cute vibe. 

They didn't have chocolate gummie bears nor swedish fish. But the lady was so sweet that she gave my friend and me free samples of the other candies so that we would find one that we liked. I ended up buying the gummie grapefruits and the peach penguins. SO GOOD. I liked the penguins more than the grapefruit though. They came in small packages sealed with a sticker saying Miette, and I didn't think the pricing was that bad. 2 packages for $2, each containing about 6-8 pieces. Definitely come here if you're looking for friendly service and something to satisfy your sweet tooth.
author: Steph W.

description: I love their macarons here! My favorite flavors are the vanilla and pistachio. Their macarons are so chewy and have the perfect texture. It's not too sticky and it's not too hard either. Their hazelnut flavored macarons are very tasty as well. It's kind of expensive $1.85 each I believe, but it's worth trying!
author: Tida P.

description: This place is so cute. I love the rainbow wall of candy. I really like the fact that they have not only a good assortment of candy, but treats from all over the world. I found my favorite hazelnut chocolates from Italy here! The macaroons are really good too, reminded me of Laduree in Paris. I will definitely be back on my next trip to San Francisco.
author: Chantelle C.

description:
A dream come true for me!  I want every single thing in this store.  It's super cute and adorable.  

They have candies I haven't seen in decades, pretty presents, and a large selection of sweets: chocolate, taffy, cupcakes -- YUM!

I'm gaining so much weight from all the stuff I've eaten from this place today. Besides that, you should check this place out.
author: Mel R.

description:
I highly, highly recommend the gingerbread cupcake with cream cheese icing. If I were a local, I'd return to try the other flavors as well.

Expect to spend bank if you're planning stock up on confections at this quaint store. But at least you'll do so in the midst of pretty packaging, jars of rainbowy treats and some of the nicest saleswomen I've ever encountered.

Basically, it's like walking into a Wayne Thiebaud painting, and that ain't a bad thing.
author: Anne B.

description:
I don't have much of a sweet tooth, so when I'm obsessed with something sugary, you KNOW it's good!

I can't get enough of Miette's heavenly french macarons. I highly recommend this parisian cookie in vanilla - not too sweet, gooey, and perfect! Also, if it's in season, be sure to try the grapefruit flavored macaron. The staff is very friendly, and makes a great effort to get to know customers that they recognize from previous visits. The decor of this confiserie is tres chic! It brings a smile to my face every time I visit.
author: Christine N.

description:
Just the most cutest and darling place that I've ever stepped into!
Shop is adorned with beautiful pastel colors, glass jars filled with candy are aligned throughout the shop and homemade macaroons and cupcakes peek out from the counter.
Beautifully packaged bags of homemade shortbread, lavender, chocolate sable, lemon........ delectable.
Beautifully wrapped handmade caramels with bergamot, fleur de sel and chocolate caramels are definitely a sweet little treat too.

Just DAAAAARRLing......

p.s. they've got those gumsmokes, the ones that puff out powdered sugar. oh, the memories
author: Heidi L.

description:
Miette's macaroons are delicious. Amazingly, amazingly delicious. I went to Paris last year and tried macaroons in a number of patisseries, and they did not even compare to the glory that is a pistachio macaroon from Miette. 
The decor is adorable-pink stripes and glass jars full of candy on display. They have these hand-made fleur de sel caramels that are to die for, as well as violet crumble bars and squirrel nut zippers. If you come in on a Saturday, they make cotton candy (!!!!!!!!). The last time I was there, the flavor was rose geranium, but they may have changed it by now. 
As far as cupcakes, I, personally, am in love with their old-fashioned cupcake-dark chocolate cake with boiled marshmallow icing. Yum yum yum!
author: Steffany F.

description: This is a nice little candy store that any kid would want to visit.  But I was only here for the macarons haha.  I bought the pistachio and peach macarons.  I can't remember how the pistachio tasted.  Again, I offered my mom the peach one and she said it was really good.  It funny watching my mom devouring a little macaron that costs $1.75, and luckily she didn't know how much it had cost haha.
author: Cindy H.

description:
To avoid the massive amounts of shoppers everywhere on Black Friday, we decided to go to Hayes Valley to window shop, since there's generally much less tourist traffic there.  This is my first time at this candy shop, but my friend has been here before.  It is absolutely a delight!  

Jars of wonderfully flavored candies and caramels fill the space on the walls and and tables.  I decided to try a dome-shaped chocolate cake in a display next to the counter.  (I think the name of it is schlumberger?)  It was a chocolate lover's dream!  A thick outer layer of chocolate ganache covers a moist chocolate interior cake.  Price = $5.
author: Mon L.

description: we ordered five cakes online and at first i was having a bit of trouble with the advertised 20% off first online order coupon code.  i emailed and called and in the end, a week later, the code that didn't work at first, started working.   ordering online was a breeze.  the day before,  i received a call because one of the cakes was just changed due to the seasonality of the fruit.  i didnt mind.  i love miette cakes because they are so pretty and also delicious!
author: claudia y.

description:
Absolutely the yummiest cupcakes I've tasted!  I asked the girl working if the cupcakes were really good and she was a little incredulous I would ask.  After trying them (to die for) I can see why...but I'm so used to seeing these beautiful cupcakes - but you taste them and they're only ok.  

Yummy candies too; licorices, caramels, gummies, chocolate etc.

I can't wait to have an occasion to try one of the cakes.
author: Shannon B.

description:
after sampling the macarons from la boulange, paulette and miette, i must say, that miette's are my overall favorite.  the shop is super cute, and the rose macarons are my favorite.  they were my macaron store of choice because of the outside texture, which was the most flavorful and had a real nutty texture, and the ganache filling was amazing, not too sweet and perfectly balanced.  

i give them 4 stars because the store in general is a bit pricey, and parking is hell.  but their products are solid and oh so yummy.
author: Christina W.

description:
THE cutest thing ever.  

This shop is just plain adorable.  Amazing treats that are actually unique.  Cupcakes that look fake- they're THAT pretty.  Great gifts, and a wonderful place to buy favors for parties and weddings.  

I had to tear myself away from this store.
author: Sarah F.

description:
This shop is full of wonderful things, but the thing that I love the most is that you can choose to buy individual pieces from all the jars of goodies ($0.25- $1.00/per) so it's easy and inexpensive to try a nice variety of the sweets the shop has to offer.  I highly recommend the fig-filled dark chocolates ($1per); they are truly wonderful.  

It's a great place to buy a small gift or a big one with choices ranging from the normal (tootsie rolls and jelly beans) to the unusual (fig chocolate $1/per and locally made nouget $50/pound).

Go in just for the fun of looking around and feeling like a little kid in a candy store with a few quarters in your pocket.
author: Elli F.

description: Beautiful decor, cool old-fashioned candies that you don't find anywhere else, and faaaaabulous macarons. My favorite are the rose geranium and pink grapefruit. I prefer these macarons to the style found in Paris: not overly-sweet, with a slightly gritty texture from the almond flour, and a light, creamy center. Perfect!
author: Morgan L.

description: Is this what heaven looks like? My eyes literally glistened in the act of scanning the pink coated room sprinkled with sweet candies, cupcakes and chocolates along the perimeter. As i attentively waited for the Oompa Loompa's to magically appear from the cracks and crevices, i ogled all the foreign confections with gusto, and  felt myself gradually morph into Veruca Salt screeching "No, Daddy. I want it NOW!" The candy stock consisted of Zotz, French candies such as Malabar Bubble and Carambar Caramels, fine chocolates and more, but the fresh macarons made off with my heart. Standing at  1.50 each,  these babies we're the epitome of pleasure. I started off with an order of 3, yet felt as if i was cheating myself i didn't try them all, therefore I walked out with all six flavors (even rose geranium and chocolate lavender!) minus the guilt.  I can't end this review in any other way except for saying, Thank you, Miette!
author: Kelly S.

description:
SO CUTE!!! 

When showing off my lovely neighborhood, I bring my friends here and we buy penny candies for a quarter or more. Who cares if I could buy that pack of Zots for a nickel back home? I'm in the City now, and inflation abounds!! 

Cupcakes are pretty tasty to, especially the gingerbread one. Minus one star for not carrying the Princess Cake (or any cakes for that matter).
author: Miss S.

description:
This place takes you away to a childhood fairytale from which you never want to leave. With its vivid colors, exquisite molding, shelves to the sky of glass jars full of candy - what more could you want from a candy store? 

The staff is cheerful and knowledgeable and make you feel special for choosing the very rare gummy. I'm sure I'll be coming up with excuses to visit this place regularly!
author: Kim M.

description: We had the chocolate cupcake, the scharfenberger cake, and the coconut mousse cake. They were all moist and delicious - enjoyed by kids and adults alike. Yum!
author: Andrea C.

description: I feel like a kid in a true candy store everytime I step foot inside.  My favorites are the gingerbread cupcakes & macaroons. I'll usually pop in after lunch if there's still room for dessert.  Today I had both a lemon and hazelnut macaroon, topped off with a dum dum pop which last me most of the afternoon.
author: Stacey L.

description: We were lured in to this little shop by the sign on the sidewalk on Hayes. There was a fairly small, but meticulously selected variety of candy here. We found several pieces of European candy, some were yummy, some went straight to the garbage can. However, it was still really fun to try candy that isn't the usual American selection. Our favorite was the sour gummy fish. They were actually pretty sour and the gummy part was very different from the usual sour patch. I will be back to stock up on those. As we explored the store, I kept thinking that when I have kids, I will be coming here for some stocking suffers.
author: Heidi S.

description: We got our wedding cake from Miette and it was unreal. I don't even like cake and we've now made a pact to get the same cake every year! Plus, the shop is ridiculously cute, straight out of a kid's best daydream. It kinda makes me want to live there.
author: lisa w.

description: This is the place to go when you're depressed.  Nothing cheers me up like over the top cuteness combined with salted caramels and cupcakes that look like a Wayne Thiebaud painting.  The packaging design on the products here is enough to send me into aesthetic bliss convulsions.  Often I don't even buy anything.
author: Bucky M.

description:
Milette Confiserie, it''s like you're in my head!  This is exactly what my dream candy store would look like---bright and airy, big glass jars filled with candies, and everything stacked neat and orderly!  

I prefer gummy or hard candy over chocolate, but my boyfriend is a candy whore....he really doesn't care how he gets his sugar fix, just as long as he gets it.  I am happy to report that we were both satisfied after our trip here.  I recommend the gummy penguins which have a pleasant peach flavor.  I'd also like to note that the staff is so friendly and willing to assist, even when they're about to close!
author: Megan M.

description:
Going to Miette is like being written into a candy fairytale. This is my go-to gift shop because no one can deny the cuteness and tastiness of all their worldly treats. I have as much fun picking out the gifts as people do receiving them.

Beware of the Green Tea after meal digestives - they look adorable but taste frigtening. Otherwise - go nuts! Literally - the chocolate covered almonds are amazing.
author: Abby M.

description:
Wow...

Candy, Chocolate, and the fancy-fancy Confectioner.

How much should I shell out for a small and very, very tiny piece of candy - A LOT!!

However, some of it is truly worth it... and others, well - those clear candy jars, just filled up makes you want to find that Golden Ticket - as....

I WANT AN OOMPA LOOMPA, and I WANT IT NOW!!!

We ventured here after taking Nico to Stacks right around the corner.  She was thrilled... and picked up some treats for her dinner party, Gary took home some licorice, and I settled for those chocolate poker chips.

You do have to watch out for those standard candies that you are able to find elsewhere (and cheaper), but when you walk into this place, you want it ALL!

Sugar Glutenous -

I remember when Lissette gave us some of these delicious treats as part of the gifts for her wedding party... NICE!

Yes, I will venture back as this is a good place to pick up something simple and nice for someone, other than just grabbing and Abba Zabba from the local liquor store... yet, I wouldn't pass on doing that as well.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
I love this place!!!!!  I love the way I feel when I'm there.  The candy selection is wonderful.   I got a maple, bacon lollipop for my husband and tiny rose meringues for my girls. 

The people that work there are fun. They're not snooty like some of the other high end chocolate or candy shops.  A real treat!
author: Kari G.

description: Oh boy, is this place cute. My boyfriend and I stumbled in to Miette while looking for vacant retail locations nearby.  It's a ladylike little place, colorful, the kind of candy store you dream of as a kid. There are all kinds of imported treats, but what I'd really like to talk about are the MACAROONS! They are absolutely delicious, baked to perfection, and much better than Paulette's! Eeeek! This is a wonderful place for a special gift, and they have something sweet for everyone! Id recommend this cute little place to anyone!
author: Joelle B.

description: Hands down the best macaroons in SF! I came to this location recently after a yoga class at yoga tree hayes valley and promptly scarfed down a chocolate lavender and coffee macaroon. Delish!  They have Macaroon happy hour from 5 to 7p and each macaroon was $1 each. The store also sells cookies, cakes, candies and ice cream sandwiches. Yeah, this place is pricey but the items are of really good quality. So, if you're shopping on hayes st, stop by miette for a tasty snack. Of course it's calories free :-)
author: Ka C.

description: A little girls fantasy! I could go crazy in this store then go crazy again all hopped up on fashion candy! Although their cakes can be a bit unapproachable (oh its too pretty I don't want to cute into it) they are soooo good! Every bit of their cakes are handmade, so perfect and pretty, real works of confectionery art. Macaroons - DELIGHTFUL, old-fashioned candy - YUM, cupcake toppers for the bakers - YUM, real marsh mellows - HEAVEN!
author: Sarah D.

description: I had this place bookmarked for a very long time, and I finally decided to trek over.  I went on the last day of May, and apparently they were running a sale where all their macarons were a dollar.  A DOLLAR!  Only in heaven are macarons a dollar.  I'm bummed I didn't know about this promo earlier because I probably would have purchased six every day.  I came here in the late afternoon and unfortunately they only had four flavors left.  They were all really yummy though.  The staff were super nice.  If I ever found myself in the neighborhood, I would definitely make it a point to come back here.  They also have a variety of cute French candy, which I haven't seen or tasted in many many years.  C'est trop cher pour moi.
author: k h.

description:
Chocolate Sables
Fleur-de-sel caramels
The chocolate bars on the table in blue and white paper
and a cupcake.

There.

That is your shopping list. 

Go there and get those things. Savor them. In fact, savor all your time in the store. It's beautiful. Classy. It's not the typical candy store.

And no, the prices aren't typical either. But when you have a $10 chocolate bar, maybe there's a hint in there. Don't wolf this one down. Take your time with it, a little corner at a time. You know, like Charlie did with his annual Wonka bar.

Same principle.

The cupcake, however. You should eat that right away. And if you're with a skeptic, don't share.
author: margo s.

description:
This place is both a gift and a curse. Wonderful Quality, but at a price.

They have most delicious treats: Parisian Marcaroons ($1.50), Delicious Cupcakes ( I love the old fashioned chocolate and the gingerbread with cream cheese frosting) about $3.00, wonderful madeleines (buttery and perfect balance of density vs. fluffyness), Home made Caramels and Taffy, and much more. Their cakes are a bit pricey, but I don't dare try them in fear it will be another item to add to my list of must haves.

I could easily spend $20.00 at one visit!
author: Kat T.

description: sO cute! macarons were good, but i liked the place around the corner better, but i cant remember what their name is. (not la boulange)
author: Lisa N.

description: Best cupcakes I've ever had. I had the carrot cake cupcake.  It was incredibly moist and the frosting was delicious. The shop is incredibly well designed with whimsical touches that make it feel like you walked right onto the Candyland game board.
author: Adam P.

description: I have literally been travelling around NZ (where im from) and now america trying cupcakes and have to say that they have the best cupcakes I have ever had! IN MU INTIRE LIFE a must try while in San Francisco! Don't miss out
author: Chris S.

description: Went to Miette, and I have been to the one in the Ferry building. Their cupcakes are great, but everything else is just bleh. The macaroons are too mealy, the candy (in the jars) is stale, the hand made toffee was nasty. The look of the store is adorable, too bad the quality of the merchandise doesn't match. I would have given them three stars but the customer service was terrible. I think she was the manager, but she acted like she was annoyed by my questions...excuse me you work at a candy store get over yourself. I was expecting sweet and instead I got sour. Sorry Miette, you're lucky you have such a good brand name.
author: Natalie L.

description: Wow, what crappy customer service here. I have always supported Miette since the Ferry Building and come to the Hayes store when I am close by. I also always buy their cupcakes. I know I could get Sibby's, Kara's, and Sprinkles and I don't, but now I do. I went into the store today around noon and there was about 20 cupcakes left. I told the girl behind the counter I'd like to buy all of them and she rolled her eyes and said, "You could have called and pre-ordered." I told her that I was in the area and wanted to reward my team for the great work they did today, it was a random treat for them. She said, "You should call 2 days before and we can get it ready, " as she was making the box to stick the cupcakes. She was totally giving me attitude. I asked her if there was some limit to buying the cupcakes and she said, "Um, well, it's just not fair to the rest of our customers throughout the day." SERIOUSLY??? You don't want a guaranteed sale on your PERISHABLE goods?? Bitch, please. I told her I didn't need to buy her cupcakes since they came with attitude. I don't get it, maybe she wasn't a good enough salesgirl to direct people later that day to purchase their lovely macarons or their candy. It's just sad to see bitchy service at a pretty pink store like that. Oh well... signing up for Sprinkle's delivery now.
author: Tricia G.

description:
I had the old fashion cupcake, $3 with the marshmallow frosting.  It was good.

The strawberry macaroon is good but pricey at $1.50; cake like confection with a fresh strawberry filling. But for something so tiny (about 1.5 inches in diameter), I better hold my wallet tighter next time. 

Cute place.
author: just d.

description: The cupcake was not as good as the food network made it sound. And for $3.25 each, definitely was not cheap. Went in with high expectations, and left feeling disappointed. Not a bad cupcake by any means, but too expensive to deserve a return visit any time soon.
author: Chris W.

description: The perfect girly little candy shop. Seriously. I was really excited walking in and couldn't wait to shop around. I could not get over the cute displays! Eventually I reigned myself in and got down to business - macarons. I'd never had one before (the hockey puck-esque travesties at the Paris buffet in Vegas do not count) and was on a mission. I had to have some and I HAD to like them. Lucky for me, macarons are delicious and the little wonders at Miette are no exception. I tried hazelnut, chocolate, vanilla, and (reluctantly) pistachio. Of course, pistachio was my favorite. These were much lighter and almost cakey in comparison with the ones from Paulette. I don't prefer one over the other but, macaron wise, Miette wins for presentation while Paulette has it for variety. They're just a short walk away from each other so couldn't hurt to try both!
author: Juliana C.

description: I love the spread of the candy, cupcakes, macarons, etc. The cake stands and plates are really cute - but pricey (I inquired about them). The old fashioned italian meringue cupcake was yummy and so were the macarons. We also got various black licorice which were just okay. I wish they had a little sitting area (like Paulette's) so that you could bask in all of the sweet goodness of the store while nibbling on your treats.
author: Mary P.

description: Although it's been a couple of years since I've been here, I had to write a review about the best bakery/sweet shop I've ever had the pleasure of patronizing. The aesthetic of store and product are just beautiful and the quality is there to back it up. They offer candy, cupcakes and the more ambitious (and trendy) macarons. Macarons of the lovely pastel cookie variety, not the blob of coconut mess. If all this wasn't enough, everything is ORGANIC. Yes people, they can offer a superior product that won't kill you for the same price most places will serve you schlock. If I wanted to get up at 3:00 AM to start my day, I'd open a place of this caliber. That's never going to happen, so someone else should get on it here in KC.
author: Mad C.

description:
I love French pastries, macarons in particular, are my favorite. This has become an issue since Hayes Valley provides both Miette and Paulette's. I have come to the conclusion I like them both equally, and here is why I like Miette.

I first fell in love with Miette before I moved to SF and would visit their counter in the Ferry Building. Their macarons are good, but I'm not sure if they are as good as Paulette's, but Miette gets my vote because they bake them in the City instead of having them shipped from Los Angeles like Paulette's. Also, Miette has a variety of other desserts to choose from, in case you aren't feeling the dainty macaron. But, really, go for the Chocolate Lavender and Hazelnut macarons.

The other thing I love about Miette is their decor. Whereas Paulette's has a decidedly modern approach, Miette makes me feel like I am in a little Parisian patisserie. The quaint and feminine decor is something I have come to value when it comes to my pastries.

It's not Paris, but Miette is a warm little reminder of that gorgeous city across the Atlantic. And when warm days hit the Bay, there is nothing better than strolling through Hayes Valley with a little bag of pastries.
author: Emily M.

description:
an adorable, charming, dainty candy shop where paris & barbie (if she's only real) can be seen browsing & spending daddy's or ken's money!...absolutely appealing confectionary!

with it's sweet, friendly color-scheme interior,  who wouldn't be interested to go in and look around. 

not to mention the clear, huge pharmacist jars that are filled with colorful sweets of licorice, salt water taffy, chewy caramels, hard candies & so much more... that price ranges from 15 cents to $20/lb....you will really be attractive to browse around.

moreover, they used gum drops and lollipops to make a bouquet of flowers to decorate the tables and shelves.

so, for dessert last night i had their heavenly, delectable & expensive cupcakes ($3 each). i got 4 cupcakes of chocolate with coffee cream, chocolate with vanilla cream & vanilla with lemon cream. it was ambrosial!..and $12 of cupcakes was so worth it!

i also noticed that they carry some imported candy bars made by nestle which you can purchase at your local draeger's or cost plus stores.

i can't wait to take my goddaughter to this place and buy her some few goodies..
author: Nelle A.

description: The pastel walls and brightly colored candies contained in apothecary jars beckon me as I walk through Hayes Valley. I have been known to go to HV JUST to get a Fleur de Sel Caramel from Miette. Today it was a Chocolate FdS Caramel, some cotton candy (flavour of the day: lemon verbena), and gumballs for me and my coworkers. This is a wonderful place for empty calories and childhood wish fulfillment. Also, if you're a fan of some foreign delights, you can find some Cadbury products here as well. Check out their lovely cakes and cupcakes too!!
author: Candice B.

description: I love visiting Miette for how beautiful it is and the gorgeous candies.  The seasonal options are wonderful too.  It is pricey but everything is wrapped beautifully and it's a fun shopping experience that you're paying for too.  The weak link to me is the cupcakes, which I'm usually a sucker for; to me, they need to be moister with less dense, more flavorful frosting.  But they're so beautiful that I'm still suckered in by the old fashioned!  It's a gorgeous little spot however and definitely worth a stop in to pick up some lovely treats.
author: BW A.

description: I wandered in here because the outside looked charming and I'm into the whole Japanese-stationary cutesy stuff. Little did I know that it was a giant candy store! I basically went insane looking at all the different candies and marveling at their designs. The flowers were pretty intricate, and so were their cakes. I ended up buying a lot of the champagne gummies, a mint air-bubble chocolate bar, and a marshmallow stick. Everyone asks me where I got the gummies, and I ate the chocolate bar within an hour of buying it so... hahaha. Definitely a good place to buy gifts for your friends.
author: Catherine S.

description:
Killing time before my Mani Pedi  walked in to Miette. Now, I am not really a candy person but, the place is adorable! The decor really channels French decadence and girlishness.
They have an interesting selection of bulk and packaged treats from all over the place. What tail hooked me was the  cupcakes. OOOOOHHHH, CUPCAKES! I had to have the gingerbread with cream cheese frosting. It was Devinne! Smaller than Kara's but still yummy.

Update!!!  OHH ya not a happy girl!
When one is PMSing and having a specific craving it is not in your best interest to deny her. I had a major craving for a Gingerbread cupcake and for once Beau was being super patient and was waiting outside with out going nuts. There were only 2 customers in the store and 2 associates, one being one of the owners. I stood at the counter card very visible in hand and in the words of Laura B. "LET'S DO BUSINESS!" I waited and waited and waited some more. Not a glace over, "Oh I can help you in just a minute." Not a "Let me know if you have questions "NADA! After 5 minutes of listening to them chity chat about the flippin' importance of good candy. I was done, PISSED. I walked right out.  I will NEVER set foot in there again. I work in retail and I know how it is and what it is like to run a business. With that kind of customer service and selling bulk candy I give it 1 year.
author: Douggers M.

description: the gingerbread cupcake with creamcheese icing- omg! so good and those little paris meringues? I don't remember ever liking meringues, but those little thingies are SO good. and the little shop with all the little candy baubles and polka dots and hand made caramels is just so perfectly cute!
author: Liz S.

description:
the chocolate butter cookies are the best cookies in the entire world.

why 4-stars? some stuff is definitely over priced. but those cookies. and the fudgey choc & caramel chews, and the italian meringue cupcake.
author: Eryn R.

description:
miette is so freaking cute. yeah, i just repeated every other review below. but i had to say it. it is the only thing i actually liked about it. 

i went in after they first opened. i work in the hood so i HAD to check it out. i hate HATE hate HATE walking into a store and feeling like i just committed a crime. and that is exactly what happened at miette. 
upon entering the store i was seriously gawked at by 6 people (and a dog) huddled around one of the counters in a pow wow. one of the guys even rolled his eyes at me AS IF to say "how dare you come in here, in the middle of the day, during store hours!!!" and one of the women actually said "look at her shoes!" got beef with moccasins miette?!?

i did a once around the little table and seriously got out of there.
author: alexis g.

description:
when i'm at Miette, i feel like a kid in a candy store!  oh wait, i AM in a candy store...

this place is so damn cute, the confections so beautifully displayed on a backdrop of pink and yellow, and it's right at hayes green where i take my dog walking so it's wonderfully hard to walk by without going in.  i went in there the other day to get some candy for my dad, and walked out w/ a great assortment of hard to find sweets for him and a hazelnut macaroon for me to go w/ the blue bottle coffee i'd just gotten a few minutes before.  while i was there looking around, the owner gave us all samples of the newest addition to her menagerie - gummy smurfs (ooooooWEEEE!).  

i gather the owner of miette is engaged to the owner of blue bottle, so you can find some of their goodies there too.
author: Suzanne A.

description: Went there to try the ginger snaps, but they were out! We had the hazelnut and pistachio macaroons instead. Absolutely delish. Wish I would have bought more.
author: Ali A.

description:
all you people who haven't been there, don't write reviews!!  you are messing up the rating system!

note: i love cupcakes and am not a non-chocolate candy fan.

I actually went there. It's beautiful. feels unreal like something from a preppy charlie and the chocolate factory sans oompa loompas, of course.

I LOVE Miette the bakery. but this place is too sterile, intimidating and CRAZY expensive!!!  I blew $50 and they were only taking cash b/c they were so new. credit card thing should be up now, though

then went home at tried the beautiful taffy we bought. tasted like paste? wa supposed to be root beer and banana flavors. pretty but tasted horrid. gawd knows how much I paid

the dark chocolate malt balls were good. 

they are so new that some things weren't even labelled and most things had no prices. "if you have to ask, you can't afford it."

was hoping they would have cupcakes, alas NO!.  wah.  but the owner emailed me and said those are coming soon.

they don't even make most of this stuff.  it's just a compilation of stuff someone likes. which means they mark it up from the original maker...
author: Sophia Y.

description: Can I live here? The sheer cuteness of Miette Confiserie might be overwhelming for some folks, but this Goldilocks thinks it's juuu-st right. Miette's interior is a retro-inspired, Candyland fantasy of tall glass jars brimming with candy -- like I'd walked into a candy store from "Mary Poppins". It doesn't hurt that the handmade caramels are amazing (the bergamot caramel was a highlight) or that the service is exceedingly kind (I was offered a sample of everything I ordered), but I'd come to Miette anyway just to feel like a pampered kid in a very fancy candy store.
author: Heather F.

description: OH MY GOD, the dark chocolate cookies with sea salt are AMAAAAZING!!!  Inspired by a Parisian baker, these puppies are a special treat.  I picked up a bag to share with a friend later that day.  Whatever!  I ate the whole bag myself.  Don't look at me like that, holiday binging lasts through the first week of Janvier:)
author: michelle s.

description:
As a child, my forward-thinking (aka: half-assed hippy) parents came up with a crazy scheme to keep me from eating too much sugar.   "There shall be no candy consumed on any day of the week  but Saturday," came the word from on high.  Coincidentally, Saturday was the day I got a $5 allowance to do with as I wished.  Thus, Saturday became Candy Day.  Instead of dissuading me from my budding sugar-addiction, this hastened a binge mentality, and fostered six days of candy-fantasizing.  I grew up in the Mission,  a mere three blocks away from some decent old-fashioned candy at St. Francis ice cream parlor, not to mention the classy european sweets offered by the York Theater, and the usual assortment at a perfectly decent corner store (except the time the owner got shot) within a block.  But, my heart was fixed on a more distant goal: schoolyard legend Ratto's.  Ratto's was, upon surface inspection, just a large corner store near the loathsome El Faro Taqueria.  But any kid in the Mission District knew that Ratto's had EVERYTHING when it came to candy.  What seemed like two full aisles were stocked with all the usual suspects from M&M/Mars, Hershey and Willy Wonka, plus all the bizarre novelty candies (6ft tape gum, squeezy baby-bottle candy goo, candy skeletons) and ethnic delights a kid could want.  But it was just a little too far for me to walk by myself, and no parental figure (out of dozens -- f'n hippies!) around would willingly drive a fat child to buy candy, so... dream on, kiddo. 

Cut to today, and my adult candy fantasyland, Miette Confiserie.  Now that I'm all growed up and every day is Candy Day, this is where I go to indulge in total sweet abundance.  So what if some of the more obscure and finer items are a little pricey... Clearly my early-set patterns regarding self-indulgence serve me well to this day!
author: Teal H.

description: This review is strictly for the rose macaroons.  They are absolutely delicious...now I know why my gf buys a whole box and eats them all herself.
author: Allison T.

description: I heart the cupcakes at Miette. The carrot cake is probably the best I've ever had too. The cake is perfectly moist and not too sweet. And they put just enough frosting on the little loaf, but not too much. I haven't tried any of the candy, but if the cakes are any indication of quality, I'm sure they're good too. Miette is a darling little boutique in the heart of Hayes Valley - cute as a button I must say... and a must try for cake enthusiasts.  The selection dwindles by the end of the day, so try to get there early.
author: Maria L.

description:
such a cute store, altho everything is expensive.  at least you don't have to go to the ferry bldg if you need some cupcakes!!

never thought i liked malt balls, but the ones here are yummy.  they come in every pastel color possible, so not only are they delish, they are cute to look at and package up for presents.
author: Helen T.

description: This is the cutest place in the history of Man. Quit trying to think of someplace cuter. YOU'RE WRONG!
author: Shannon V.

description: This place is super cute, with so much to look at and want to put into your mouth. They raised the price of their macarons though. $1.75 now kids. I totally forgot about eating them though and went back to Davis for the week thinking about them everyday. By the time I got around to eating it, it was hard, but not bad. I prefer Patisserie Phillipe's macarons though, still $1.50, colorful, slightly bigger, and all in all better tasting.
author: Adrianna C.

description: Unquestionably the prettiest store in San Francisco.  My mouth and my eyes get excited when I walk in.  The people who work here are friendly and knowledgeable about the treats they sell and will wrap up your purchase perfectly.  I am a huge fan of their macarons.  I think they are better than any of the other purveyors of these French cookies in Hayes Valley!  This is one of the places on my "must visit" list when I make recommendations to friends or others visiting San Francisco
author: Joey G.

description: An amazing candy store. It is the cutest place in the world, and very delicious. I feel like I am in a movie when I am there. It can be a little pricey, but totally worth it if you, er, maintain.
author: Mitsi M.

description: Such a cute little store! I've had the yummy homemade fleur de sel caramels, they're awesome! I also bought a bag of Jordan almonds that I keep in my car and munch on when I'm driving and need a little sugar fix. All the European chocolates and candies are wrapped up so pretty...and they wrap up your stuff so cute with a little ribbon so it's the perfect little gift to cheer someone up or bring to someone when you visit. A must visit for people with a sweet tooth. There's almost too much to choose from, they have so much stuff. My friend found these salty licorice things from Holland she got for her mother (who's Dutch). She got very nostalgic and was impressed she was able to find them!
author: lani P.

description: The folks at Miette Confiserie could not be nicer or more helpful.  They are super friendly and good at suggesting items based on what you enjoy.   We make this a regular stop on our "family dates" with our two little ones.  A stop at Miette's and a pizza around the corner at Patxi's and we are a happy foursome.
author: Tina P.

description: i am that kid in a candy store when i shop at miette confiserie. great selection of international chocolates and special candy bars (like nestle coffee crisp and yorkie -- it's not for girls). and don't forget to stop by the glass counter and see the lovely cupcakes and macaroons. yum!
author: Helen Y.

description: My friend Flora is so thoughtful.  When I told her I went on a self constructed "Cupcake Tour of San Francisco,"  she took me to this place.  OMGosh.  Their cupcakes are bomb, so moist!  However, the thing to try here are their macaroon cookies.  They are melt in your mouth good!  LITERALLY.  MELT IN YOUR MOUTH.  The place is so cute and they have a large variety of baked goods and candies from everywhere!
author: Jennifer N.

description: Imagine if Willy Wonka had a gay brother, this would be his candy store.  Dare I say the word "cute".  A cool place to visit even he you don't have a sweet tooth. Try the hazelnut macaroons.
author: Ezduzit S.

description: This candy store made me smile like there was no tomorrow.  IT was the CUTEST shop I have ever seen!!  I wanted to buy everything in sight.  This is the candyshop that is in my dreams.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
dude, this place is like where you would buy
the golden ticket and get to go to the chocolate factory. 
(not the R. Kelly one, the Willy Wonka one)

great place to drop by if you're on a "walk around SF-date"
your babe will probably go nuts unless she hates candy
(a candy hating female? preposterous)

there was a locally handmade nougat thing i tried
and it was like manna from heaven. ambrosia, food of the gods
Lyndy and I make it our weekly treat to walk over and hook it up
(Lyndy = JT roommate and candy connoisseur Xtreme)

scrump-o-meter rating: 3 out of 5 "daddy i want it, NOW!"

p.s. try the australian licorice (red not black)
if you dont reach orgasm its cos you fell into a chocolate river or turned into a giant blueberry.
author: JT X.

description: Giddy. That's how I felt when I walked into this store. Yes, yes, the candy definitely did contribute, but the vision! the vision! All the details are perfect.
author: Mister X.

description: This place is so cute, and has a bunch of non-chocolate related items, which is my personal favorite. French inspired candy shop. I bought some delicious caramels here, as well as violet drops which were super cute. The shop is very clean, accented in white, with fancy jars filled with candy. I felt like this place was straight out of some movie. Their toffee looked yum too, but alas there is only so much sweets one can handle for a day.
author: Jessica C.

description: We left here giggling like girls half our age with mouths full of sugary treats. You can get the same candy at lower prices in many other shops or even liquor stores, but there are random things you have likely never seen, like the French Bread candy bar. It's just a bar of dark chocolate with flecks of real bread, that you can't really decipher, we thought it would be more like Nutella on toast. Hard to disappoint me when it comes to chocolate though, after all, I grew up on Hershey's. One of my favorite confections here are the Fernet drops. So when there's no bar handy you can get your fix sucking on it.
author: Colleen B.

description:
My boyfriend and I stumbled upon here the other day and were immediately drawn in by the sight of candy! 
There were also candy creations (something you might imagine in Charlie and the Chocolate Factory) around which looked good to eat!
Anyways this place has alot of different varieties of candy. There are also delicious little cupcakes behind the counter that looked sweet too.
The coolest thing we picked up was a licorice pipe. My boyfriend and I are not smokers so we thought it was cool to walk out of the store with a candy pipe in our mouth. 
The staff here is also very nice and friendly. 
Although you may be able to find most of the candy here at other locations, Miette Confiserie is a very cute and unique place to stop by if you're in the area for a nice sweet treat!
UPDATE: Tried their cupcakes today...delicious, loved the unique whipped frosting on top and the cupcake was sooo moist! Also picked up a bag of cool gummi spiders which were sweeet.
author: Miss H K.

description:
MACARONS!! Mi piace Macarons moltissimo!!
OK, Macarons are NOT Macaroons. An "o" can change everything. Notice, they are completely different animals, or species. Like a cat is not at all like a catfish. One is a cat, another is a fish. Macarons are made with almond flour, powdered sugar, and egg white. And depends on the flavor, different things are added such as cacao powder, ground coffee, ground pistachio, etc. With the flavored italian buttercream in the middle, this delicate little treat is heavenly, if done perfectly perfect. The perfect texture should be lightly crunchy on the surface, because of the egg whites, chewy inside thanks to the sugar and ground almonds, then creamy in the middle from the buttercream. I'm not exaggerating, but I felt like a flower blooming when I take a bite of a perfect macaron. These heavenly treats originated in France I believe, but it's loved by many of the royal members in Europe. Macaroons are American treats that are made with coconut flakes. 

My favorite flavors are pistachio, rose, chocolate lavender, and hazelnut. Sadly, rose and chocolate lavender are out of season now. Why are Macarons so expensive about everywhere that they are sold? Many say that they are extremely hard to make, because it requires the professional oven and tools. It is not entirely true because I made them in my college dorm kitchen and they turned out great. I did notice that they are extremely hard to keep in the perfect condition. Any change of temperature or humidity could damage the texture that they might turn into some marshmallows....well, not quite as bad. And they are expensive to make for sure.

Remember Carry brought Miranda a bag of chocolate from Payard in Sex and the city? These macarons are MUCH better than the ones from Payard.

I love miette, and if you are a girl, or have a sweet tooth, or have a nice childhood would love it too. It's a confiserie, which means, LOTS of candies!!! Most of the candies there are imported from European countries. And better yet, if it's not busy in the store, you can ask to sample almost all of them!! Get the rose water cotton candy, and they'll make it for you!! It's amazing. The violet drops are super too.

Yes it is a bit over priced. Especially a candy cane that costs $4. But it's a place that sells a dream, a feeling. Unlike Godiva or Starbucks, the things at Miette are with very high quality if not the highest. Godiva charges ridiculous amount for chocolate that I refuse to swallow, as well as Starbuck's coffee.
author: Yuchi C.

description: Oh Miette, you have only been open for a couple weeks yet I've visited you way too many times. I love your sunny atmosphere, your super friendly people at the counter, the beautiful jars filled with yummy candy, and your oh-so-cute packaging (i'm just a sucker for some ribbon!)  I love that I can get two handfuls of customized candy goodness for the change at the bottom of my purse. I've discovered so many new favorites -- the Caffarel Gianduia is the best thing you could ever buy for 50 cents, and I love the peach bon-bons. Sigh........
author: Tuyet N.

description: I am not a big fan. Just cause it looks nice doesn't mean it taste good. Many of the flavors are just off. Either too sweet or too bitter. The texture of their cake is good but all of their whips are either too airy or too heavy. I won't lie to myself and say I like it here cause it is a cool little spot. It's just not all that great. For a special treat I would really go elsewhere.
author: Lee M.

description:
mmmmm...

went here yesterday for my birthday cake. bad news. they DON'T DO CAKES!!! unless you order in advance, and I'm real big on procrastinating. that was what really brought it down a star for me. because the other miette is all the way in the ferry building!

still, it was lovely. i got an old fashion cup cake to blow a candle out on. not a big fan of the mallow topping. but as a whole it was delicious and cute. the saleswoman was super nice. i got some fresh cut nougat which was soooo freakin' good.

i ended up getting my cake at the ferry building miette. i got the princess cake. it was delicious. nice and light, such good whipped cream inside. sponge cake soaked in rasberry chambord. so so so so good. now i need the bumblebee, and the tomboy, and whatever other cute named cakes they've got.
author: melody r.

description:
MMM, who doesn't love macarons? Being too full from lunch, I opted for a raspberry macaron. The filling was not too sweet and had little bits of shredded coconut in the cookie part. 

There were samples of graham crackers ... delicious! They were not dry like the store bought ones, but buttery and delicious. The sales associate recommended buying their marshmallows (which were extremely soft and yes, i squeezed them) to make the best smores ever. That is a good idea for a simple dinner party dessert!

Also bought ginger snaps. Four stars instead of five comes from expecting the ginger snaps to be AMAZING. The texture threw me off a bit since I was expecting them to be crisp, but it may have been the half hour they were sitting in a warm car that affected the texture. 

I wish I bought some chocolate! Because of the unusually HOT weather in the city this week and flying back to San Diego today, I chose not to buy any chocolate that would probably melt during the trip. Chocolate lovers beware! You WILL spend money buying all sorts of specialty chocolates here. 

Cupcakes are also served there, but they looked pretty ordinary. I think I'd rather go for mini cupcakes from Kara's cupcakes. 

The store is so cute. The walls are painted a beautiful pink color and the decorations remind me of a doll house.
author: Esther F.

description: I'm not sure why everyone thinks this place is so overpriced. They are cheaper than those horrible mall candy stores by far and they have better candy. I thought the clerks were as charming as the store, which is to say very, very charming. They were, admittedly, busy helping other customers when I arrived, so it took them a while to help me, but only a jerk would take that as a sign pf poor service. I loved that there was a mix of familiar candies, more obscure candies, and handmade treats (try the burnt caramels!) - there was a little something for everyone, which is a good thing in a candy store because everyone has different cravings.
author: Claire B.

description: Sexy - too bad I'm off the sugar right now an Old Fashioned cupcake sounds delightful.
author: melissa h.

description: I absolutely love Miette.  So convenient that I can just walk down the street and get an absolutely mind blowing cupcake.  I've never really been a cupcake fan, and their old fashioned chocolate cupcakes just make me drool.  All that marshmallow cream on top of a perfectly rich and indulgent chocolate cake.  Ugh.  So delicious.  Just walking in is a treat because the inside of the shop is decorated like a candy fantasy land.  So fun!  They have a great selection of chocolate bars and the staff are super friendly.  The little French style macarrones are great too.  I usually grab a couple cookies on my way out the door to share with friends.  Eat them quick because they only keep for about a day!
author: Scottie M.

description: The macrons alone are enough to go back.  And the sables, and English toffee, and madelines... The place is adorable & they have all kinds of fun little candies that you remember from childhood, and always new things to check out as well.  The ladies are always very friendly.  Any time I'm in the neighborhood (or a nearby one), I have to swing by.  A little pricey, but it's good ingredients made with magic & love worth it!
author: Ljótur H.

description: I'm a little bit in love with this store. It's just so cute! The wallpaper, the gumdrop posts (love!), the wallpaper, and of course the candy. We went in for salted caramels, then went back a few hours later to get a gift, and they were all out of the caramels! Crazy. This place just made me happy - a kid in a candy store, you might say. It's a little expensive, and a little slow (people take their time ordering, that's for sure), but the girls behind the counter were so nice and friendly, and it's just really fun to be in there, so you can't mind too much. I kind of want to live around the corner. But I really, really shouldn't.
author: Janet G.

description: It's the sweetest sweets store of my dreams.  Macarons.  Gourmet chocolates.  Beautiful displays.  Excellent, super-friendly service.
author: Esther R.

description: It's so sickeningly sweet in this tiny shop, and I'm terribly upset I moved further away from it! I taste-tested a majority of their black licorice - who knew I loved the stuff? These candy-makers really know their licorice, and the employees are very knowledgeable on the history and makings of the candy. Everything in this place is literally perfect! The taste is obviously on-point, but the attention to detail is what really stands out in my mind. It's so fresh and dainty in the shop, the licorice is shaped in adorable forms, the pristine jars packed full of candies - it's all too cute! And I'm still starry-eyed over the pistachio macaroons...
author: Brittany L.

description: Looks can be deceiving................... which this place is.. the macaroon was stale and COLD (they put in the refrigerator at night) which to me means.. day old... and I should get a discount. but even apart from that... I have come into the Octavia store before and each time the girl (whose day I think we ruined AGAIN) wasn't too happy.. even IF the desserts were worth the money (which they aren't) the owner should tend to her bakery a little better. We got there right after they opened and they barely had anything to offer , hence the reason we bought the macaroon and as mentioned, it was stale.. Seems to me that once these owners either have a cookbook out or have been on the food network, they forget what good quality is..... There are far better bakeries in this city and less expensive.. Miette, clean up your act...
author: Susan L.

description:
lovely little shop..absolutely adorable.  But when I really looked around it was just filled with candy I would never want to eat (black licorice? * shudder *). 

 I didn't think I would ever make it back so I asked the nice lady what were the most popular items. She recommended the ginger cupcake with the cream cheese frosting and the pistachio macaroon.  

btw, i learned that because they are french macaroons they are not made with any coconut, just in case any of you were reluctant to try them for that particular ingredient.  the cupcake was nice but nothing particularly special besides the fact that they were made with organic ingredients...but the pistachio macaron!  oooooohhhhh *gurgling noise* i'd go back just for another soft, chewy, perfectly textured macaron for sure!

i'd say it's a cute place to stop by if you're in the neighborhood, but I much prefer kara's cupcakes!
author: jozilla w.

description: It's more than a candy store, it's an experience.  I saw the conversion of the ugly spot across the street from the park into a cute little boutique!  SO cute in fact, that they were featured in Victoria Magazine (another one of my guilty pleasures).  Being Canadian, I was thrilled to see a selection of candy that I grew up on.  My husband generally doesn't eat sweets, but he was impressed with their diverse collection of licorice (from all over the world)
author: Bonnie A.

description: For a few years now I have been driving one hour to get to the bakery shop in Hayes Valley just because it is so hard to park along the Embarcadero to get to the Ferry Building location.  The macarons are awesome BUT the customer service is the WORST.  I have to agree with others like Ellen Y. who have written about their unfortunate experience in this store.  The male employee is abrupt, borderline rude.  He obviously is not that into his position and someone should seriously look into his attitude vs. customer relations.  No matter how good the desserts are, it is not worth an encounter with this guy!  Buyers beware!  Either visit a different shop or find another bakery that makes the authentic French macaroons unless you want to have a really negative experience -- and at the price of these baked goods, customers deserve a little polite consideration.  I tried to contact the store manager about this but got no live body, just the message machine all day.  Corporate really needs to look into their employees and customer comments if they want to stay in business at this location.  I will be going elsewhere from now on!
author: Anita L.

description:
I am always on the prowl for treats for my grandson, Dylan's baskets. 
In addition to Easter baskets, I make Valentine's Day and Halloween baskets for my kids. . . So literally, two days before Halloween, I am at a lost for candies for the basket, when I remember Miette had a fabulous new candy store in Hayes Valley. . I picked up  gumdrops (licorce favored) purple hard rock candy, black and orange lollipops, black penguins, gummie worms, mini chocolate chip cookies. etc. . . (you get the idea) and the wonderful staff was most pleasant and I wound up buying more than I should have, but my choices were awesome and looked great in the basket (along with tiny books, stuffed animals, toys) . . usually I have to bag and tie them in tiny bags, but they did it there. . another plus. . . 
The store reminds me of the old fashion candy stores of years gone by with an updated art deco twist. . . .  whatever it is, it is definitely a magnet for me.
author: Kea C.

description: Cute little candy shop. Such a themed decor for the shop. I would prefer if they had little tables and chairs for eating the cakes and macarons. Oh, and $1.50 for a rose macaron? Delish!
author: Lisa Z.

description:
so why did i not know about this place until last weekend when it is within walking distance of my apartment?!

it is so very colorful and has very yummy cupcakes and macaroons. it looks like something out of willy wonka except girlie and french. 

i bought a dozen cupcakes there for my birthday and then went back the next day and bought two more. 

the turkish delight is also delightful.

my only complaint is that it does not have the cakes that miette in the ferry building has.
author: Joy A.

description: A cute confiserie offering a small selection of baked goods near the register. I've had their mini scheffen berger cake, gingerbread cupcake, and their macaroons. The cake was AMAZING...I savored every decadent bite. The cupcake was moist, not overly sweet, with just the right amount of spices. The macaroons are a hit or miss...sometimes it's cold so you have to wait until its room temperature or else it just doesn't taste that great. But when they are at room temperature, they're oh so satisfying!
author: Jane K.

description: One of the cutest candy stores I have ever been to. Everything is organized so neatly it makes the store look so good. It is a bit pricey, but everything looks so good! And the girl behind the register was so cute. She made me smile.
author: Guy S.

description:
Miette is a quaint little shop that transplants you to a petite bakery in Europe.  The pastries are miniature sized, perfect size for a treat, so you don't feel as if you have over-indulged.

There is an array of salted caramels, taffy, licorice, imported candy, jelly beans, chocolates, as well as a variety of locally made baked gods staring at you from behind a piece of glass.  Eat ME!  I can never resist the... Macaroons!  I didn't even think I liked macaroons until I sampled the unique variety at Miette.

It's a grown up candy store!  Perfect for me, since I'm a grown up and I have quite the sweet tooth.
author: Ashley Q.

description: Underwhelming.  Expected nostalgia and uniqueness in a place where 3/5 of the shelf space is taken up by hoi polloi jelly belly beans, gumballs, and M&Ms.  As my 6 year old said, "Cost Plus is better than this place."  The stale lollypop and taffy didn't help.
author: babsie g.

description:
The only thing this place needs is Ooompa Loompa greeters at the door. Every time I'm there I have to overcome the fear that the Willy Wonka of my childhood nightmares (the Gene Wilder Wonka--the psychopathic one) might shuffle across the store. 

But once I get past that I have a great time in this place. It's fun to look at and fun to browse through.  I go crazy with salted caramels, the ridiculous array of licorice, the candy from my childhood my mom never allowed me to eat, all sorts of foreign candy with wrappers I can't read ("I think this little blob shaped one might have antennae and legs...but it's really chocolatey!") ...and of course, the macaroons. Those macaroons will be the death of me. But I'll take that over, say, falling off a cliff.
author: Mich L.
