description: The interior is a bit pink for me, but the macarons are worth it. I tried a few varieties of macaron, and they were all delicious, although I have to say that the pistachio, chocolate-hazelnut and chocolate-orange ones were by far the best.
author: Finn G.

description: Beautiful space dedicated to one pursuit - fine candies and chocolates. Mostly imported - you will find a lot of Caffarel chocolates from the Piedmont region of Italy - foil-wrapped and fun in shapes of  mushrooms, nuts, and fruits. One of my favorite items were the sardine shaped chocolates sold in a sardine can - so cute. Also camembert cheese rounds made of white chocolate caught my eye. Tons of glass apothecary and candy jars filled with licorice of every kind, jelly bellies, single color M&Ms, lollipops, hard candies, oh my! All wrapped up by an extremely friendly staff - a gift from here is one that will be appreciated!
author: Mariangela S.

description: A perfectly decorated European sweet shop, this will make you feel like a kid in a candy store. In Paris. Best purchased item there? Absinthe lollypops made by Lollyphile. Next to the Maple Bacon and Wasabi Ginger versions, it was really a no-brainer. Also of note? Two foot long marshmallows and an entire wall of licorice varieties. Yum.
author: Max E.

description: Talk about a kid in a candy store... So many different kinds of things to choose from.  I was in heaven when I found my favorite Pink Grapefruit gummy candy.. The taste just sends me back to my childhood.  Another candy that brought back memories of my childhood, is the red licorice Scottish Dogs... nom..nom.. nom..
author: Trish P.

description: Love the maple caramels with fleur de sel made locally (by a company called ??? can't remember)  but they are a little pricey at $2 each. Now, I will pay extra for artisanal products, especially local ones, and these caramels are big (2 or 3 bites each) and rich, so I'll go here for those, and the intense black licorice from their big selection but it has to be occasionally. Check out the Chikka Bars- a spicy mutli nut brittle bar, yum.
author: Shona M.

description: This is a lovely candy shop with fancy specialty candies from Europe.  I went here to get macaroons since Paulette's macaroon shop wasn't open at the time.  I tried the chocolate orange, hazelnut, rose, and pistachio.  They were much thicker and denser than Paulette's and though they were still good, they were not as authentic as the ones I've had in France.
author: Grace M.

description: Tres bien!  A lovely little candy shoppe with my favorite Italian licorice candy always in stock.  I've never seen it at ANY other store in the U.S.  I also like the cupcakes and the pretty boxes they put them in.  They are the perfect present for someone on short notice.  It adds a touch of class to Hayes Valley.
author: V T.

description:
Before I write my little review, let me just say that hateful, slanderous, and personal attacks (like the one recently posted) don't belong here.  This is a place where "useful," "funny," and "cool" are the only comment options available short of full-on flagging (which this one probably deserves).  So.... If you have a personality conflict with someone maybe you should address it in an adult fashion (read: less cowardly) instead of libeling them in a public place where they have little or no recourse to defend themselves against what are obviously your personal issues.

That said....    [music shifts from sad cello solo to bubblegum pop]

La!

    Well, I've been stopping by Miette (Confiserie) regularly since they opened to quell my addiction for all things sour and gummy - Sour Trout, Danish Sour Belts, Gummy Smurfs, Peaches, Root Beer barrels, Cherries, Colas....  need I go on?  Of course by now I have also managed to "sample" their fresh, local, and organic various macarons, old-fashioned cupcakes, lime tarts, fleur-de-sel and burnt caramels, absinthe lollipops, French nougat, cotton candy, fine dark chocolate tiles with burnt caramel and grey sea salt..... again - could go on.  Suffice it to say you won't be disappointed with the selection.  Quite honestly, anyone who doesn't feel lucky to have such a place in their neighborhood, nay, CITY - just doesn't know what's good for them. 

   Miette Confiserie is the Honest-to-God apotheosis of sweets. Which is to say they take their fare quite seriously (they make their own pastries, which are incredible), but they also understand that candy and cake is a fun, frivolous treat and should be an all-around lighthearted and wonderful experience.  So, for instance, not only do they carry an amazing range of exotic licorices  - they have an entire wall of it - but they have it beautifully displayed in old-fashioned glass jars along with a very thorough menu.  Having a hard time deciding?  Ask one of the  young ladies behind the counter (nicely) and they will gladly give you the Famed Licorice Tour, then personally wrap up whatever you decide you might like (even if it's just a little tiny bag).   Sound awful?  You really should go to Wal-Store instead.   Sound delightful?  You are correct - it sure is.   Not only is everything they carry high-quality, it is offered to you so beautifully and elegantly that you might actually have to pinch yourself.   Did I mention that your personal Candy Heaven is (of course) accompanied by young ladies who love candy and pastries maybe even more than you do (and therefore know a lot about it).  This is your chance to revisit your childhood, this time casting yourself in an elegant Parisian film, finally replacing your own local candy store where the old guy with the long dirty fingernails reached in and grabbed you a couple handfuls of Swedish fish.  
Yeah.  Really.       
I know.

Cripes, this little place'll rock your candy-lovin' WORLD. 

P.S.  Please treat these ladies well, as they work extremely hard to keep this place so timelessly elegant and beautiful.  Again kids, this ain't Wal-Mart.  It's not what you're used to - it's better.
author: Sam W.

description:
it was fate, or happenstance.

i was at Christopher Elbows Chocolatier (one of my favorite places in SF) when i overheard 'french macaroon' and 'the little cute candy store' in a conversation the staff was having with another customer.

brimming with curiousity, i had to ask whether my ears were faulty or if the conversation indeed involved 'french macaroons'

hence i got the directions to this very cute, very picturesque little boutique hideaway, just around the corner from the big street (next to Stacks)

if you've seen the show Pushing Daisies, this place looks like it can be a page out of the show. Everything is cute, tidy, pastel and just simply adorable. They have all kinds of licorice, candy, chocolate... everything looks CUTE! i wanted to buy one of everything to try.

i'm a french macaroon fan, so i was happy there were 6 flavors on display in the big glass jars looking oh-so-pretty.
That day they had: lemon, vanilla, chocolate, hazelnut, coffee, and pistacio.
I got the hazelnut, pistacio and lemon to try ... they were all good, so it's like asking me which one is my favorite child. but if i must choose, then my favorite is the pistacio, then lemon, then hazelnut.

just as i was able to leave, next to a door i saw a container of chocolate 'candy's in colorful wrapping - the description says every candy comes with some text that's supposed to be a joke in it. kind of like bazooka joe gum, or the Baci dark italian chocolates. it's cute but the text is in french, and it's rather hard to translate the context of a joke... but the chocolate was yummy.

i love Miette... the little store is so quaint i felt like i stepped into a storybook. a definite stop for the foodie and those with a sweet tooth.
author: amy c.

description: This shop is absolutely gorgeous. I love the vintage aesthetic with the apothecary jars filled with candy and the beautiful display case, plus the ladies who work here are super friendly and seem to dress in tune with the store. I'd give it 4.5 stars if possible and the only reason for .5 off is that I bought a few cupcakes here and they weren't amazing...both were dry and one of them had this beautiful frosting that melted within minutes of me buying it (on a cool day).
author: Sara W.

description: Wonderful selection of fine candies and chocolates. But be prepared to shell out a good about of dough, especially for the artisan chocolate bars. Very friendly service, who will make a personalized mixture of jelly beans from a variety of flavors for you.
author: Scott S.

description: I'm giving it 4 stars because although it is kind of pricey for some of the items it is absolutely adorable and the presentation of the candy all the way down to the way they package their cakes, tie the string and place the items in the cute pink bags is simply adorable.  I wish they had a little bit more to offer as far as selection goes, but I do really think this place is very cute and worth checking out if your a candy enthusiast like myself.
author: Erin S.

description: What a fantastic awesomely delicious candy store!!!!!
author: Alice C.

description: Definitely cute candy store.  Overpriced novelty items, but I get it... where else can you find pixie sticks nowadays unless you chance getting a 5 year old package at a dimestore-- btw, it's 10c per stick.  4 stars just for the little maple bacon flavored lollipop I was able to procure for a mere $3.50 (cough!).  Will be back to see if the cuppycakes taste as good as they look.
author: Marjorie B.

description: My littlue Miette. Sometimes when I want to escape I walk into miette and drool at their perfect looking cupcakes. I buy a hazelnut macaroon and savor the flavor. The best part is that they have chocolates from all over the world. (Example: British Kit-Kats which my boyfriend creams himself over ...) They have a pretty limited selection of stuff sometimes which is why I have to restrain from giving them a full five stars. But to browse, buy, or just smell, Miette is the place to go.
author: Shyla B.

description: This place is great! My roommate brought home cupcakes from here that were absolutely heaven! We had chocolate cupcakes with chocolate buttercream frosting!!!!!!!!!!! Absolutely the best! I've tried Kara's and I like them a lot, dont get me wrong! But, these are defintely right up there! Close call... I might need to get some more from each place and try them again!
author: Brittany H.

description: CUTE!  I love ths store....yes...it is a little pricey....wonderful cupcakes but the walnut butter cookies are to die for!  I want to make my way over to the other location for my birthday cake....end of January...I better hurry.
author: Nancy P.

description:
stepping into this candy store, i felt like a kid again.  all the candy in the jars, they look so pretty and i wanted to try all of them!  i was so excited.  you can also try the candies.  try them before getting them! i might not come here as often since i m not in this area much but whenever i m around, i will definitely come! 

i ended up getting half a pound of GIANT Maltballs and Macaroons.  The macaroons are highly recommended.
author: Kapo T.

description: Great little candy store in "my hood"  very clean and nice to look at....they have the usual array of sweets with a french feel in the store...tried the old fashioned cupcakes and they didn't dissapoint...can't wait to go back!
author: Denny R.

description: Absolutely amazing macaroons. I didn't even think I liked macaroons, I usually lean towards lots nad lots of chocolate. I've also been to their little store in the Ferry building. All of the flavors are amazing but I love the pistachio and vanilla.
author: shadi m.

description: Got the girlfriend some snacks from here - macarons and some caramels. They have the perfect gifts for the ladies but the macarons were a bit dry. ( I prefer the ones over at Le Boulange).
author: John S.

description:
3.5 stars. place is cute, nice.  i only purchased cupcakes here once. 
Please note: they do not have a bakery  here, you would have to order through the Ferry Building.  However you could have the one at the Ferry Building deliver your cake here for easier pick up.  (That's a plus side.)  
Cupcakes are $3 each. Quite expensive.  I got to try them, but I don't think I would be purchasing cupcakes at $3/each anytime soon.  I'd have to save money for it.
-Gingerbread cake w/cream cheese on top: i thought this was the best!
-chocolate cake w/reg whip on top: eh, ok. nothing too fab about it
-chocolate cake w/marshmallow whip: hmm.. next fav
-lemon(?) cake w/lemon icing: didn't get to try
author: Christi S.

description:
The people here are nice, and the selection of candy is reasonably cool,  but in the end the number of "fine" candies is actually quite minimal.  This place is all about packaging, decor, and social cache.  When it comes down to it, the prices are just ridiculous:  $6 for a piece of small piece of marzipan that's not even made in-house?  WTF?  Strictly for those who like breaking out a Hamilton for Jelly Bellies that could be had else where for an eighth of the price....

(Side note:  the Blue-Bottle produced caramels are the one shining star...)
author: Patrick P.

description: Cute, cute, cute! Pricey, pricy, pricy! Very cool set-up, unusual chocolates and candies as well as old time favorites.  But not old-time prices!  If you go here, bring your credit card but also be prepared to have a smile on your face the entire time you're here.
author: Suzanne L.

description: This is the cuttest store in Hayes.  I must admit, this isnt exactly my kinda of candy... I'm a Willy Wonka Fan (nerds).  But I love the decor.  The best part is they have these flower bouquets that are candy wrapped with various cellophane colors.  They are hand made by Italian nuns!  I bought them just for that fact!
author: Michelle L.

description: We happened to be wandering the neighborhood when I spotted the sign on the corner with an arrow pointing the way. The store is almost too pretty inside to believe. We quickly noticed the wall of licorice jars. I almost lost my breath! I had just been thinking I'd never see that sight so close to home (we enjoyed the licorice selection in the Netherlands on a trip last fall). The girl working there let us sample the different options and we filled a bag with a range from sweet to salty. Another favorite treat on our European adventure was macaroons in France, and Miette's are wonderful! Perhaps the best I've managed to try here in the States. These were the two things we bought this time. But I can not wait to go back and try the salted caramels, gingersnaps and cupcakes. Thank goodness I don't live closer so I can't go back as often as I would like!
author: Melissa W.

description: I tried Miette a few years ago and had their macarons YUM! This place has been on my mind ever since. Loved the macarons! Recently, I tried their gingerbread cupcake and though it was good I didn't think it was great. Moist yes. Light gingerbread flavor. I would like a stronger gingerbread flavor. Heard their cream cheese frosting had gingerbread in it, but I didn't taste any. I still like this bakery. Unfortunately I think some of their stuff , like cookies are waaayyy too pricey. But like any sweet toothed sucker...I'll be back!
author: Juju F.

description: They've got more than just old school candies in the shop.  While it's fun to look at the candies and chocolates the real treats here are the Miette baked goods.  We got the macarons on this visit.  At $1.50 each they're half the price of last weekends at Bouchon, but they're also more than half as small, they're almost bite sized which is fine by me.  The hazelnut and pistachio macarons are delicious but I wish it had just a little crispier shell.  The chocolate filling of the hazelnut macaroon was especially good.  Be on the lookout for a new macaron bakery around the corner on the 20th (Paulette).
author: Edgar C.

description: Walking into Miette is like walking into a little candy dreamland. It's charming and oh so tempting!  Great stop for licorice lovers (from Germans to the Swedes) and delicious treats of many varieties.  Really, you can't go wrong, just pick something and enjoy!
author: Redloci R.

description: I love this place! I bought candy here for my sister's baby shower and they had a great selection to choose from. The staff was friendly and helpful as well.
author: Corina V.

description:
OK, I don't know why I need to add my review when there have been so many others, but I went to Miette today, and realized that I always have the same friggin' reaction whenever I go in there, so I guess that means I gotta Yelp it, so here goes.
First of all, first time I went in this place I hated it.  For one second.  I mean, the presentation was just so ridiculous and pretentious and perfect it made me sick.  And all of the people who work there are perfectly coiffed with perfect skin, hair, uber hip etc.  Over it.  YET, if you dig a little deeper, there is so much more there and I have to berate myself for being so closed minded and judgmental.  
I reliably and repeatedly buy the black licorice here.  What a selection.  Incredible.  I almost laughed at the one salesperson, who while helping me with the licorice, referred to one type as "salt forward".  Yet then I tried it, and guess what, it WAS.  So yes the black lic is fantastic fantastic and I love the salty and the sweet and that tasty chalk, yum.
Today I went to buy a holiday present and I was blown away by all of the new candy.  Yes it's expensive, but my is it tasty.  The people who work there are so NICE, and well, I do love the place, even though I want to hate it.  And there is still so much there that I have to try...
It's no LES Economy Candy but it's still pretty great.
author: Judith S.

description:
I am ridiculously in love with this place.  The macarons are heavenly and I got a bergamot chocolate bar there last week. Yum!

I've had the chocolate pot de creme at the Ferry Building location and it was so good!
author: Nisaa K.

description: Whenever I walk in the door at Miette, I smile.  It's like walking into a sugary dream.  The almond dragees are maybe my most favorite food.  The macaroons also deserve special mention-- soft, then chewy, and fragrant, exactly how they are supposed to be.  Really, everything is great.  I've had great birthday cakes from Miette, cupcakes I drool to remember, homemade caramels and marshmallows and cookies I'd kick a baby panda to get to.  The employees are all very helpful friendly and the owner remembers my name and chats when the store isn't too busy.  Special.
author: Joanna P.

description: Parisian chic, super cute, and an utterly fabulous candy store with unique items.  Try the homemade toffee made with Scharffen Berger chocolate - simply divine!
author: Courtney B.

description: Miette Confiserie transports you back to a gentler time ... a gentler time where cavities don't appear to be worrisome.  CUTE!
author: Marcus C.

description: Good for high-end candy, and has some fun stuff that you can't find elsewhere.  The clear jars filled with candy of various colors are pretty.  But their downtown bakery is great so for the money I'd skip this and just go there.
author: Carrie L.

description: Absolutely fantastic cookies, and an interesting selection of mass-market (though uncommon) and house-made candies.  We had the chocolate cookies and a pistachio cookie, and they were both amazing.  Highly recommended.
author: Akshay S.

description: Truly lovely, love their gingerbread cupcakes! My favorite. They were so kind to also give my husband a birthday gummy when they overhead that we were celebrating. Charming env't and staff and yess... a bit pricey. But a good special treat.
author: Sadie F.

description: Ice cream sandwich was amazing!!! I had the creme fraiche flavor with graham cracker cookie. Only $4. Made my day.
author: S O.

description:
if i woke up in a prettier version of charlie and the chocolate factory. i get the ginger cupcakes alot and usually get handmade caramels. its such a beautiful, pretty shop where i always feel like i took a moment for myself and bought something cute and yummy for me. that sounds really corny. but its true. 

i love the girls that work here too, they are awesome, really nice and always remember me. its just a great place....i really have fun in here gawking at all the things i shouldnt be eating and neat european lables. even the kit kats look different and prettier in here.
author: kelly M.

description: This candy store is adorable.  I love the decor -- such a happy, friendly, inviting atmosphere.  The woman who helped me was also very smiley.  I tried the carrot cake and two cupcakes.  The ginger cupcake was incredible.  The other -- something with chocolate -- was just ok.  The carrot cake was moist and flavorful but the frosting didn't really taste like creamcheese.  They have a wide selection of treats but I wish they had more cupcake flavors.
author: C C.

description:
As someone who isn't too into sweets,  I think about Miette and its macarons way more often than I should.  I like to bring them to parties as a gift for the hostess or give them to a friend who needs a surprise.  You should always try the seasonal flavor before it's gone. Outside of macarons, if you see any of the caramels you should snatch them up too.  They go fast.

In my office the pink Miette box has reached Tiffany blue status--if you see it you know a good treat is on its way.  Yes, it is pricey, but the experience and product are worth it.  The employees seem genuinely happy and are rightfully proud of their offerings.
author: Erik F.

description: Four stars for the icecream sandwich...creme fraiche ice cream between graham cracker wafers. So good. And the cutest little candy shop you'll ever see. Way cuter than the ferry building location, but if all you want is a sweet treat, either location will do.
author: Mitsi T.

description: Forty bazillion types of salted black licorice.  Plus good service (I've been there many times and haven't had any service problems).  Boom! That's four stars in my world.  It would be five if their chocolate bars weren't so pricey.
author: Steve O.

description: Completely adorable, like a candy store should be.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
What a heavenly little shop to browse around -- it's really a place full of novelties to explore.

Not really there for everyday consumption -- if I treated myself to that quality level of sweets from day-to-day, life and other eats would eventually become lackluster.

My bf found a delightful gift for his mom, for only $5 -- Candy covereed dark chocolates delicately wrapped in colored cellophane and arranged in a cute little flower bouquet.  Apparently they're imported and hand wrapped by nuns in Italy. Amazing.

A great place for gifts, or for an occasional indulgence. I'm waiting to find an occasion to go back and buy that chocolate covered Scharfenberger chocolate cake for myself. yum.
author: Joyce C.

description:
Four stars for the pistachio macaroon. Four stars just for that.

And maybe also for the lovely lady with short hair, glasses and colored tights that is always happily ready to help you with whatever confection you need. NEED.

They also have children's parties that are so cute they will make you puke little lavender colored chocolate coated raspberry plum marshmallow nougat drops! Yum!
author: Sara R.

description: Awesome French macarons!  Love the Chocolate Lavender and Rose flavored macarons.  Found out today that they have ice cream sandwiches that look fantastic as well.  Will be returning to try one of those.  I also recommend the cupcake with the Italian meregue icing, delish!
author: K V.

description: I mail ordered and paid for 4 and only received 3 orders of the pink  rosettes that i thought would be perfect for my baby shower. When i contacted them via email and phone to see when they would complete my order they just ignored me and never responded to either. Very unprofessional. I do not recommend them AT ALL!
author: J A.

description:
I love miette!
it's so beautiful and everyone there is so nice.
every time I walk out I am either walking out with candy or a smile on my face. if there was 6 stars id give it 6
author: dylan g.

description: Simple, slice of high end fancy candy heaven!  A bit off the beaten path, but now that I have found it, it is on my beaten path.  There aren't a lot of firsts left for me, but I've never had a chocolate bacon bar before.  Surprisingly quite tasty, but the goji chocolate bar still holds my first vote.  I just can't wait to try their amazing looking cakes.
author: Todd R.

description:
huh.  it's adorable, no doubt.  i mean, like really fucking adorable.  the kind of adorable i wouldn't normally sully with profanity but who the fuck am i kidding?  sometimes a review just doesn't sound right without a sprinkling of choice four letter words.  i consider it to be my certain charm.  and you probably consider it to be really fucking gimmicky and annoying.  to you i say, touche!

so yes, adorable.  now on to the not so great parts also known as, THE TRUTH HURTS.  the selection at Miette is fairly sparse and the staff member i talked to didn't seem super knowledgeable about candy.  in general or in particular.  She sure knew how to completely ignore me and talk to the only other bitch in the place about how they chose the wallpaper for the store and also, her flat redecoration plans with her lubby hubby.  Cute!  When i asked (very sweetly asked, I might add.  Anyone who knows me will tell you that I am super charming adorable on the outside and all hell hath no fury inside.  but i digress.), "What's vegan?" she told me they had some licorice.  that's it.  i then went on to inquire, "are the dark chocolate malt balls vegan?" and she answered, "huh, i don't know.  they might say on the package in back."  AND THAT WAS THAT.  oh wait, no.  she told me that she was inclined to believe that they are vegan but wasn't sure.  she didn't offer to go look or extend any assistance in picking anything else out.  listen, bitch.  if you're going to sell this fat girl who is on a ridiculous candy time in candy town binge some powerfully overpriced sweets, you're gonna have to work a leeeeeetle harder.  And yes, I may be dressed like your friendly neighborhood bird lady but mama is packing a fire in her belly and some heat in her wallet.  and by fire, i mean an entire el farolito burrito and by heat, i mean a crisp ten dollar bill.  LET'S DO BUSINESS!  

anyway, i ended up picking out some goodies for my parents because god knows, they could give a fuck if dead baby panda was in their candy.  I chose a scrumdidiliumptious Charles' Chocolate Bar for myself because I am familiar with it and know it's vegan.  and i only know that because the smart and lovely folks at Chocolate Covered on 24th st tell you what's what when it comes to vegan chocolate.  or any chocolate for that matter because they are true candy lovers and their selection is infinitely better as i'm sure is the case with many other chocolate/candy shops in the bay area i'm just not familiar with them so i can't give you any names and in conclusion, BACK OFF LEAVE ME ALONE.

i would probably give this place two stars if it wasn't independently owned but i do have a soft spot for the little guy (or the waspy white lady, in this case) and i know it's expensive and very difficult to open a business so i really do hope they are able to stock their shelves with a bigger selection in the future and maybe employ some folks who are truly passionate about delicious candy.  at this point, i would only go back if i were in the neighborhood and in the mood to be ignored and um, wanted a piece of australian licorice.  that i can get at trader joe's for ten times cheaper.  

also, this might just be me and it probably is but i really don't like being sold candy by a skinny white b*tch...there is just something so false about it.  i want my candy lady to be plump, rosy cheeked and wearing a pink gingham apron.  call me a bigot but whatever.

Update: fuck it, one star.  I was harassed by the owner's f*cktard boyfriend for my review...further proving that customer service and Miette, they don't go hand in hand.  Oh and if you write a negative review of this place be prepared for an episode of, When Skinny White B*tches Attack.  Luckily, the brain needs fat to function so they are a feeble adversary.
author: Laura B.

description: The little rose flavored merengues are delightful.  Their macaroons are quite good too.  A fun place to appease your sweet tooth.
author: Danielle B.

description: It's very cute but overpriced & I found the clerk rude. She ignored me & then made me feel like I lived under a bridge. I swear I was clean. Snobby shop.
author: Fidel M.

description: eye candy is their forte cuz this is her performance art in action, but didn't care for the flavors or prices. go for the visuals on a lazy saturday....cinnamon marshmallow for $5 anyone?
author: miriam b.

description: mmmmm.... aztec chile salted dark chocolate, you stole my heart!
author: Liza P.

description: Charming Hayes Valley would not be complete without a confiserie (ie candy/ sweet shop) and Miette is a perfect fit. Step inside Miette and you will feel like you've entered Willie Wonka's chocolate factory, only better since there are other options besides chocolate. Treats here range from candy in jars to cupcakes and cookies. Everything is insanely cute, and you will find many tiny goodies already packaged in delightful boxes. The counter is filled with the baked goods- cakes, cupcakes and my all time favorite macarons. Gen opted for the cupcakes, as these nearly rivaled Delessio in terms of creativity. One of the chocolate varieties came topped with a soft meringue.  I of course went for an assortment of macarons- chocolate, strawberry, hazelnut, almond, and pistachio. We carried our loot wrapped in cute green boxes over to a cafe across the street to enjoy along side a cup of my all time favorite blue bottle coffee (which you will find tucked away on Linden street). Not a bad way to spend a lazy warm afternoon.
author: Kate A.

description: I first sampled Miette's fine edible creations on a trip to SF last year. I spotted their display of gorgeous cupckaes amidst the maddening crowds at the Ferry Building market. That tasting experience blew away all NY cupcakery competitors to date. Near perfection, in fact. So, to discover their candy store in Ha(Yes!) Valley (sorry, couldn't resist poking fun at one of the worst n'hood tourism campaign slogans ever) was like stumbling upon a free discography of Iron Maiden LPs as a teenager... or something similarly sweet. Michelle M. had already tipped us off, praising their licorice collection. There was chocolate, hard candy, petite baked goods, gummies, nuts, etc. - everything a good confiserie should stock - and they really love their products. A very friendly and knowledgeable staffer gave us a lengthy tasting tour of all 18 varieties of licorice on the wall. That took 15 minutes alone. It was tempting to extend the tour to the next section of the store, but we decided not to take advantage. It was hard to leave... everyone in the joint was smiling ear to ear, including us. But we bought our bag of goodies and headed out into the real, slightly less sweet world beyond their doors.
author: Dan B.

description: I ordered my wedding favors from Miette in Hayes Valley and they did a wonderful job.  I ordered different color malt balls and they packaged them in cute little bags with adorable bows.  When I picked up the favors they even included extra packages in case I need more.  Everyone at the store was helpful and patient and the malt balls were delicious!
author: Paula S.

description: I feel like I landed on the good ship lollipop! The chocolate covered gummy bears and chocolate covered espresso beans are especially dangerous. I will be making a trip here to buy my Valentine some treats!
author: Mama L.

description: if you dont know what to buy someone (me) buy them (me) something from here. semi sweet non parells, or fancy designer taffy and malt balls. dont bother wrapping it. it looks pretty just the way it is.
author: coffeecake j.

description: So maybe you think candy and other bonbons are too dear to spend frivolously on them. Then, you meet Miette, the sweet store promising the perfect blend of childhood sugar highs and mature, refined taste. You may be drawn by the confections from far away lands or the absolutely flawless, whispy yet substantially palette-pleasing shortbreads (as is for purists, or enhanced with walnuts, lavender, and other flavors for heathen) made fresh here. Either way, you know you'll be back, already rationalizing that the two-block walk to your car will burn off the indulgent calories.
author: Geo G.

description:
ohmygosh like umm heelllooOOo like this place is like sooOOooo good.
hahaha!
seriously. let me take this wig off...
ok. this place is delicious. its in hayes valley which AUTO makes it sweet (pun accidentally/not intended?!) cute shop with a very chic lay out. fancy candies line the walls in cool jars. center table with more treats. first thing i noticed though: the price. i was all "this is just a stick of chocolate I have seen at corner stores...but it costs 6 bucks here..." so i would not recommend buying the small candies. nowdontgetmewrong! there are some that are well worth the buy. i cant be specific right now but i recall my mother going "i havnt seen this candy in ages!" something stereotypical reminisce-y like that.
what i go for, are the macaroons and cupcakes...man i want one NOW. 
i have had the gingerbread cupcake with a cream cheese topping. the cream cheese was ultra rich. UltraMan status rich. thats rich, mind you. so cheesey but had JUST enough sweet to make it dessert level of cheese, feel it? cool.
very moist and very filling. it was so flavorful that it very much satisfied me once i was through. 
the macaroons come in an assortment of flavors. soft texture after you get passed the harder exterior (which is not a bad thing though it may sound bad? hmm) ive had the pistachio, rose, chocolate, and orange Macs from this place. a litttllleee pricey again. but the quality is wonderful and the shop is  just like WOW like sooOOooO cute! eeee! haahhhh.
check it out. 
hayes valley area is the b e s t.
bring cash.
author: Spencer P.

description: I can't believe this store actually sells their macarons -- they are so awful.  Macarons are supposed to light and soft, with a thin crispy shell and a slight amount of chewiness as you bite into the ganache filling.  These macarons are so chewy that it felt like I was biting into a candy bar.  The filling was also weak, which was very disappointing since I chose naturally strong flavors like grapefruit.
author: P B.

description: aside from the super cute store, the french macarons are the best in the city!  hazelnut macarons are delish!
author: J D.

description: miette is sucha  cute shop! everything is so visually appealing that my brain registered "satiety" and all i purchased was 3 macarons (instead of half the store). the grapefruit tasted strange, but the vanilla and hazelnut were delicious
author: Patricia S.

description: I love Miette, but unfortunately the only sad thing is it is so pricey that I can only find myself having one or two cookies without looking at my empty wallet. :( The service is great!
author: Jeannette L.

description: I know I'm not the type to spend $$$ on cupcakes and cookies, but when I went into this little shop and my friend raved about the cookies, I had to try some... and they were worth the hype! They look as good as they taste. I wouldn't necessarily go out of my way to get some candy here (their primary focus at this location) but for the limited number of pastries? Yeah. I'll do it. Unless I can get easy parking at the Embarcadero.
author: Erick K.

description: Licorice heaven!  Miette has two whole shelves of licorice jars, and you can mix & match in your little paper bag.  Most of them range from slightly salty to very salty, but you won't end up on bad-candy.com.  The staff is very helpful with descriptions and samples.  For something new, try the ones that look like a piece of schoolboard chalk.  Don't forget to pick up a postcard for your fridge door.
author: Matt B.

description: very cute with wonderful international candy and chocolate treats.  i do not go in there as often as i would like because i cannot seem to resist buying several items each time (i do not have a lot of will power and will eat all of those wonderful items when i get home).
author: n. h.

description: only bad thing i can say about this place is that i have to leave cole valley to get there...the original chocolate cupcakes with the marshmallow topping and boston-bean in it was outer-space like
author: Ron S.
